loans.name: Ejeh

texts.en: May happiness be with LAPO, says Mrs. I. Ejeh. She is 30 years old and has been a LAPO client for over 6 years. I. lives in Benin City, Nigeria, and runs a beauty salon. She believes that the requested US$400 will allow her to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more hairdressing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a new motorcycle

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa L. B. is 29 and has five kids. She raises pigs and will use this loan to purchase a cow to raise for milk production and to finance feed and care for the pigs. This is her first loan with Friendship Bridge, and like most of the women doing their first credit, it's a bit scary. It's stressful to think of those loan payments, but she decided to go ahead with the loan anyway. Her dream is to buy a few more calves and raise them. The remote village where she lives has lots and lots of pastureland, and the people make good use of it, raising lots of sheep, goats, and cattle. Teresa's picture doesn't show her animals because she pastures them more than an hour's walk away, and it was not practical to visit them.

Like many people in her area, money has been hard to come by. There have been times when there just wasn't enough and Teresa has had to borrow from her neighbors. She has successfully paid them back, though.

Teresa is a member of the women's group Nueva Vision, or New Vision. Most of the women in her group, even the younger ones, cannot read, write, or speak Spanish. They primarily stay with their traditional ways and speak their native Ixil language. Until very recently, almost all the houses in this remote village were made of wood, a very poor building material for this area, but now most are of concrete block and adobe. The change is that many of the younger men are now working in another country and they send money home to their families, enabling the families to improve their housing.

Interviewed by Juana Cedillo in the Ixil language.
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows.

loans.use: Purchase a calf and care for pigs

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
CATALINA and her husband work growing flowers. Their community is characterized not just by their handicrafts buy also their greenhouses, and the flowers they harvest (especially roses) are sold both within and outside the state. She is 37 years old, has three children, and is part of the solidarity group called Perla 1, along with Ms. Florentina Pérez Pérez (sales of fruits and vegetables). With their loans, Catalina will buy insecticides for the flowers, and nylon and wood to improve her greenhouse. Florentina will buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to supply her business.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

CATALINA junto con su esposo se dedican a la floricultura, su comunidad se caracteriza no solamente por sus artesanías sino también por sus invernaderos, ya que la cosecha de las flores (en especial las rosas) que se comercializa dentro y fuera del Estado. Ella tiene 37 años, tres hijos y forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Perla 1 junto con doña Florentina Pérez Pérez (venta de frutas y verduras). Con sus prestamos Catalina comprara insecticidas para las flores, naylo y madera al por mayor para hacer el invernadero, Florentina comprara una variedad de frutas y verduras para abastecer su negocio.

loans.use: FLOWER SALES

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
In a humble home in the district of Nuñoa, we find Petronila, who is very active and enthusiastic, showing her elegant and beautiful works that are made with extreme patience and care. This hard-working mother of four children has done this work for sixteen years. Year after year, she has improved and increased the quantity and variety of her production, on occasions with help from her beloved daughters. Presently she has a large amount of orders, but unfortunately she can't fill them all because she doesn't have enough raw material (alpaca wool) for the production of her beautiful art. This is why she is appealing to your help and requesting a loan that she promises to repay in six months. Let's help this adorable mother to keep performing her noble work efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En un humilde domicilio del distrito de Nuñoa encontramos muy activa y entusiasta a doña Petronila, mostrando sus elegantes y hermosos trabajos, realizados con suma paciencia y creatividad.Esta laboriosa madre de cuatro hijos está dedicada a esta noble labor hace 16 años, que año tras año fue mejorando y aumentando la cantidad y variedad de su producción, en ocasiones con apoyo de sus queridas hijas.Actualmente ella tiene gran cantidad de pedidos, pero lamentablemente no puede cumplir con todos, porque no posee suficiente materia prima (lana de alpaca) para la elaboración de su bello arte, es por esa razón que recurre a tu ayuda y solicita un préstamo que promete reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses. Ayudemos a esta adorable madre a que siga desenvolviéndose eficazmente en su noble labor

loans.use: Purchase of alpaca wool to keep producing beautiful woven goods.

loans.name: Zokhrab

texts.en: Zokhrab was born in 1966. This young man is married andhas 3 children. He lives with his family in Khachmaz town. Two years ago he decided to start his own business for supporting his family. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to maintain his car and improve his business.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Total 2083(A) Group

texts.en:
Alice is 32 years old and married with six children. She also cares for three dependants. Her business offers tailoring services. She wants to use the extra profits she earns to start a beauty salon and secure a plot of land. Pheobe sells fresh foods. Florence owns a small bar and wants to use the loan to purchase more furniture. Agnes sells charcoal and wants to increase her inventory.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines and improve the other businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria has been a member of the Banco Comunal Capulí for 8 years, where she has learned to be punctual, responsible and respectful.

Victoria lives with her partner, is 33 years old and has 4 children. She sells meat wholesale in market F. She buys the animals in the town of Sachabamba and sells their meat in the San Juan Bautista district. Furthermore she sells cheese as retail in the same market.

Victoria needs a loan of 2400 soles to invest in buying sheep, pigs and cheese.

She hopes that her children will grow up to become professional, and to have a car to travel to markets. She also hopes that her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí hace 8 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser puntual, responsable y respetuosa.

Victoria es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 4 hijos, Victoria vende carne al por mayor en el mercado F. Vivanco, los animales lo compra en el pueblo de Sachabamba y lo beneficia en el camal del distrito de San Juan Bautista. Además Victoria vende queso al por menor en el mismo mercado.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ovejas, cerdos, queso.

Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un carro para viajar a las ferias y que su negocio sea más grande.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 2400 soles to invest in buying sheep, pigs and cheese.

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.es:
Marianela and Erlinda have been members of the Sol Radiante (Radiant Sun) Community Bank for one year.

Marianela is single and 22 years old. She is a street vendor of sweets and sandwiches at Sucre Park in Ayacucho. She also sells apples during Holy Week, a period of high demand.

Erlinda lives with her boyfriend and is 26 years old. She has a small shop where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat. She also is an Anthropology student at the university.

Marianela and Erlinda need a loan of 400 soles each (about $150), which they will use to purchase pecans, rice and sugar.

Marianela’s dreams are to study at the university and expand her business. Erlinda’s dreams include finishing her studies and having a baby.

Translated by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Marianela y Erlinda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 1 año.

Marianela es soltera y tiene 22 años, Marianela vende golosinas y bocaditos de manera ambulatoria en el parque Sucre de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Marianela aprovecha la demanda y vende otros productos como manzanas en Semana Santa.

Mientras que Erlinda es conviviente y tiene 26 años, Erlinda tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carne. Además Erlinda estudia en la Universidad la carrera de Antropología.

Marianela y Erlinda necesitan un préstamo de 400 soles cada una, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pecanas, arroz y azúcar.

Los sueños de Marianela son estudiar una carrera profesional, aumentar su negocio, mientras que los sueños de Erlinda son terminar su carrera y tener un hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of pecans, rice and sugar

loans.name: Thị Cúc

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Cúc is 24 years old. She makes pork sausages. She is requesting 2.006.000 VND to buy pork. Her husband is furniture maker, he makes wooden tables and chairs. They have 3 young children. Their family income is 150.000 VND/day. She like SEDA's program because she can pay back the loan in installments. This is her second group loan, her first was successfully paid of. This is the same group but she is now the group leader so she could help/support other members.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Mến is 28 years old. She makes pork sausages. She's requesting 2.006.000 VND.
- Mrs N. Thị Hảo is 49 years old. She is requesting 2.006.000 VND to buy feed for her pigs.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Huế is 20 years old. She needs 2.006.000 VND to buy pigglets to raise.
- Mrs Nghiêm Thị Thanh is 28 years old. She sells basic goods. She needs 2.006.000 VND
- Mrs N. Thị Ty is 27 years old. She sells basic goods. She needs 2.006.000 VND

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị N. Thị Cúc (MS: 020034), năm nay 24 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thịt lợn về làm giò, chả bán. Chồng chị làm thợ bán bàn ghế bằng gỗ. Chị có 3 con còn nhỏ. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị 150.000 VND/ ngày. Chị rất thích tham gia vào chương trình vì được trả góp. Chị đã tham gia được một chu kỳ vay vốn và cả nhóm chị hoàn trả rất tốt. Lần này chị và cả nhóm tiếp tục tham gia kỳ II và chị đã xung phong làm nhóm trưởng để giúp đỡ các thành viên khác trong nhóm. Chị Nghiêm Thị Mến (MS:020032), năm nay 28 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để buôn bán giò, chả. Cô N. Thị Hảo (MS: 020033), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho lơn. Chị Nghiêm Thị Huế (MS: 02..35), năm nay 20 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua lơn về nuôi. Chị Nghiêm Thị Thanh (MS: 020036), năm nay 28 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán phế liệu. Chị N. Thị Ty (MS: 020037), năm nay 27 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua bán phế liệu.

loans.use: by pork to make sausages

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a businessman from Primorsk where he lives with his wife and a daughter. He sells groceries such as bread, sugar, candy, cookies and noodles in a small grocery store. Alexander can boast of high sales because his merchandise is regularly re-stocked and characterized by good quality. Presently, he is making about 4000 Ukranian Hryvnias each month. He has about 6000 Ukranian Hryvnias of turnover capital.

Alexander is very honest and polite with both his suppliers and his customers. It has helped him to gain a reputation as a trustworthy and friendly vendor and to build a solid client base. Alexander is applying for a loan of $550 US to re-stock his merchandise for the busy summer season and hopefully generate additional profit. He plans to invest the profits to open a new vending facility in the same neighborhood.

loans.use: To increase grocery store stock

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys and her husband formed their household with many dreams of offering love, unity and above all tranquility to their dear children. This is why they decided to work in seasonal sales, meaning that they acquire products according to the season or time of year that meet the needs of people and sell them at an affordable price. They buy wholesale in the cities of Desaguadero and Tacna, selling their items in the cities of Juliaca, Ilave and Ayaviri during fairs in the different village surrounding their city. In the cold season Gladyn also sells hats, clothing, and personal accessories and wishes to acquire bedspreads, sheets and blankets. It is for this purpose that she is requesting support with the hope of finding a helping hand among all of you.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer.

Gladys y su esposo formaron su hogar con muchas ilusiones de ofrecerles amor, unión y sobre todo tranquilidad a sus queridos hijos, por ello decidieron dedicarse al negocio de las ventas, pero por temporada, es decir, según la estación o época del año ellos adquieren productos acorde a las necesidades de la gente y los venden a precios cómodos. Ellos comprar al por mayor en las ciudades de Desaguadero y Tacna, comercializando sus artículos en las ciudades de Juliaca, Ilave y Ayaviri durante las ferias de los distintos pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad. Gladys, por temporada de frió, adicionalmente de vender sombreros, prendas de vestir, accesorios personales desea adquirir colchas, sábanas y mantas. Por ese propósito va su petición con la esperanza de encontrar en ustedes una mano ayuda.

loans.use: Investment capital for the purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Daniel P.'s Group

texts.en:
These are Daniel P. K., Fatmata S., Ramatu B. K., Moses K., and John S. S.. They are teachers at the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,700,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate needs and then repay it over a period of 10 months out of their monthly salaries.

Forty-one years old, Daniel P. K. would like to use his loan to pay school fees and other charges for his children. He is married with 6 children.

Fatmata S. will use hers to invest in a business. She is married with 3 children.

Ramatu B. K. is 39. She is married with 3 children. Ramatu will use her loan to pay her children's school fees and other related charges.

Moses K. too will use his to pay school fees for his children, while John S. S. will use his to purchase building materials.

loans.use: To pay school fees and other charges

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: G. Karim is 45 years old. He is married and has two children of school age. Karim is providing taxi services with his car. He has been in this business for about 3 years. It is the main source of income for his family. Karim is working hard. He gets up early and goes to bed late trying not to lose any clients. Karim has no higher education but he dreams that both of his children will get to go to university. He is planning to send his daughter to the university next year. Karim is planning to fix his car in order to provide higher quality service so that he can earn more income. He requests $1000 for the term of 9 months. With this loan Karim is planning to purchase spare parts for his car. Let’s get behind this dedicated father to make his dream become a reality.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for taxi

loans.name: Ilva Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Ilva habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de la ciudad de Managua,  tiene 30 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos de 2, 4,8 y 11 años de edad, dos de ellos están cursando la primaria, y los otros dos pequeño no estudian. El negocio de doña Ilva es una pulpería,  lo cual le permite velar por su familia, tiene ocho años de tener la pulpería. La cual empezó con la ayuda de su esposo, él trabaja en la alcaldía de Managua desempeñándose como conductor, y apoyado a su familia para optar a otros ingresos. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la compra de productos varios en la pulpería para ofertar a sus clientes, así como captar mas clientes y poder mejorar las ventas y fortalecer el negocio. A largo plazo  es poder obtener mejores condiciones en su negocio, como mayor inventario; mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos a estudiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ilva lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is 30 and married with 4 children ages 2,4,8 and 11. Two of the children are in primary school, the younger two are not yet in school. Mrs. Ilva's business is a local store which she has had for 8 years, which allows her to watch over her family. She started the store with the help of her husband, who works as a conductor for the City of Managua, in order to support her family with additional income. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of various products for the store to offer to her clients, to attract more clients, improve sales, and strengthen her business. Her long-term goal is to be able to improve her business, increase the inventory, improve her home, and support her children in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products for her store

loans.name: Hilmer

texts.es: Hilmer tiene 27 años, es soltero, actualmente vive con sus padres, pero hay temporadas donde viaja a la costa para estar pendiente de las tierras de cultivo que posee en esa zona. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, ya se en su pueblo o de lo contrario en la costa donde también se va a sembrar papa, comenta que para la siembra de este producto hay que tener suerte, porque el año pasado sembró en la costa, pero la papa no tuvo un buen precio. Pero esta vez el tubérculo tiene buen precio en el mercado, su actividad es sembrar y negociar porque trabaja con su capital 50% y el 50% con el banco. Le agrada lo que hace, porque cuando tiene un buen precio se dobla su capital. Es cliente por vez primera en MFP. Con el dinero solicitado primero comprará un insecticida denominad “rejin” que cuesta un aproximado 380 soles que le alcanza para dos hectárea de fumigado.
texts.en:
Hilmer is 27, single, currently living with his parents. Seasonally he travels to the coast to cultivate the farmlands that he possesses in that area. His entire life has been dedicated to agriculture. Whether in his town or on the coast, he already plans to sow potatoes. He comments that he needs luck to plant this crop because the previous year he planted on the coast, but the price for potatoes was low. But at this time tubers are bringing a good price in the market, so his job is to plant and negotiate, because he is working 50% with his own capital and 50% with the bank. He likes what he is doing, because when prices are good he can double his investment. He is a first-time client of MFP. With the money he is requesting, he will first buy an insecticide called "rejin" that costs approximately $125 to cover 2 hecatres with insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of insecticide for his farmlands

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim C., 40, a widow, is a resident of Svaypleung Commune in Kompong Tom Province. She makes different kinds of food to sell on her bicycle. She has been operating this business since 2000 and earns approximately $3 per day. She now lives with her mother, Mrs. Bun Pheng, 65, a Khmer noodle seller. Her mother helps her care for CChenghieng's three young children. In order to earn additional income. C. is requesting a $500 loan to buy piglets and foods for them.

(Mrs. C.'s mother and her daughter are pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: to buy the piglets and foods for them

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr.Victor González, tiene 43 años de edad, es padre de un  niño  pero  no está casado vive en  el barrio San José.

             Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar con su padre en la curtiduría, y hoy en día gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación al trabajo pudo independizarse.

                El cliente manifiesta que con el crédito comprará de cuero  fresco.
texts.en:
Victor González is 43 years old, has a son, is unmarried, and lives in the San José neighborhood. When he was very young, he started worked with his father in his leather shop and thankfully his efforts and dedication to this job has enabled him to support himself. Victor says that he will buy a new leather hide with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather hides

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba S. is forty eight years old.  She is married and has given birth to seven children - six daughters and one son.  She says that almost all of her daughters who have completed junior high school could not continue.  However, her son was able to go further and is now in the tertiary. 

Abiba’s husband is a commercial driver.  She lives with her children and husband at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Abiba works very hard to support her husband provide for the family.  She is a food vendor.  She cooks rice with stew.  Abiba sells on a table top at the local market.  She buys bags of rice from Kumasi.  She has been in business for over fifteen years. 

She wants to buy bags of rice on a large scale so that she can cut down on the cost of frequent trips to procure goods.  It is her dream to help her husband so that they can put up their own structure.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su propia casa. El negocio de Nora es la venta de comida, su puesto de ventas está ubicado en el paradero de una empresa de transportes y junto a una carretera muy transitada, lo que garantiza entradas seguras para ella. Cada día realiza el esfuerzo de levantarse en horas de la madrugada para preparar los alimentos, ya que vende desayunos y almuerzos a sus más exigentes clientes que en su mayoría son conductores de los vehículos que pertenecen a esa empresa de transportes. La comida que Nora hace es deliciosa y de buena la calidad, por lo que después de 20 años de haberse generado el sustento con este negocio, desea mejorarlo e incrementar las opciones de comidas y bebidas para sus clientes. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está deseosa de emprender un trabajo solidario con todos los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que está solicitando se implementará con lo necesario para vender jugos de fruta, comprará principalmente una licuadora, una máquina para exprimir y una extractora, con el resto de dinero adquirirá las frutas necesarias para emprender este nuevo reto.
texts.en:
Nora is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. Nora sells meals for a living. Her stand is located near a commuter stop and a busy roadway, which guarantees her a secure income. Every day she makes the effort to get up very early in the morning to prepare food since she sells breakfasts and lunches to very discerning customers, usually drivers who work for the nearby transportation companies. The meals that Nora makes are delicious and of high quality. After 20 years of supporting herself with this business, she would like to improve upon it and widen the selection of meals and beverages for her customers. This is her first loan with MFP, and she looks forward to joining all of the members of the communal bank in their solidary work. With the money that she is requesting, she will set herself up with the necessary items to sell fruit juices. First she will buy a blender, a juicer, and an extractor. With the rest of the money, she will buy the fruits she needs to meet this new challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Outfit her business for selling fruit juices

loans.name: Hermenigildo

texts.es:
El socio HERMENIGILDO; es natural de la comunidad campesina de Ccolcca, provincia de Quispicanchi – Ocongate; situada a 3, 900 m.s.n.m, esta a 4 horas en bus de la ciudad del Cusco.

El Sr: Hermenegildo, realiza trabajos en carpintería, hace puertas, marcos de ventanas, mesas, sillas, carpetas, entre otros, el tiene un pequeño volquete que le permite viajar a la selva de Perú en busca de madera para efectuar sus trabajos de carpintería, es el único carpintero en toda la población de Ccolcca,  el invertirá el préstamo en la compra de madera, para hacer la elaboración de puertas y marcos de ventanas de sus vecinos.

El socio agradece el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago en las fechas establecidas, el valora este préstamo, que le permite culminar con sus trabajos y de ese modo tendrá sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is a native member of the rural community of Ccolcca, in the province of Quispicanchi-Ocongate, which is located 3,900 meters above sea level. It is 4 hours by bus from the city of Cusco, Peru. Hermenegildo works in carpentry, making doors, window frames, tables, and chairs, among other things. He has a small dump truck which allows him to travel to the Peruvian jungle for wood to use in his carpentry projects. He is the only carpenter in the whole town of Ccolcca, and he will use this loan to buy wood, to make doors and window frames for his neighbors. He is grateful for the financial support and is committed to repaying the loan by the date specified. He values this loan, which will allow him to complete these projects and earn some money.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es:
Su negocio tiene como nombre “Centro D. Copias Albert” el cual se dedica a la reproducción D.  copias en blanco y negro, a colores, anillados, encuadernación (otros trabajos anexos a estos) D. libros o cualquier material bibliográfico

La socia inició su actividad económica con una sola máquina fotocopiadora; en ese tiempo no había negocios D. ese tipo y por enD. no tenia competencia. Es así como ella pudo ahorrar y comprarse un terreno. Por otro lado, algo que la ayudó mucho fue su prestación D. servicios a diferentes entidades tales como: la Comisaría, Biblioteca, Hospital, Municipalidad, dado que, están muy cerca a la ubicación D. su negocio y así es como fue incrementando sus ingresos.

Con doce años D. esfuerzo, tiene una estabilidad económica que le permite ayudar a sus padres  y contribuir con los gastos familiares. Es el único trabajo que tiene, pero sus planes para el futuro es tener otras máquinas fotocopiadoras y así dar oportunidad D. trabajo a otras personas.

Es una persona que se identifica con la alcancía, son muy unidas y es por ello que lleva 4 años dentro del grupo.

La ALCOM se formó en el año 2005. El asesor visitó a una D. la socias que conformaba alcancías antiguas y la animó a armar un nuevo grupo.

Es así como esta socia antigua fue comentándoles sobre los créditos a otras señoras y a su vez  ellas a otras, fue así que formaron la alcancía y la nombraron “Mujeres emprendedoras” por acuerdo D. todas; ya que se consideran mujeres luchadoras que pueden lograr sus objetivos a base D. esfuerzo y dedicación. Este grupo lo conforman nueve mujeres y un hombre. 

Durante el tiempo formado han tenido experiencias alegres y tristes ya que cuando se reúnen pueden compartir sus problemas personales y ayudarse entre ellas. Estas situaciones a ellas no las intimidan, D. lo contrario les ayuda a ser más unidas y solidarias.
texts.en:
This business is called "Centro D. Copias Albert" and is a copying business that offers black and white copies, color copies, spiral binding, and binding of books or other materials. This member started her busines with only one copier. In that time there weren't other business like this and she didn't have competition. This is how she was able to save and buy some land. On the other hand, something that helped her a lot was lending her services to different organizations like the police station, library, hospital, and the city. Given that these places are very close to her business, this is how she was able to increase her income. After twelve years of effort, she has a stable income that lets her help her parents and help pay the family's expenses. This is the only job that she has, but her future plans are to have other copy machines and employ other people. This group is very close, and she has belonged to it for four years. ALCOM formed as a group in 2005. The consultant visited one of the members that had belonged to another group previously and encouraged her to form a new group This is how the member of the previous group told the other women about credits, and they told others. They formed a group and called it, "Mujeres emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women), which was agreed on by everyone. They consider themselves fighters who can accomplish their objectives through hard work and dedication. This group is comprised of nine women and one man. During the time the group has been together, they have had happy and sad experiences, and when they meet they can share their personal problems and help each other. These situations don't intimidate them, but instead help them become closer and more supportive.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase another copy machine

loans.name: Alice Nalukwago‘S Group

texts.en: Alice is 32 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 2 months and 15 years. Four of her children go to school. She owns a six room house and takes care of additional family members. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day. Alice has a stall where she sells tomatoes and onions in lugala, one of Kampala city suburbs, and that is how she earns a living. She uses public transport to get to and from shopping. Alice receives about 15 customers a day and sells to all types of people. She works seven days a week and doesn’t pay rent charges as she works from her home. She has done this business for three years now.  This is her second loan since she joined MCDT and has been with MCDT for one year, working with the same group mates. Alice wants to use this loan partly to pay school fees for her children and also to buy boxes of tomatoes and onions. She aspires to one day go directly to farmers without involving third parties.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.es: Elisabeth tiene 28 años, vive en casa de sus padres, con ellos y su bebé recién nacido.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Desde hace un año se dedica a la  venta de comida al paso que son las salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas) y sándwich en una esquina cerca de su casa en horas de la tarde. Por las mañanas va al mercado a comprar los ingredientes frescos y prepararlos para la tarde, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hermanas en este proyecto pues su meta es acrecentar sus ventas obteniendo más clientes, hasta el momento Elisabeth está en camino de concretar su anhelo ya que cada día su clientela va creciendo. Es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida por haber sido invitada a formar parte de su banco comunal, donde se compromete a realizar un trabajo unido con las demás integrantes. El dinero que requiere lo usará en la compra de bancas y toldos para implementaran mejor el espacio de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elisabeth, 28, lives with her newborn baby and her parents in her parents’ house. For one year she has been selling street-food called “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes) and sandwiches. She sells on a corner near her house in the afternoon. In the mornings, she goes to market to buy fresh ingredients and prepares the food for the afternoons. He sisters help her. Her goal is to increase sales and get more customers. Elisabeth is on her way to making her goal a reality. Every day she has more customers. This is the first time she has asked MFP for a loan. She is very grateful to have been invited to be part of her community bank. She promises to work in a united way with the members. She will buy benches and awnings to improve her business space.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy benches and awnings for her business

loans.name: Tania Isabel

texts.es:
Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Tania es soltera y tiene 36 años, Tania tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende ropa variada, regalos, golosinas, cosméticos, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Tania hace manualidades.
Tania necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas y cartulinas.
Los sueños de Tania son tener una cadena de tiendas y equipar su tienda.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Communal Bank Tulipanes (Tulips). Tania is single and 36 years old. Tania runs a store in her home where she sells various clothes, gifts, sweets, and cosmetics; she carries out this activity every day. Tania also makes handicrafts. Tania needs a loan of 3,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of fabrics and cardboard. Tania dreams with owning a chain of stores, and stocking her current store.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and cardboard.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida tiene 32 años, vive con su hijo en la casa de sus padres. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa, su metodología de trabajo consiste en visitar las casas de sus vecinos y amistades ofreciendo sus prendas, las que luego cobra al crédito, y así obtiene mayores ganancias, ya sea en cuotas semanales o diarias. Cada mes, Zoraida viaja a otra ciudad donde se abastece de mercadería, adquiriendo principalmente lo que más demandan sus clientes, aparte de modelos nuevos para ofrecer. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal y quiere seguir trabajando de la misma forma, manteniéndose responsable en sus pagos. El dinero está solicitando será destinado a la compra de más prendas de vestir al por mayor.
texts.en:
Zoraida, 32, lives with her son in her parents’ house. She has been selling clothes for one year. The way she works is to visit her neighbors’ and friends’ houses and offer her garments. Then, she charges on credit; that way she earns more with weekly or daily payments. Each month Zoraida travels to another city to stock her merchandise. She primarily gets what her customers ask for; she also gets new styles to offer. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her Community Bank. She wants to keep working the same way, keeping herself responsible in her payments. The money is to buy more wholesale clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a tabletop at the lorry station in the mornings and evenings. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Veronica buys her goods from Kumasi and nearby communities. She has been in business for ten years.

Veronica is 44 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children: two daughters and two sons. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Veronica wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Uamsho borrower group . She is 37 years old, married, and a mother of six children aged 18, 15, 12, 10, 6, and 3 years. She also cares for two other dependents. Lucy started her own cafe selling food three years ago. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tsh.

This is Lucy's first loan from BRAC Tanzania, and she has requested the amount of 200,000 TZS to buy more commodities like sugar, wheat, and rice for her business. With the profit she will gain from the use of this loan, Lucy hopes to save money, pay school fees, get more food for her family, and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, wheat, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es: Guillermo Antonio H. D. reside en Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador. Guillermo vive con su esposa quien trabaja como comerciante, tienen tres niños todos menores de edad, Guillermo se dedica a su propio negocio es una tapicería donde se elabora variedad en muebles, con doce años de experiencia en la tapicería Guillermo a ganado la confianza y fidelidad de sus clientes, ya que los productos de Guillermo poseen excelente calidad, el crédito que solicita es para destino en capital de trabajo de la tapicería.
texts.en:
Guillermo Antonio H. D. lives in the city of Delgado in the district of San Salvador. He lives with his wife, who works as a merchant, and three dependent children.

Guillermo has an upholstery business in which he produces a variety of furniture coverings. With twelve years of experience, Guillermo has been able to gain the trust and loyalty of his customers. His products are of excellent quality. He is requesting a loan to be used as capital to invest into his upholstery business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for his upholstery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase food stuff

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es: Doña María B. tiene 62 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Fajas Típica Para Mujeres”, habita junto  a sus Hermanas, ella y sus hermanas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con el pequeño Taller de 3 Telares, lleva 18 años de Tejer   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chirijcaja del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Miss María B. is 62 years old and is single. She works in the weaving business, making typical belts for women. She lives with her sisters and they all work in the same business, in a small shop with three looms. She has worked for 18 years in weaving. She lives in the Chirijcaja area of Cantón Poxlajuj in the department of Totonicapán, Guatamala. Currently her clientele’s demand has increased, but her economic conditions aren’t enough for her to increase her capital. It’s for this reason that she came to the ASDIR association to ask for a loan with the intention of buying raw material to increase her sales. She is also hoping to help her family so that they will have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (purchase of raw material)

loans.name: Adriana Margot

texts.es:
Adriana es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de Alta Gracia, es conviviente, tiene 34 años, tres hijos de 15, 13, 5 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Adriana cuenta que sus padres no pudieron darle estudios porque ellos son diez hermanos, ella empezó a trabajar desde los 8 años en casa cuidando ancianos, personas enfermas, así trascurrió su vida, hasta que tuvo sus hijos se dedico a cuidarlos y al ver la necesidad económica se puso a vender ropa interior ofreciendo por su barrio y su familiares, hace dos años atras decidió vender productos de belleza por catalogo.  
En Finca ella aprendió la responsabilidad en los pagos, a ser más esforzada 
Adriana necesita 1000 soles para la compra de ofertas de cosméticos por catalogo.
El sueño de Adriana es que sus hijas terminen sus estudios del colegio y puedan continuar estudios superiores en un instituto.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of Bancomunal Virgen de Alta Gracia, she lives with her significant other, is 34 years old, and has three children, 15, 13, and 5 years of age, all students at the state school.

Adriana tells us that her parents couldn't afford to let her study as she has 10 siblings. She started to work when she was 8 years old at home taking care of elderly and sick people, and she did that until she had two children of her own to look after. But due to her ecomonic needs she started selling underwear in the neighborhood and to relatives, and two years ago she decided to sell beauty products from catalog.

With Finca she learned to be responsible with her repayments and to increase her efforts. Adriana needs 1000 soles to purchase the cosmetics offers from the catalog. It is Adriana's dream that her children finish their schooling and continue superior studies in an institute.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase offers from a cosmetics catalog

loans.name: Roselilian

texts.en: Roselilian is a 28-year-old entrepreneur and mother of one school-age child.  She and her husband live in Runyenjes, Embu, Kenya.  She began her current business of selling second-hand clothes and plastics in 2003.  She specializes in women’s clothing: skirts, dresses, casual and formal tops.  She periodically travels to Nairobi, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices.  The prime location of her business on a busy street, her many years of doing business and her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good clientele base.  Her customers return to her shop for her wide selection or to make requests for certain styles.  Roselilian plans to expand her business with her next loan of Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet sells crates of drinks at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more sales during and after the season. She hopes to become a major drink distributor in her community in Benin City, Edo State. She is 48 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a retired government worker. She has to sell for long hours to meet the basic needs and necessities of the family.  She hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Kenia Magdalena

texts.es: La joven Kenia V., prepara rica comida desde hace dos años, hace almuerzos para vender en zona franca, comida que vende al contado y al crédito con pago semanales. Cuando inicio las ventas lo hizo con fondos que su esposo dio y apoyo de una amiga logro comenzar a vender ropa, zapatos, y los encargo que el cliente hacia, pero las ventas en los últimos meses fueron pésima y no obtenía ganancia y con ropa que no vendía es por eso surge la necesidad de vender comida el cual cada día vende mas y es por eso recurre al financiamiento por que no cuenta con capital suficiente para hacer mas alimentos, el cual comprara: carnes, arroz, frijoles, lácteos, y frutas para preparar los alimentos y frescos.  Desde horas tempranas se levanta para hacer los diferentes menús con ayuda de su mama pues tiene que abordar una ruta para trasladarse a la zona a entregar la comida el almuerzo en hora exacta. Con este financiamiento quiere comprar más  platos, tazas cuchara entre otros, ya que ha aumentado sus ventas, en comida también comenzara a comprar ropa por que en este mes de navidad sus cliente le hacen encargo de ropa para sus hijos el cual da al crédito con la facilidad de pagar en varios pagos. Da las gracias A fodenic por el apoyo a mejorar su negocio el cual espera pronto ir ahorrando para tener su propia casa que es uno de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Kenia V. has been making delicious food for two years. She makes lunches to sell in the “Zona Franca” (a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua). She sells food for cash and for credit with weekly payments. She started her sales with funds that her husband gave her and the support of a friend. She was able to start selling clothes and shoes, and she had customer orders. But, sales in the last few months have been bad. She did not get income, and she had clothes that she did not sell. That is how the need to sell food emerged. Every day she sells more. That is why she turns to a loan. She does not have sufficient capital to make the food. She will buy meat, rice, beans, dairy products, and fruit to prepare the food and drinks. She gets up very early to make the different meals. Her mother helps her. She has to be en route to transport and deliver the lunch at the exact time. With this loan she wants to buy more plates, cups, and spoons among other things. Now that her food sales have increased, she will also start to buy clothes. In the Christmas month her customers order clothes for their children, which she gives them credit to buy with the ease of making several payments. She thanks Afodenic for their help in improving her business. She expects to soon be saving for her own house, which is one of her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more cups, plates, and spoons for her food and to buy various seasonal clothing

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: i hit my knee. it hurts.
texts.en:
i hit my knee. it hurts.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sdf

loans.name: Mrs. Tou Chuon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight people, and they all live in Roka Khpos village in Takeo province. Mrs. Tou C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a vegetable middle woman, buying in bulk and reselling.

Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more vegetables to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Tou C. is 48 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while another is a laborer. The others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To purchasing more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 40 years old and is married with four children, two of whom are at the university. Her husband is an electrician and he also supports the home. 

Joy owns a restaurant where she sells drinks and cooked foods to make a living. She is popularly called ‘Madam Joy’ by her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers.

Joy hopes to expand her business in the future. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: María Del Transito

texts.es: María del Transito C. D. R. D. 51 años D. edad, resiD. en Atiquizaya, ubicado en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo y cuatro hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar, y que son el mayor incentivo tanto para María como para su esposo. Ella se destaca por ser una madre D. familia muy responsable en todo lo que realiza, así mismo es muy amable y trabajadora. María posee un molino, en el cual muele frijoles, maíz, café y otros productos más. El negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa D. habitación, lugar en el cual muchas veces sus hijos le ayudan a atender el negocio, ya que María cuenta con muchos clientes, los cuales llegan a moler a diario el maíz para sus negocios D. tortillas y otro tipo D. alimentos. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar algunos repuestos para el molino y D. esta manera mantenerlo siempre en buen estado, así mismo desea poder extender su negocio vendiendo granos básicos, esto con el fin D. obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María del Transito C. D. R., 51, lives in Atiquizaya, Ahuachapán department. Her family is composed of her husband and four children, who are students and who are María and her husband’s greatest incentive in life. María is known for being a very responsible mother in everything she does; she is also very kind and hard-working. She has a mill where she grinds beans, corn, coffee and other products, too. The business is located in her home and her children help her out often because María has a lot of customers who come daily to grind corn for their tortilla and other food businesses. She is requesting funding to buy some replacement parts for the mill so that she can always have it in good working order. She also wants to expand her business and start selling basic grains in order to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains and mill replacement parts.

loans.name: Zenia Yojana

texts.es:
La joven Zenia S., tiene 27 años de edad, recibe ingresos por el Alquiler de dos Habitaciones
que  logro construir con el dinero que le dieron de su trabajo, ya que tuvo que retirarse porque salio embaraza y necesitaba tiempo para cuidar a sus dos hijos, esta casada con  Angel Flores, una persona trabajadora, es albañil de profesion, ella necesita el dinero para la compra de materiales para realizar mejoras a una habitacion y poder alquilarla y mejorar sus ingresos. Tiene un niño de nueve años el cual asiste a la Escuela y ahora con su bebe que tiene solo un mes de nacido. Zenia es una persona joven, muy humilde y con deseos de sacar adelante su familia. 
Su esposo se va encargar de realizar las mejoras y con eso se ahorran el pago de mano de obra.
con el credito acondicionara una parte mas de su casa para alquilarla y tener mas ingresos, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Zenia S., 27, earns income by renting out two rooms that she built with money she got from her employment when she had to leave it due to pregnancy. She needed to have time to care for her two children. She is married to Angel Flores, a hard-working person; he's a bricklayer by profession. She needs funds to buy building materials and supplies in order to make improvements to a room so that she can rent it out and improve her income. She has a 9-year-old son in public school and her one-month-old newborn. Zenia is a young, very unassuming person, who wants to see her family do well. Her husband will do the work on the room so that they can save on labor costs. She will use the loan to convert another part of her home to rental space so that their income will increase; she needs the profits to meet family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina, de 29 años, es una joven perseverante y sincera que vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, quienes son su razón de ser y su empuje diario.

Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de comestibles y bebidas, especialmente cerveza y gaseosas, productos que le proporcionan mayores ganancias, principalmente los fines de semana cuando su localidad acoge a personas de pueblos vecinos para compartir actividades sociales. A Cristina le gusta atender a sus clientes, aunque a veces es difícil cobrar cuando ha dado algo al crédito, pero igual se siente contenta de aportar para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Por otro lado, desde hace 8 años su esposo cultiva café, ya que su localidad es reconocida como una de las mejores zonas cafetaleras del país y el café que producen es de gran demanda por su exquisito sabor y aroma. 

Este el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, ella es una de las primeras en llegar a las reuniones que convoca la junta directiva de su banco comunal, porque le agrada compartir con sus compañeros. Con los mil quinientos soles que ahora solicita comprará los granos de café de sus vecinos, para luego venderlos al por mayor a una acopiadora de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Cristina is 29 years old and a persistent, sincere young woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children, who are her reason for living and the drive that motivates her every day.

For the past two years, Cristina has been selling food and beverages, especially beer and sodas. These products yield the highest returns, especially on the weekends when people from the neighboring towns gather to share in social activities. Cristina enjoys attending to her customers, even though it is difficult at times to collect payment whenever she issues credit, but nonetheless she is happy to be helping with the household expenses. Meanwhile, her husband has been growing coffee for eight years. Their community has been recognized for being one of the best coffee growing areas of the country. The coffee he produces is in great demand for its exquisite taste and aroma.

This is Cristina’s second loan with MFP. She is one of the first people to arrive at the meetings held by the Communal Bank directors because she enjoys sharing with the other members. With her loan of 1000 soles that she requested, Cristina will buy coffee beans from her neighbors so that she can sell them later wholesale to a buyer in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee beans to sell

loans.name: Nyameke

texts.en:
Nyameke B. sells fresh plantains in Jukwa. Nyameke has received a junior-high education. She is divorced and stays with her two children. 

Nyameke has been selling plantains for quite some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will enable her go to the farmers to buy and transport the foodstuffs herself instead of buying them on a retail basis. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her two children.

loans.use: To buy and transport plaintains directly from farms

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 50 años, separada de su esposo desde hace 28 años, tiene 4 hijos, pero vive con el  menor de ellos, en su domicilio propio fabricado de material rústico. Desde 30 años se dedica a la agricultura,  pero paralelamente prepara comida, negocio que vende en la casa de su hijo mayor. Sin embargo a ella le preocupa mucho, el no poder contar con la ayuda de su familia cada vez que trabaja en su chacra, por lo que tiene que contratar operarios para agilizar su labor. Dentro de estas dos actividades, lo que más le gusta es la agricultura, por que sabe que podrá obtener una buena recompensa durante la cosecha y eso le permitirá cubrir los gastos del hogar y sobre todo colaborar económicamente con sus hijos, que buscan un futuro mejor para sus nietos. Más adelante desea cultivar frutas cítricas, plátanos y paltas como hasta hoy, ya que espera tenerlos fértiles para heredarles a sus hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y está contenta de trabajar con su grupo comunal, porque se siente respaldada por sus compañeros en cada decisión que toma. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 10 sacos de fertilizantes, 8 latas de herbicidas, asimismo comprará trampas para la mosca, para evitar que afecten los cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old. She has been separated from her husband for 28 years. She has four children, and she lives with her youngest child. She lives in her own house, which is made of humble materials. She has been farming for 30 years. She also prepares food, which is sold in her oldest child’s house. Nevertheless, she worries a lot about not being able to count on help from her family each time she works on her farm. She needs to hire workers to speed up her work. Of her two activities, she likes farming the best. This is because she will be able to get a good reward during the harvest, which allows her to cover the household expenses. Also, above all, she can collaborate economically with her children who are looking for a better future for her grandchildren. Later on she wants to plant citrus fruits, bananas, and avocados. She hopes to have them fertile so that she can leave them to her children. This is her third loan with MFP. She is happy working with her communal bank she feels the support of her colleagues in every decision she makes. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy ten sacks of fertilizer and eight cans of herbicides. She will also buy traps for flies so that they do not affect the crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 10 sacks of fertilizers, 8 cans of herbicides, and fly traps

loans.name: Lubele North Amito Este Group

texts.en: A. Este is a hard-working business woman. She is 33 years old, married and has 5 children, 4 of whom go to school. She has been operating a charcoal selling business for two months so far. She is using the loan to purchase charcoal from villages to take to Pader trading center for sale. She is an encouraging business woman whose dreams are to build a home and to have a stable life with no displacements because of rebels.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mrs. Phang Vorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of eleven people living in Peam Reang Leu village in Kandal province. Mrs. Phang V. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Chorn Mouv, is a farmer who owns a half-hectare of land to grow crops to support his family. The problem is that the field has infertile soil and is far away from any irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Phang V. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She is the mother of eight children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a laborer, and the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Elizebeth

texts.en:
Elizebeth A. is currently in the business of selling bread and ice cream at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cakes and groundnut paste to sell. Elizebeth is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has 3 children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock cakes and groundnut paste to sell

loans.name: Juliver Gil

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; El socio vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

El socio es ÉL Sr. Juliver;   él tiene 27 años de edad, El socio es casado y tiene 1 hijo El socio se dedica al transporte, él tiene un auto y lo utiliza como servicio de transporte; Este socio es un padre amoroso y muy responsable el desea comprar su casita propia y dar una muy buena educación a su hijo y poder tener una excelente calidad de vida. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su auto.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank “Virgen Purificada – Angostura.” He lives in the Angostura district in the province of Saylla in the department of Cusco. The member’s name is Mr. Juliver. He is 27 years old and is married with one child. He works in transportation; he owns one car and uses it for transportation service. He is a loving father and very responsible. He wants to buy his own house and give a very good education to his son so that he can have an excellent quality of life. He is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his car. He values and is infinitely grateful for the loan since it allows him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. He promises to complete all payments on his loan in the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for his car

loans.name: Taumaia

texts.en:
Taumaia U. is 46 and married with 5 children (ages 12 - 22).  She plants and harvests taro to sell.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Taumaia needs a loan of 3,000 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or $167 per week) to continue to improve her business.

In 2007, Taumaia joined SPBD.  This is her 6th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Taumaia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan P., 37 years old, is from the village of Bonbon, Sagay, Camiguin Province. Susan is married and has three school-aged children.

To make a living Susan runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food and daily use products in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month.

In 2010 Susan joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A.  is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant  and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant.  Mary is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more chairs and tables to be used in the restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs for her little restaurant

loans.name: Felipe Alfaro

texts.es:
Felipe de 47 años, , vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), el tiene un taller de costura en la sala de su casa.  

Desde pequeño el veía a su papa coser ropa pero nunca pensó que el seguiría los mismos caminos del papa, cuando creció y por la falta de oportunidades comenzó con el negocio para solventar económicamente los gastos de su familia. Ahora el tiene su taller de confección en su casa trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm. 

Para poder incrementar su producción el quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y hilos, en el futuro quiere dar empleo y enseñar lo que sabe y con los ingresos construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
47-year old Felipe lives in the Perimetral de Guayaquil, a suburban area bordered by a salt water stream, where he runs a sewing business out of his home. As a young boy he used to watch his father making clothes but he never thought he would follow in his father’s footsteps. However, when he grew up, because there were few other opportunities, he started the business so he could support his family. Now he has his own sewing workshop in his home and works there from 8am to 9pm. In order to increase production, Felipe wishes to use the loan to buy fabric and thread. In the future he would like to employ other people and teach them what he knows. With the income he earns, he wants to renovate his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María es comerciante de ropa en un centro de compra Roberto huembés inicio hace trece años con apoyo de su esposo, hoy en día su hijo mayor la sigue ayudando para mantener en equilibro en el negocio.
El modulo es alquilado, paga agua y luz por aparte, pero se vende, hay días buenos y días en que se vende poco.
Opto al financiamiento para aumentar el inventario y comprar mayores cantidades y así poder comprar variedad de ropa, el cual ha logrado la captación de clientes. Sus planes es seguir con su venta de ropa ya que es su medio de sobrevivencia.
Lo que comprara: ropa de damas juvenil,  ropa interior de dama, en variedades de colores y estilos, lo cual espera que sus ventas mejoren. Y poder cubrir pagos de la joven que le ayuda a vender como sus gastos.
texts.en:
Ana María sells clothing in Roberto Huembés shopping center. She started her business 13 years ago with the help of her husband and today continues running the business with the help of her oldest child. The store space is rented and she pays water and electricity bills separately. Ana María sells everyday, but there are good days and bad days. She opted for financing to increase inventory and the variety of her products, which will help her gain more customers. Ana María plans to continue her clothing business, as it is her main source of income. She will buy clothing for younger women and women's underwear in a variety of colors and styles, in the hopes of improving sales and covering the salary of the young woman who works for her as a sales assistant.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various women's clothing, such as underwear, to increase sales.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
El Sr. Vidal D., es soltero de 36 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Capiatá km. 21, barrio Loma Ybate. 
Es comerciante, confeccionista y costurero desde hace más de 20 años y hace  2 años que se independizó y posee su propio taller de confecciones con el nombre de Power Confecciones. 
Cuenta con dos máquinas rectas industriales y una overllock de 5 hilos y con el crédito otorgado por la Fundación Paraguaya adquirió una cortadora con mesa, la cual le genera más ganancias ya que no tiene que estar pagando a terceras personas para realizar el trabajo de corte, además posee una clientela bien formada la cual se encuentra muy satisfecha con la producción del Sr. Vidal.
 Con la producción propia el Sr. Vidal puede acceder a un precio mucho mejor el cual le posibilita a aumentar sus ventas y de esa manera incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El Sr. Vidal comenta que se encuentra muy agradecido con la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza depositada en su persona con el préstamo otorgado.  
En esta ocasión el solicita un préstamo para la compra de una mesa con cortadora ya que le facilitara mucho el trabajo además de agiliza por que con esta herramienta el podrá cortar en una ves gran cantidad de moldes para coser.
texts.en:
Vidal D. is a single 36-year old man. He lives in Capiatá, in the Loma Ybate district. He has been a retailer, tailor and cutter for more than 20 years. Two years ago, he set up on his own and now runs a tailoring workshop called Power Confecciones. He has two industrial sewing machines and a 5-thread overlock machine. He also purchased a table cutter with a loan granted by the Fundación Paraguaya, and this increased his profit margin because he doesn't have to pay a third person to do the cutting-out work. Vidal also has an established client base that is very satisfied with his work. By producing the clothes himself, Vidal can offer a much better price, allowing him to increase his sales and therefore his profits, and improve his standard of living. Vidal says he is very grateful for the trust the Fundación Paraguaya has shown in him by granting him the loan. Now he is requesting a loan to buy a cutting table. This will make his work much quicker and easier because it will allow him to cut a large quantity of sewing patterns at once.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a special cutting table.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G., from the village of Panalsalan, is 39 years old, married, and has two grown children. To make a living, Merlyn has been planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale for over six years, earning approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is now requesting her ninth loan for 50000 PHP to pay for services to increase crop yield. Merlyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Merlita's Group

texts.en:
Merlita I. is from the village of Sinippil, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 47 years old, single, and the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. To make a living, Merlita operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She is just starting this business.

In 2010, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her food products. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make food products for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the village of Brgy. La Torre North, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Erlinda is married and has two adult aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo, de 27 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro, aunque para eso tenga que trabajar muy duro. En la ciudad de San Francisco las cabinas de Internet más visitadas son las de Eduardo, su carismática forma de atender, junto a los juegos en red que ofrece y sus precios más bajos que los de la competencia, han hecho que tenga mucho clientes, los cuales han hecho crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y lo hace con mucha paciencia y amabilidad, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en sus cabinas todo el día, abriendo desde muy temprano, hasta muy altas horas de la noche. Con el tiempo, desea mejorar las instalaciones de sus cabinas de Internet, para poderle brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, planea comprar una computadora nueva, para incrementar el número de servicio de Internet.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 27, is a cheerful, hard working young man.  He lives in his parents’ house and what he most wants is to forge a good future for himself even if that means having to work very hard.

Eduardo’s Internet access booths are the most popular ones in the city of San Francisco.  His charismatic customer service and the games he has available on line as well as having prices lower than his competitors have resulted in his having many customers who have made his business grow and improve his income.

What he likes best about his work is customer service, something he does with much patience and kindness.  He has been in business for two years and considers the most difficult part of the job having to stay at his booths all day opening very early and staying open until late at night. In time he’d like to improve his Internet access booths in order to offer better service to his customers.

This is his second loan with MFP.  He knows that this will be a significant factor in his business’ development.

He is a very responsible member of his communal bank which makes him be quite highly respected.  He will use the 2000 new sol loan to buy a new computer to increase the number of Internet access units.

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Manos Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
MANOS TRABAJADORAS – KIVA   

Carmen tiene 44 años de edad tiene 1 año siendo presidenta de la Alcancía comunal “MANOS TRABAJADORAS”, esta Alcancía tiene 3 años, de estar formada y actual mente esta conformado por 10 personas que le brindan todo el apoyo que necesita, Carmen Como presidenta los miembros de la Alcancía comunal se unieron a través de ser vecinos y hasta la fecha  tienen 3 años trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad.                 
Carmen es madre casada tiene 2 hijos q son dependientes la señora tiene ya 9 años trabajando en  un puesto de golosinas en un colegio y también vende productos de belleza hace 3 años la señora Carmen es una persona trabajadora q a sabido sacar adelante a su familia junto a su esposo, ella quisiera un capital de trabajo extra para surtir, mejorar y agrandar su negocio para poder salir adelante como la persona trabajadora q se considera
texts.en:
Manos Trabajadoras – Kiva

Carmen is 44 years old.  She has been president of the “Manos Trabajadoras” community bank for one year.  This group has been together for three years and currently has ten members who provide it with all the support it needs.  The members of the group came together as they are neighbors and, to date, they have been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for 3 years.

Carmen is a married mother who has two dependent children.  She has been working in a candy stall in a school for 9 years.  She has also been selling beauty products for 3 years.  She is a hard-working person who has known how to get her family ahead in life, together with her husband.  She would like extra working capital to stock, improve and expand her business so that she can get ahead in life as the hard-working person she considers herself to be.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit M. is 59 years old, married, and has three adult children. Anahit worked at Ijevan High School as a teacher until she retired on a pension. In 2001 she and her husband organized their own business in a rented space. This business consists of food and mixed product sales. During these years they have built up their own shop and have bought furniture for their house. Anahit’s shop has a reputation in Ijevan of having the cheapest products for retail and wholesale purchasing. 

Thanks to her first Kiva loan Anahit increased her shop assortment, which allowed her to have a good income. This permitted her and her husband to repair a part of their house and to add a story to their shop, which is situated in their house’s yard. Anahit and her husband are also managing a gift shop in the new addition.
