Anahit is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 AMD to buy food wholesale and New Year’s gifts for her shop. With future income she intends to complete her house construction.  This is Anahit’s sixth loan from Nor Horizon and her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase food wholesale and New Year’s gifts for her shop

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Asunción; ella tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con la crianza de animales como cuyes, conejos y aves, la socia lo distribuye a sus clientes de forma ambulatoria de  preferencia a los restaurantes y clientes que le solicitan de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas  animales y para la comida de estos mismos como maíz, pasto entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the community bank named "San Valentin". The bank is located in the district, province and region of Cusco. 

Her name is Asuncion. She is 42 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. She raises livestock such as guinea pigs, rabbits, and foul. She distributes her products to clients from door to door, giving special attention to restaurants and clients who have placed orders. This is how she is able to support her family. 

She requests a loan to purchase more livestock and to purchase food for them such as corn, hay, etc. 

She is happy to receive this loan and she is committed to the payment terms.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 55 años, es viuda, y vive en compañía D. sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta D. productos básicos para la comida, desD. hace 4 años que posee una tienda en donD. ha logrado tener experiencia en el comercio, ya que desD. un inicio incursiono en esta actividad D. manera ambulante y distribuyendo sus productos a otras ciudades. En la actualidad su tienda se encuentra instalada en el interior D. su casa y en donD. sus hijos la ayudan en la atención. Su establecimiento abastece con productos D. primera necesidad a sus vecinos que gustoso consumen en su establecimiento debido a  al buena atención que ofrece  y esto hace que su negocio sea la preferida ante la competencia. Ante esto continuará esforzándose en incrementar el capital D. su negocio con más productos. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería en productos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old, a widow, and lives with her 5 children in her own home.  Her business is selling essential food products.  She has owned her store for four years and has gained a lot of experience in selling.  When she was just starting out in the business, she used to make her sales as an traveling saleswoman, distributing her products to other cities.

Currently, Yolanda's store is located in her home and her children help her to serve in it.  Her establishment supplies essential household products to her neighbors who happily buy from her thanks to the good customer service that she offers.  This makes them favor her store over the competition.  Yolanda will continue working hard to increase her business capital with more products.

This is Yolanda's eighth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always shown herself to be responsible in making her loan repayments.  Yolanda likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She would like to thank those people who will help to fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest the loan money in buying more merchandise, more essential household products.

loans.use: To buy more essential household products

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Mrs. Nilda V. is 42 years old and lives in Burgos, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with three children. Her husband is a farmer and they own a little parcel of land. Although it is her husband who cultivates this land, gardening has also become her own primary activity. It began as a back-yard gardening project and eventually led to selling a few of her garden vegetables during market day. 

She’s thankful to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for providing them with financial assistance in the past. She is now applying for PHP 14,000 to buy farm pesticides and fertilizers for her garden. She also wants to buy a cow. 

She has many plans for the future. One of her dreams is that someday, she will be the one supplying vegetables in the market.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy farm pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en:
Komiljon is married and lives in Kabodien where he operates his own store selling household goods. He has been in this business for 15 years now. Because of his determination and customer-friendly attitude, his venture has been very successful. Komiljon currently needs a loan of $3,000 USD to increase his turnover capital. He believes that this loan will help him re-supply his inventory and encourage more customers to come and shop in his store. Increased sales, in turn, will generate the necessary funds to sustain the business as well as help him meet his family’s needs. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
Noemy pertenece al banco comunal “Los Solidarios” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Noemy, tiene 37 años de edad y tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Cusco y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Noemy es docente y trabaja contrata en distintos colegios, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para estudiar una maestría o hacer una segunda especialización.
texts.en:
Noemy is a member of the communal bank “Los Solidarios” ["The Ones with Solidarity"] of the Arariwa Association. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule. 

Noemy is 37 years old and has three children. She was born in the city of Cusco and currently lives in the city of Urubamba. Noemy is a teacher, and she works on contract at different schools. At this time, she needs a loan to study for a master's degree or take on a second specialization.

loans.use: To study for a master's degree or take on a second specialization

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie Q. is from the village of Kabatangan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 28 years old. Marjorie is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Marjorie owns & operates a motorela or habal-habal service with as her husband as the driver to local community members. Marjorie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marjorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marjorie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Marjorie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Marjorie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the transport service.

loans.name: Hector De Jesus

texts.es:
Hector de Jesus A. P., TRABAJA COMO fontanero, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA  DE TRES HIJOS Y ESTOS SE ENCUENTRAN EN EL COLEGIO, EL ACUDE A CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: zinc y perlines PARA reparar el TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION ES SU PRIMER PRESTAMO CON CEPRODEL.
A GRADECE A CE`PRODEL POR EL APOYO BRINDADO YA QUE ESTE FIANANCIAMIENTO VEIENE A YUDAR PARA QUE SU FAMILIA VIVA EN MEJORES CONDICIONES CON UNA VIVIENDA MAS SEGURA.
texts.en:
Hector de Jesus A. P. is a plumber. He is the father of a family of three children, all of whom are in school. He has approached Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) to request a loan to purchase construction materials such as zinc and beams to repair the roof on his house. This is his first loan with Ceprodel.

He is thankful to Ceprodel for the support they have given him. This loan will help him provide his family with better living conditions and a safe home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as zinc and construction beams

loans.name: Toussaint K.

texts.fr: Monsieur Toussaint D. habite à Dalifort. C’est un célibataire qui a en charge un enfant. C’est un opérateur conseiller pour le plateau de Tigo. Il exerce ce métier qu’il a choisi par amour mais aussi dans le souci de se procurer des revenus. Monsieur D. est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis mai 2010. Il n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour financer un besoin social (baptême). Ce financement lui permettra de régler  un problème ponctuel.
texts.en: Mr. Toussaint D. lives in Dalifort. He is not married, but takes care of a child. He is an operator consultant for the cellular service provider, Tigo. He chose this profession because he loves the work, but also with the goal to make good money.  He has been an associate of the Yoff office since May 2010.  He has never received a loan before.  He is requesting a loan of 150,000 cfa francs to pay for the child's baptism. The loan will enable him to take care of a this one-time problem.

loans.use: to pay for the baptism of his child

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly V. is 31 years old and a resident Prey Chor of Kompong Cham province, where she earns a living raising ducks in a pen behind her house. She raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. She is married with one child who is enrolled in the local school. Her husband’s name is Sokny and he works with her in the business. 

Ly V. has applied for a $1100 loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional duck-feed for duck growing. She will use the remainder of the funds to buy a used motorbike for transportation needs in her family. Ly V. is in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase duck-feed and buy a used motorbike for transportation needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, shirts and sweaters

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia  El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos independientes.   Estudió hasta 3ro de educación primaria.
Juana es una socia nueva que recientemente ingresó al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de quesos, dos sacos de harinas, azúcar, aceite, para su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de picarones (dulce peruano). Cuenta que todos los días vende en el mercado de Ilave en un triciclo de forma ambulatoria.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando en el negocio y generar más ganancias..
Lo que le  gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “3 de Mayo” (May 3) communal bank located in Ilave District, El Collao Province and Puno Department.  She is 55 years old and the single mother of two independent children.  She completed third grade.

Juana is a new client who recently joined the Manuela Ramos Movement.  She will ask for a 500 new sol loan to buy cheese, two sacks of flour, sugar and oil for her business.  She sells “picarones’ (Peruvian sweet).  She relates that she sells every day in the Ilave market as a peddler using a three-wheeled cart.  Her dream is to stay in business and generate more profits.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to buy cheese, two sacks of flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
La señora Felicia es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, 
tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Cuenta con un pequeño negocio rodante (ambulatorio) de venta de bebidas, galletas y biscochos, donde sus principales clientes son los camioneros quienes descansan cuando llegan a la ciudad.  Dedica gran parte del día en la atención de su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 5 paquetes de agua mineral sin gas, 2 paquetes de agua mineral con gas, 4 paquetes de gaseosa inca cola, 2 paquetes de coca cola, 2 paquetes de guaraná, 2 cajas de galletas, 2 bolsas de biscocho, 2 paquetes de frugos,3 paquetes de bolsa , 1 paquete de sorbete, 1 ciento de vasos descartables.
Con estos productos abastecerá nuevamente su negocio, debido a la situación actual del país las cosas han subido de precio y los negocios han caído en sus ventas, pero Felicita continúa con su trabajo con la esperanza de crecer cada día más. 
Con Manuela Ramos ve la oportunidad de poder seguir trabajando y no dejar caer su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicia is a member of the “Mujeres Del 2000” (Women of 2000) communal bank in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She is 45 years old, married and has three children.

She has a small rolling (ambulatory) business selling beverages, cookies and cakes where her main customers are truck drivers seeking a bit of respite when they arrive in the city.  She spends a large part of the day tending to her business.

She will use the new, 2000 new sol, loan to buy: 5 packets of flat mineral water, 2 packets of sparkling mineral water, 4 packets of Inca Cola, 2 packets of Coca-Cola, 2 packets of Guaraná (soft drink), 2 boxes of cookies, 2 bags of cake, 2 packets of Frugos (fruit juice), 3 packages of bags, 1 packet of drinking straws and 100 disposable drinking glasses.

She will stock her business again with these products.  Because of the current situation in the country, prices have risen and sales have dropped in businesses but Felicia continues working in hopes of growing more each day.  With Manuela Ramos she sees the opportunity to continue working and keeping her business from failing.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, mineral water and juices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Noroy

texts.en:
Noroy is an entrepreneur from Istaravshan. She lives there with her husband and two children. 

Noroy sells children's clothing. All the merchandise she offers for sale in her business is trademark quality at affordable prices. 

When Noroy launched her enterprise 20 years ago, it was pretty basic. However, she has consistently increased her clientele and the assortment of discount clothing imported from neighboring cities. 

Noroy is seeking a loan of 7,500 TJS to add to her stock and meet the growing demand for clothing. At this point, one of her business goals is to find reliable and accountable suppliers to partner with. 

Noroy has already repaid six loans to IMON International without any delinquencies. We believe her outstanding credit history and willingness to strive for higher goals will help her repay the current loan and reach success in her business.   
  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz, vive con su hija, es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de gallinas, frutas y algunas verduras, tiene 20 años de dedicarse al negocio, posee experiencia y las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante.
Actualmente Luz solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras, pues quiere aumentar el negocio,  su compra será en sandias, jocotes, pepinos, para continuar ofreciendo a sus clientes las frutas complaciendo sus gustos.
Su objetivo es que a través de financiamiento pueda crecer y aumentar sus ventas, también ayudar a su hija para que pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Luz lives with her daughter.  She is a single mother who sells hens, fruit and some vegetables.  She has been in business for 20 years.  She has experience and makes her sales as an itinerant vendor.

Luz is requesting this loan to buy fruit and vegetables as she would like to increase her business.  She will buy watermelons, jocotes (hog plums) and cucumbers so that she can continue offering fruit to satisfy her customers.

Luz' goal is to use loans to grow her business and increase her sales.  She would also like to help her daughter to do well in life.

loans.use: to buy fruit and veg (watermelons, jocotes and cucumbers) for her business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La joven Margarita tiene la edad de 19 años, estudio hasta el tercer semestre de preparatoria y es soltera, actualmente vive solo con su mama y nos platica que hace dos años cuando su papa murio ella tubo que ponerse a trabajar y dejar la escuela para poder sacar adelante a su mama asi que decidio abrir una pequeño negocio inicio vendiendo refrescos y galletas y poco a poco con sus ganancias, inicio a invertir en la compra de abarrotes y asi poco a poco ha logrado que su negocio continue creciendo.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, papel higenico, azucar, sal, regrescos, dulces y galletas para resurtir su negocio.
Ella dice que esta trabajando muy fuerte ya que desea en un futuro su tienda cresca mas y tenerla muy bien surtida para que sus clientes siempre encuentran lo que buscan y tambien poder sacar adelante a su madre.
texts.en:
Margarita is 19 years old.  She studied as far as the third semester of high school.  She is single and currently lives with her mother.  She tells us that two years ago, when her father died, she had to leave school and start working in order to support her mother.  So she decided to open a small business. 

She began by selling soft drinks and cookies, and little by little started to invest her profits in buying groceries.  In this way, little by little she has managed to keep her business growing. 

She needs this loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, toilet paper, sugar, salt, soft drinks, candy, and cookies in order to re-stock her business.  She says that she is working very hard, since she wants her business to grow even more in the future. She wants to keep it very well stocked so that her customers always find what they are looking for and so that she can support her mother.

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Rosa Amparo

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas de Agua Fría.

La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene  40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 18, 11 y 10 años los cuales estudian en  escuela, colegio y Universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que siempre ha estado al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y de su hogar, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura tiene cultivos de limón y de sandias, él junto a otra persona a quien le pagan un sueldo son los encargados de trabajar y de recoger los frutos para luego venderlos a comerciantes, los cuales llevan la fruta a distintos mercados de la ciudad.

Quiere utilizar el crédito para comprar un lote de terreno en el cual espera sembrar limón y así en el futuro poder cosechar esta fruta la cual en temporadas se vende a muy buen precio.
 
Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos estudian y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Damas de Agua Fría” (Ladies of Agua Fría) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Ayacucho parish in the Santa Ana canton.  It is a place that is known for its beautiful fresh water thermal baths, which are a great tourist attraction in the canton and the same province.

Rosa is a founding member of the Communal Bank.  She likes it because the interest is lower than in other lending institutions.

She is 40 years old, and she is in a common-law- marriage.  They have three children; ages 18, 11, and 10.  The children go to elementary school, high school, and the university.  Her husband is a farmer.

She is a very good housewife.  She has always been up to date on her children’s needs and those of the household.  Her husband is a farmer, and he grows lemons and watermelons.  He pays a salary to another person, and together they are in charge of the work and collecting the fruit to sell later.  They sell to merchants who take the fruit to different markets in the city.

She wants to use the loan to buy a plot of land where she hopes to plant lemons.  That way, in the future, she will be able to harvest this fruit, which sells for a very good price in season.

Her dreams are to see her children go to school and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 64-year-old widow with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, oil and spices. 

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries. 

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Maríap's Group

texts.es:
Maríap's Group está conformado por 4 mujeres, del cual María es la presidenta.

María tiene 49 años es soltera pero tiene 5 hijos, vive en Pujilí a media hora de Latacunga. María se considera una persona amable, carismática, le gusta hablar mucho con la gente y es muy felíz.

María trabaja en la crianza de animales, trabaja con Fodemi por 3 años, el actuál crédito que solicita es para la compra de terneros para su crianza y reproducción lo cuál le dará muchos ingresos con sus futuras ventas y así podrá dar la educación a sus hijos.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un gran negocio de ganado.
texts.en:
Maríap's Group is made up of four women, and María is the president.

María is 49 years old and single, but she has five children.  She lives in Pujilí, half an hour away from Latacunga.  María considers herself to be a friendly and charismatic person.  She likes talking with people, and is very cheerful.

María works raising livestock.  She has been working with Fodemi for three years.  The current loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of calves which she will raise and breed, providing good income with their future sale.  In this way, she will be able to provide her children with an education.

Her dream is for her children to become professionals, and to have a large livestock business.

loans.use: to buy calves for raising and breeding.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 42 years old, married.  He lives with his wife and five children.

Ali is a blacksmith; he opened his own shop in 2009.  He sells and makes metal doors, windows and frames.  He has a good experience from his previous work, and has a good reputation.  He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to renovate his shop and to pay the annual rent.  He is aiming to increase profits to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: In order to renovate his shop and to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions and sugar.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng is 50 years old with eight children. Her youngest child is still in school. She has been a tailor for 10 years. She also does rice farming. This is her first loan with VisionFund. With this loan, she hopes to increase her daily income from tailoring work, to increase her crop yield, and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a power machine for her tailoring work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn and her husband are rice cultivators. This couple is living with their 4 single children in Phnom Penh city. Agriculture is her sole income. Together, they generate an average of 2.50 USD each day to support the family. One of her daughters also helps in earning income by working as a garment factory worker and she gets her monthly salary the same as other workers. 

With the 250 USD loan she has applied for from Kiva, Mrs.Thorn will be able to pay for laborers working in her rice field. With the rest of this fund, she will add to her own money to partially repair her house. With the increase in income, she plans to save for her business expansion, buying extra farmland for growing rice crops.

loans.use: to pay for laborers working in her rice field and partially fix her house

loans.name: Vardan

texts.ru:
Вардану 29 лет, он проживает в Ванадзоре. Вардан не женат и живет с родителями. 
У Вардана высшее инженерное образование, но он никогда не работал по своей специальности. Уже 2 года Вардан занимается распространением кофе, сухих завтраков и сладостей. Он покупает товары в Ереване и сдает их в магазины города Ванадзора и деревень Лорийского марза. У Вардана есть небольшой грузовой автомобиль, с помощью которого он перевозит товары из Еревана в место сдачи товара в Ванадзоре и деревнях. Благодаря своему небольшому бизнесу он содержит семью. 
Вардану требуется кредит на сумму 500.000 драм для приобретения зимних покрышек для своего грузового автомобиля и для его небольшого ремонта.
texts.en:
Vardan is 29 years old and lives in Vanadzor. He is single and lives with his parents. Vardan has a college degree in Engineering but he has never been able to work in his profession. Instead, for the last two years Vardan has been running a grocery delivery service. He purchases coffee, cereal and sweets in Yerevan and resells them to stores in Vanadzor and the villages of the Lori region. Vardan owns a small delivery truck which he uses to transport the goods from Yerevan. This small business allows him to support his parents. 

Vardan would like to take out a loan of 500,000 dram to purchase winter tires for his truck and to make small repairs to the vehicle.

loans.use: To buy winter tire casings for his truck and also to dye his truck

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон разведен и сам воспитывает двоих детей. Он занимается купле - продажей скота и имеет хороший опыт. Он начинал свой бизнес с малого оборота денег. Он хочет, чтобы его дети выросли образованными и воспитанными людьми. Рахмон запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Рахмон надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас  за ваше милосердие и доброту.
texts.en: Rahmon is divorced and is raising two children on his own.  He is involved in buying and selling livestock and has good experience in this field.  He started his business with a small revolving capital.  Rahmon wants his children to grow up to be educated and well-mannered people.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to expand his business.  Rahmon relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your mercy and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en:
Sarantsetseg is a 33-year-old woman who lives with her mother and three younger brothers in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure near Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Sarantsetseg's brothers attend local universities and high school. 

Sarantsetseg has supported her family for the past six years by operating a beauty salon at the largest outdoor market. When she began her business, she rented one small room; she now rents two rooms and has 3 employees. Sarantsetseg usually offers tattoos, manicures and massages. She takes special care of her employees’ families; therefore, her workers like her and their work. Recently, customers have asked for a tattoo cleaner service. Therefore Sarantsetseg needs a laser machine which refreshes tattoos. 

Sarantsetseg is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a tattoo laser machine, which she really needs for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new tattoo laser machine

loans.name: Mawere1 Group

texts.en:
Patson is a 37-year-old married man with 2 children, aged 11 and 6 years. Both children are going to school. He also has 1 dependant, his nephew, whom he stays with. 

He has a flea market business at Garikai Flea Market in Masvingo town, which he is operating with the help of his wife. He has been in this business for 10 years. He does not have any employees who work for him. He buys his products from Zambia and Harare, Zimbabwe. High competition in the market is the challenge he faces in the business. In the next 5 years he would like to have a boutique in the central business district in Masvingo town. With the  extra income generated from the business, he will be able to pay his children's fees in full without any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Having a plentiful harvest and a higher income is the goal of every farmer like Romeo, a 52-year-old father who aims to become successful someday. Despite the hardships of farming, he has the strong determination to improve his corn farming business. He has been a farmer for almost 34 years and usually earns a profit of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every harvest season. He uses his income for basic necessities and allowances for his children. Being a hardworking father, he has educated all five of his children and most of them are now professionals.

Romeo plans to continue managing his business to earn and save for the future. He wants to ask for additional capital of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy corn seed, fertilizers and insecticides needed for corn production. He believes that through hard work he will increase production and income.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers and insecticides needed for corn production.

loans.name: Libasse

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Libasse  âgé de 56 ans, est marié avec trois femmes et neuf enfants .Son activité consiste à faire du commerce  divers : vente de  friperie, confection  et vente de tamis et divers autres produits dont la vente peut générer un profit  .Il a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine.
Avec ce crédit il va acheter du bois et des grillages pour fabriquer des tamis et les vendre dans le marché. Il  participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille avec une participation de 750 FCFA/jour.
texts.en:
Libasse is 56 years old and is married with three wives and nine children. 

His business involves trading in diverse items: selling secondhand clothes in the clothing industry and selling sieves and a variety of other products whose sale can generate a profit. He has more than five years experience in this field. 

With this loan he is going to buy wood and wire netting to make sieves and sell them at the market. He contributes to his family's daily expenses with a contribution of 750 FCFA per day.

loans.use: to buy wood and wire netting to make sieves.

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 26-year-old single man, the oldest among his two brothers and sister. 

Bashar is a student at Middle East University majoring in engineering. After graduation he wants to find a job in the field so he can start building for his future. 

He has applied for a loan today to pay for this semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for this semester’s fees

loans.name: Railu's Group

texts.en:
Railu, standing to the left hand side from a village of Koraput district. Her husband works as an auto driver in the village and has an inconsistent income. As a parent of three children, Railu works hard to support her family. She has an incense stick business in her village. Aimed with a dream of having a decent living, Railu is working really hard to improve her business.

She along with her group member has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Railu will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials for her business like sticks, scented powder, glue etc in a bulk amount which will reduce her operation cost and she will be able make incense stick in a relative high quantity. This will add to her savings and she will be able to lead a quality life.

Railu aspires to diversify her business from incense sticks to candle making business in the near future.She is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her business like sticks, scented powder, glue etc in a bulk amount

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza is a widow with nine children.

She has sold in retail for quite 4 years. With a loan she is going to switch to wholesale. To do so, she will be hiring a truck to load produce and go to Tororo to get her stock. Wholesale can give her much more profit and it helps her get rid of her stock much faster. She is going to keep in her stock in large sacks. Each sack contains 100 KG of produce. She has a house where retailers will come to her to get produce.

She got grant money from Village Enterprise Fund worth 100 dollars in the year 2002. She has also completed business training organised by Village Enterprise Fund.

She will be focusing on the following items -- sorghum, maize, millet, simsim, groundnuts, dry cassava, sun flower, beans, peas, green grams etc.

loans.use: Rent truck, buy stock in tororo

loans.name: Amalia Del Socorro

texts.en:
Amalia has been selling shoes for the last 7 years, thanks to the support of her brother, who has two shoe stores. He first gave her a certain amount of shoes on consignment for her to sell at work. Little by little, her sales and orders increased, so she decided to make this her full-time job. This is how she has been able to help her husband with the family expenses, and to get ahead with her kids.

She is currently requesting a loan in the amount of US$475 to continue buying shoes that her clients order, and mostly to be able to pay for her 4 daughters’ education. You can help her achieve her goals, don’t hesitate any longer, offer her your support. She and her family will thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 7 años que Amalia se dedica a la venta de zapatos, gracias al apoyo de su hermano, quien tiene dos zapaterías, quien le dio a consignación cierta cantidad de zapatos para que los vendiera en su trabajo. Poco a poco fueron creciendo sus ventas y sus pedidos, pro lo que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad de tiempo completo. Es así como ella ha logrado ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar y salir adelante con sus hijos.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 475 para seguir invirtiendo en los zapatos que sus clientes le piden, pero sobre todo para poder pagarle la educación a sus 4 hijas. Tú puedes hacer posible el logro de sus objetivos, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarla, ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Mr. O. sells general goods through his business. He is a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and has benefited from the TEACH programme. He is seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva for working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wholesale goods for retail sale

loans.name: Sophath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophath M. has had a business buying and selling flowers and bananas for more than 20 years. She is widowed with 6 children. Five of her children are married and live in different houses. Mrs. M.'s youngest daughter is single, lives at home, and assists her mother in the business every day.

Mrs. M. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy flowers and bananas from local farmers to sell in the market.

loans.use: Purchasing more flowers and bananas from local farmers to sell in the market.

loans.name: Faleoo

texts.en: Faleoo M. is one of the new members of the Samatau Center. She is in her early thirties, and she runs two businesses: selling chips and fine mats. Faleoo works at her chip store five days a week - she sells chips at a school during recesses. She can sell sixty to ninety bags of chips a day and earn up to US$36. Faleoo weaves fine mats in the evenings and during weekends. The fine mats are in high demand for special events such as weddings and funerals. The white, soft fine mats are very expensive - 10 inches can sell for up to US$200. The price of the mats depends on their size and fineness. Faleoo’s husband has no job, and the couple has six children who are young and in school. Faleoo is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase plastic wrap, cans of oil, a new fryer and pots, so that she is able to continue her chip business and to support her children in school.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic wrap, cans of oil, a new fryer and pots

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. María T. is 44 years old and married to 47 year old Mr. Arístides Speranza. They have 3 children, 2 in high school and 1 in the school near their home in San Estanislao.

María sells meat in the city market, specifically "menudencias" or edible organ meat of cows and chickens, such as heart, liver, kidney, intestine, etc.

María and Arístides are hardworking and selfless, as their daily work begins at 3:00 in the morning and they work Monday through Saturday.

María has a future project to build a room in the front of their house to open a small store. Today she is asking for a loan in order to buy at wholesale prices meat to resell, such as liver, heart, kidney, intestine, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. María T., tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada con el sr. Arístides Speranza de 47 años de edad. Tienen 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando en el colegio y 1 esta en la escuela cerca de su domicilio en San Estanislao.

La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de menudencias en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad, las menudencias son las partes internas de los animales como las vacas y las gallinas, que también se consumen, ejemplo el corazón, hígado, riñón, tripas, etc.

Son personas muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, ya que su jornada laboral se inicia a las 03:00 horas de la mañana y lo hacen de lunes a sábados.

Tiene como un proyecto para el futuro el de construir un salón en frente de su casa para montar una despensa. Hoy solicita un crédito para la compra al por mayor de menudencias como: hígado, corazón, riñón, tripas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase organ meats: liver, heart, kidney, intestine, etc.

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en: My name is Manzoor B. from a mid-size city, Multan, a city famous for its pottery, in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of three girls, all of whom attend school except the youngest who is small and not of school-going age yet. I embroider clothes on order from various shopkeepers and at times from my neighborhood women. My husband manufactures some machine spare parts. Please lend him $325 to improve his business further.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: La Alegría Group

texts.es:
The group named La Alegria (The Happiness) was started in May 2007. One of the members found out about the program Committee of Enterprising Women from a neighbor that had formed her own group. She then contacted her friends and some family members that agreed to become part of her group. The group is comprised of hard-working women that day to day endeavor to earn their daily bread, maintain their homes, and offer their children a good education.

The members dedicate themselves to different lines of work but 11 of them sell chickens. Others sell fruits, eggs, milk, clothes, and prepared foods, etc.

The group La Alegria is comprised of 19 members, all of whom are neighbors. It is located in the city of Ita, in a rural area. They have different fund raising events for the group including lotteries and social gatherings where they sell food. The group has all ready repaid loans from the Foundation and always paid on time. This loan is for $2200 and all the members appear in the picture.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

El Grupo denominado La Alegría tuvo su inicio en el mes de Mayo del Año 2.007, una de las integrantes se enteró del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras por intermedio de una vecina la cual ya había formado su propio grupo. Luego se propuso contactar con sus amigas y algunas de sus familiares, las cuales accedieron en participar dentro del Grupo. El mismo está conformado por señoras trabajadoras que día a día se esfuerzan por ganarse el pan de cada día y colaborar en sus casas y brindar a sus hijos una buena educación.

Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades pero once de las integrantes se dedican a la venta de gallinas, otras venden frutas, huevos, leche, ropas, comidas rápidas, etc.

El Grupo La Alegria esta conformado por 19 integrantes de las cuales todas son vecinas, el grupo se encuentra localizado en la Ciudad de Itá en una zona rural. Las mismas realizan distintas actividades para la recaudación de fondos para el grupo como sorteos, polladas, etc.; cabe destacar que el grupo ya ha retirado préstamos de la Fundación con anterioridad y han cumplido de forma excelente con sus pagos. El promedio que desean retirar cada una es de 800.000gs y aparecen todas en la fotografía.

loans.use: To buy chickens, fruits, salon products, beverages, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Kyerinda West C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Robinah N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling. Robinah is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 6 children ranging from age 7 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Robinah makes approximately UGX 28000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more capital in her business. Robinah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Robinah is joined in her small group by Jesca N. and Joy A.. Jesca N. has a business in shop keeping and wants to purchase more shop items. Joy A. is currently operating a beauty parlor and wants a loan to buy more cosmetics, oils and lotions.

loans.use: To boost charcoal business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: A. Nana is a bar owner. She is a single parent of 2 children. She owns a big drinking spot that supplies drinks to a large population in her area. She is asking for $1150 ($1200 USD) to buy more alcohol and non-alcoholic drinks for supply and sale.

loans.use: To add to her capital and buy more alcohol and non alcoholic drinks for supply and sale.

loans.name: Michel

texts.es:
“I have an unfinished construction in my dwelling. I need to put in windows and doors and plaster the walls. That is why I request this loan of 1200 dollars to be able to finish the construction of my home. “

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar en mi vivienda, necesito colocarle las ventanas, puertas y enjarrar sus paredes, es por eso que Solicito su apoyo con” $ 1,200.00 dlls para poder terminar la construcción de mi vivienda”.

loans.use: To put in windows and doors and plaster the walls of his house.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan B. is a 41 year old farmer who has been selling dairy products such as milk and yoghurt in Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement since 1999. He is married and has three children. He applied for $800 USD to purchase one milking cow. He also works in the local police department, but his main source of funding is dairy sales.

loans.use: Elkhan would like to purchase one milking cow.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Establishing and managing her little grocery store has given much satisfaction to Flor, who, after a lot of thought, decided to seek a loan in order to outfit and expand the workspace she had converted into a mini market. The project was undertaken for the benefit of her beloved family and with the collaboration and help of her beloved husband. Your generosity could help make her noble aspiration become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Su desempeño y adecuada administración de su pequeña bodeguita le ha otorgado mucha satisfacción a Flor, quien después de mucho meditar a decidido solicitar un préstamo para implementar y ampliar su espacio de labor a fin de convertirlo en un mini mercado, para beneficio de su amada familia y con la importante colaboración y ayuda de su amado esposo.Vuestros generosos corazones podrán contribuir a concretar este noble deseo.

loans.use: To outfit and expand a small grocery store

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim P., age 37, is widow who lives in a small village off of National Road Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has two sons and one daughter. All of them attend the local school.

Mrs. Lim P. has been selling fish for eighteen years. She buys the fish from a nearby district market and resells them at market in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agathe A. was born on September 8, 1967 in Lomé, Togo. Living in Benin for about 10 years, she is married to Mr. Daniel Dohou and mother of three children: Boris, Gabriel, and Rita for whom she is still responsible. From her mother, Mrs. Abla Dogbe, she gained several years experience with selling corn. Three years ago she became independent, and she does her buying in the north of Benin, then distributes her merchandise to retailers.

In view of the present hikes in the price of corn due to the ever-increasing cost of living, she is requesting a loan of US$ 925 to stock up.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Agathe est né le 8 Septembre 1967 à Lomé au TOGO. Résident au BENIN depuis une dizaine d'années, elle est mariée à monsieur DOHOU Daniel et mère de trois enfants: Boris, Gabriel et Rita tous encore à sa charge. Elle a déjà acquis auprès de sa maman dame DOGBE Abla, plusieurs années d'expérience dans la commercialisation du maïs. Devenue indépendante il y a trois ans, elle s'approvisionne au Nord du BENIN puis distribue sa marchandise à des détaillants.

Compte tenu de la hausse actuelle du prix du maïs due à la cherté de la vie, elle sollicite un financement de 400000FCFA afin de s'approvisionner.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 sacks of corn

Achat de 15 sacs de maïs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase equipment for breaking and shaping building stones

loans.name: Mailing Ivonne

texts.es: Su mama le enseñó el negocio de la costura, de soltera era ayudante en el taller de su mama, cuando contrajo nupcias su esposo le ayudo a la compra de una maquina de coser y que ella empezara su propio taller, por la calidad de su trabajo no le fue difícil hacerse de mucha clientela, por lo cual se ve obligada a  invertir  más y a la vez contratar ayudantas para poder cumplir con la demanda en su localidad. Vive con su esposo quien trabaja en el ministerio de salud y con su salario le ha ayudado a salir adelante, tiene 2 hijos los que asisten a escuela de primaria, sueña con tener un local  bien acondicionado para trasladar su taller  y lo piensa lograr con los créditos que adim le ofrece.
texts.en:
Mailing's mother taught her the business of sewing: as a single woman she helped in her mother's seamstress workshop, and when she married her husband helped her to buy a machine. Once she began her own shop, due to the quality of her work it wasn't difficult to attract many customers, as a result of which she was obliged to invest more and at the same time to hire assistants in order to be able to meet the demand in her area. She lives with her husband who works at the Ministry of Health and with his salary he has helped her to move forward. She has 2 children who attend primary school. Mailing dreams of having a well-equipped space to move her workshop to and she hopes she will achieve this with the credits that adim offer.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Nilson

texts.es: Nilson tiene 29 años, aun no ha pensado en la posibilidad de casarse, pero sí tiene tres robustos hijos, y su compañera le ayuda a  trabajar la chacra. Trabaja en la agricultura para afrontar su situación económica, es la única actividad que conoce. La labor de cultivar las tierras le agradan mucho porque no siente ningún tipo de presión, su trabajo es independiente y a la vez muy rentable, en ciertas oportunidades su producto llega a tener un buen precio, esto le permite tener sus ahorros para tiempos de sequía. Pero es vez le ha afectado el alza en los precios de los fertilizantes, entonces, ahora con los ahorros  que los tenia para la compra de unos 20 sacos de fertilizante, solo pudo comprar 8 sacos. Es cliente por vez primera en MFP. Con el dinero comprará productos para fumigar sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Nilson is 29 years old and is unmarried, but he has three strong children and his girlfriend helps him work on the farm. He works in farming to cope with his economic situation and it is the only job that he knows. He likes the work of farming because he does not feel any pressure. This business is independent and very profitable. In times when his products sell at a high price, he is able to save for times of drought. Recently the prices of fertilizers have also increased so that he can only buy 9 sacks with his savings instead of the usual 20 sacks. He is a first time customer with MFP. With the requested money, he will buy products in order to fumigate his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase good products to fumigate his crops

loans.name: Yawa Irène

texts.fr:
Né le 28 juin 1973 à Akata dans la préfecture de Kloto, située au centre du Togo, madame A. Yawa Irène est célibataire et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est une revendeuse des céréales dans son quartier. Pour conserver les céréales, elle les met dans les bidons jaunes qui sont normalement utilisés pour l'huile de palme. Avec sept ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, elle a beaucoup de clients et elle maitrise bien son travail.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 12 sacs de haricot et 10 sacs de maïs afin de reconstituer son stock et de pouvoir bien vendre pour gagner d’argent et soutenir ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born on June 28, 1973 in Akata in Kloto Prefecture, located in the middle of Togo, Ms. Yawa Irène A. is unmarried and the mother of three. She is a retailer of grains in her district. For safe-keeping, she puts the grain into yellow drums that are normally used for palm oil. With seven years of experience in this field of commerce, she has many customers and has a good command of her work. She is requesting this initial loan to buy 12 sacks of beans and 10 sacks of corn to replenish her stock and to do well in her sales. She can then earn money and care for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain

loans.name: San Juan Bautista Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo " San Juan Bautista" esta representado por la señora Olga. Son un grupo que se dedica a diferentes actividades como el comercio D. productos ropa, abarrotes a la sastrería, zapatería y comercialización D. productos en general, son gente con experiencia en el manejo del mercado que les rodea por lo que no tiene miedo a la competencia ya que son gente dinámica y con ganas D. trabajar. el destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos para agrandar su mercadería y producto terminado para tener una mayor rentabilidad y poderle dar un mejor futuro a su familia. Los socios (as) tienen experiencia con grupos solidarios por lo que son responsables y cumplidos en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The members of the San Juan Bautista group is represented by Olga. The members of the group operate various businesses selling products and services such as clothes sales, grocery sales, tailoring services, footwear sales and other miscellaneous products. They are experienced at working the market around them so they don't worry about competition. They're dynamic people and eager to get ahead. The loan will be used to buy materials and supplies so they can increase their sales and, in turn, be able to give their families a better future. The members have experince with cooperatives and are responsible and diligent about repaying their loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Yvessin

texts.fr: Monsieur yvessin A. habite le quartier d’adidogomé à lomé, il est un homme très dynamique qui exerce le commerce de planches et de chevrons à agoè, il fait ce commerce depuis 1999, il n’est pas mariée et assume lui-même ses charges et celle de ses frères et sœurs. il demande un premier crédit de 500000F de chez WAGES pour pouvoir augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Mr Yvessin A. lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé. He is a very dynamic young man, who sells wood planks and rafters in Agoè. He has been in the business since 1999, he is not married and he, alone, is financially responsible for himself and his brothers and sisters. He is requesting a first loan of 500 000F from WAGES in order to increase his inventory.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood planks and rafters

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Benkelema de l’association Djidia  (toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  4 enfants, vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Bankorona l’un des villages de la sous préfecture de NIENA (distant de 2 km de NIENA) en 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente d’haricots, de céréales, des articles de boutiques et des condiments alimentaires pour la restauration.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé de collaborer  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt (prêt de groupe) et tous les précédents se sont bien dénoués.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 10 sacs de 100 kilogrammes de maïs, de mil, de riz, d’haricot, 20 litres d’huile d’arachide, 15 paquets de bonbon, 2 paquets d’allumettes et diverses sortes de condiments alimentaires pour la restauration. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de NIENA et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 5.250FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans leurs activités.
Les femmes du groupe Benkelema ambitionnent  aménager un point de vente adéquat ou avoir un restaurant digne de ce nom ou d’être des grossistes.
texts.en:
The four women of the Benkelema group of the Djidia association, who are all married and are on average 32 years old with 4 children, live in traditional extended families in the village of Bankorona, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Niena (about 2 km from Niena itself) in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They run various businesses which include, among others, the purchase and sale of beans, cereals, various articles, and condiments for food preparation. In order to meet the needs of their customers, they decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso 2 years ago. They are seeking their third group loan, and all their previous loans were repaid without problems. With this loan, they intend to buy ten 100-kilogram bags of maize, millets, rice, beans, 20 litres of peanut oil, 15 packs of sweets, 2 packs of matches, and various types of condiments for food preparation. They each foresee generating an average monthly profit of 5,250 FCFA, of which one portion will be used to meet their families' needs and the rest invested in their businesses. The women of the Benkelema group hope to establish a suitable retail outlet, or to have a reputable restaurant, or to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals and condiments

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Nelida es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 2 hijos, Nelida tiene una tienda en el mercado Santa Clara en donde vende CD, DVD, útiles escolares y otros productos dependiendo de la demanda. Además Nelida junto a su esposo tienen un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa.
Nelida necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos, temperas y DVD.
Los sueños de Nelida son comprar una maquina para la producción de discos musicales, sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Nelida is a member of the community bank “Sonrisa” (Smile). She is 41 years old and lives with her common-law husband and 2 children. Nelida has a store in the Santa Clara market where she sells CDs, DVDs, school supplies and other products, depending on the demand. Nelida and her husband also have a booth in the 12 de april market where they sell clothing. Nelida needs a loan for 3000 soles that she will invest in notebooks, paints and DVDs. Nelida dreams of buying a machine to produce music CDs and also that her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: school supplies and DVDs

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Муж Дилором работает в колхозе, сама Дилором занимается предпринимательством – куплей продажей детской одежды на разных рынках района. Дилором 34 года, имеет 2 детей. С МикроИнвест сотрудничает 2 года. Показала себя пунктуальной и отчетственной клиенткой. Дилором подала заявку на КИВА и собирается расширить ассортимент весенней одежды.
texts.en:
Dilorom's husband works in a collective farm and Dilorom is a businesswoman - she buys and resells children's clothing on the markets of her region. Dilorom is 34 years old, she has two children. She has been with MicroInvest for two years now. She has shown herself as a punctual and responsible client. Dilorom applied for a loan with Kiva and plans to expand the assortment of spring clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Djiguisèmè Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Djiguisèmè sont mariés majoritairement dans des grandes familles polygames avec en moyenne 49 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le quartier bozokin de Kirango Markala (4ème région administrative du Mali)
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et dans l’association traditionnelle des femmes de Kirango.
Après trois prêts correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé  pour acheter, 200kg de poisson qui serait séché avant la revente, 17 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 15sacs de 50 morceaux de savon, des ingrédients pour la fabrication des boissons locales  (80kg de gingembre, 90kg d’oseille de Guinée, 8sacs de sucre et des essences). Elles s’approvisionnent, en bois de chauffe à Djibougou, en poissons au bord du fleuve Niger à Kirango avec les pêcheurs et quant aux autres produits à la foire de Diamarabougou. Le poisson est revendu dans la cité administrative de Kirango, à Ségou, à Dougabougou et à Diabali  et les autres produits en détail à travers les quartiers de Markala à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
 Elles  espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 46.000FCFA par mois, qui sera essentiellement utilisé pour augmenter le fonds de commerce. Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The six members of the group Djiguisèmè are women who are married for the most part in large polygamous families, and they average 49 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in the Bozokin district of Kirango Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community and kinship and in the traditional women’s association of Kirango.

After correctly repaying three loans, the group members are on their fourth solidarity loan, which will be used to buy 200 kg of fish (to be dried and then sold), seventeen cart-loads of firewood, fifteen 50-count sacks of soap, and some ingredients for making local beverages (80 kg of ginger, 90 kg of dried hibiscus flowers, 8 sacks of sugar, and some flavorings). Supplies of firewood are gotten in Djibougou. The fish is gotten from fishermen on the banks of the Niger River in Kirango. As for the other goods, these are gotten at the Diamarabougou fair. The fish is resold in the administrative section of Kirango, in Ségou, in Dougabougou, and in Diabali. The other goods are sold retail across the districts of Markala to customers composed primarily of women.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 46,000 francs CFA that will essentially be used to augment the working capital. Their ambition is to buy a house in which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto E. is 31 years old and married to Teresita. They have been blessed with two children: Christ John, who is 12 and just graduated from elementary school, and Cristel Joy who is 4. Teresita is currently working abroad as an “Overseas Foreign Worker” trying to earn money for their family.

Crisanto and his wife are making the sacrifice of being away from each other just to earn more income in order to give their children a better future. He believes that there is nothing greater that he could give his children than education, and thus Crisanto strives hard to grow his farming business and make it more profitable.

Crisanto manages his farming business for his family. He availed of a loan last year and is now requesting another loan of PHP 15,000.00 in order to maintain and improve his farm. He paid off his last loan successfully, but is still in need of financial assistance for his farm. He is very thankful for being able to borrow from ASKI, Kiva's partner, since ASKI offers many benefits to its clients. He hopes that someday, his family will be able to improve its living condition. He works towards this through his perseverance in developing his farm and by sacrificing a lot for his family’s future welfare.

loans.use: addional capital to maintain and improve his farm

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es: Alfredo Antonio Z. González tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casado. Alfred tiene 2 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica es tenería. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alfredo inicio este negocio por cuenta propia para que sus hijos no tuvieran problemas para estudiar. Alfredo tiene los propósitos de incrementar sus ganancias. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar cromo, vaquetas entre otros. El sueño de Alfredo establecer una negocio en su vivienda para que su esposa se haga cargo de este pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Alfredo Antonio Z. G. is 45 years old and married with 2 children, both of whom work. For the past 14 years he has worked tanning leather. He started this business on his own so that his children would have access to a good education. Alfredo would like to increase his profits, and the loan that he is asking for will be used for working capital, as well as the purchase of chromium and veal hide, among other things. Alfredo's dream is to set up a business in his home so that his wife can be in charge of it.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị (255021112) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Sóc Sơn. She is married and has three school-aged children.

V. owns and operates a business primarily manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2000, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

V. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her 9th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Sandra Del Rosario

texts.es:
la sra. SANDRA DEL ROSARIO E. O. se dedica a la venta de baleadas, ella elabora las tortillas. las baleadas que ella vende son de varios tipos como ser: con frijoles, queso y huevos, con frijoles y carne de res o carne de cerdo y las especiales que llevan de todo.
El negocio de la Sra. E. se encuentra ubicado en la colonia Apaguiz en el estacionamiento de la gasolinera "ESSO ROCA" salida a Jamastran. El negocio de ella opera bajo el nombre de Baleadas "La Amistad".
Doña Sandra es madre soltera con (3) hijos, y tiene 3 años de residir en el mismo lugar.
Gracias a los ingresos que le genera su negocio ha podido mantenerse por si sola y brindarles todo el apoyo a sus hijos y darle mayor solvencia a su negocio, tiene una buena clientela.
Su meta es poder ver a sus hijos graduados de secundaria y tener su propio techo dingno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Ms. Sandra Del Rosario E. O. has committed herself to selling baleadas (a wheat flour tortilla filled with seasoned beans). She sells various types of baleadas, such as: those with beans, those with egg and cheese, beef and beans or sausage and the specials of the day.

Ms. E.’s business is located in the Apaguiz colony at the “Esso Roca” gas station off the Jamastran exit. Her business operates under the name “La Amistad.”

Ms. Sandra is a single parent of (3) three boys and has resided in the same place for the last 3 years. She is thankful for the profits she has generated from the business which have helped her maintain it solely on her own. It has also given her the ability to help her children and retain good clients through fruitful business. Her goal is to ensure her children graduate middle school and have a proper roof where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for food preparation

loans.name: Basir Ahmad

texts.en: Basir Ahmad has got a catering shop. He is 36, married with three children. He is the son of D. M. and lives in District 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He wants to fulfill the requirements of his shop and expand his business, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 afghani. He is confident that with this loan he will increase his business as soon as possible. He would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For a catering business

loans.name: Marguerite

texts.en:
Marguerite K. is 38years old ,married  and she has  two children with the following years old : 13,11,20. and she takes care of  one dependent.

Marguerite   is requesting  her first loan From Vision Finance Company .she works from 6:00am to 6:00pm  and employs one person to help her .

she  earns mounthly profit of  70,000 Rwandan Francs . She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs. With this new loan she hopes to purchase more charcoal  to sell which will help her to get more profit in order to pay  school fees for her children, to expand her business.

loans.use: purchising more charcoal sales

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: LA SEÑORA, SALOME M. M. , ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA QUE TRABAJA  EN LA INSTITUCION MAS DE CINCO AÑOS SIN CAMBIAR A OTRAS INSTITUCIONES ES DECIR ES UNA CLIENTE FIEL. ELLA TIENE UNA CARNICERIA, DONDE EL ESPOSO LE AYUDA CUANDO TIENE MOMENTOS LIBRES, YA QUE EL ES ALBAÑIL CONTRATISTA. LOS TRES HIJOS AUN ESTUDIAN, PERO TAMBIEN COLABORAN CON EL NEGOCIO DE LA MAMA. ELLA INVERTIRA ESTE CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MAS CARNE PARA VENDER EN SU CARNICERIA.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salome M. M. is an old client of Emprender, having worked with them for more than five years without changing to other institutions. That is to say, she is a faithful client. She has a butcher shop, which her husband herlps her with in his free time, since he is a building contractor. Her three children are students but they also help out her business. She will use this loan to buy more meat to sell in her butcher shop.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat for butcher shop

loans.name: Juana Celestina

texts.es: La señorita Juana Celestina B. P. tiene 29 años de edad  soltera vive con su familia reside en el lugar conocido como Caserío la libertad del Aldea Vásquez, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, en la actualidad se dedica elabondo cortes tipicos y cuenta con un pequeño taller desde hace cinco años según el crecimiento de su produccion y negocio  ella acudio a las intalaciones de Asdir con el objetivo de obtener un credito, para poder seguir invirtinedo en su capital de trabajo comprando materia prima asi mismo incrementando el numero de operarios y clientes como tambien su produccion mensual para un mejor futuro, y creando más empleos en su comunidad, logrando sus ingreos menusles, para poder seguir estudiando.y ser una empresaria

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Estrellitas” esta representado por la señora Verónica Beatriz y  esta conformado por 13 socias, D. las cuales 7 participaron en el ciclo anterior y 6 se incorporaron en este ciclo, es decir que se encuentran en un segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. Los socios en general se dedican a diferentes actividades como ser venta D. electrodoméstico, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. comida, y  viven en la misma zona. En cuanto a la competencia  ellas venden en su barrio donD. no existe mucha competencia en sus rubros D. tal manera que sus ventas les generan ingresos diarios frecuentes. El crédito esta destinado a la inversión en sus actividades económicas o negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento diario D. sus hogares. A futuro ellas esperan incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar mas aun la calidad D. vida D. sus familias otorgándoles una mejor educación y la posibilidad D. que sus hijos asistan a la universidad.
texts.en:
The group "The Little Stars" is represented by Verónica Beatriz and consists of 13 members, seven of whom participated in the last loan cycle and six of whom joined for this loan cycle. The fact that they are in their second loan cycle speaks to their sense of reponsibility and punctuality in making their loan payments. The members, who all live in the same area, are involved in different business activities, including the sale of electrical appliances, cosmetics, groceries and food. They sell in a neighborhood where there is not much competition in their respective lines of business. For this reason, their sales frequently generate daily income for the members. The requested loan is intended for investment in the economic and business activities that pay for the group's daily household expenses. In the future, they hope to increase their earnings and to improve even further the quality of life of their families, providing them with a better education and the possibility of their children attending university.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital.

loans.name: Busari

texts.en:
Busari is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions, jewelry, and school shoes in Oyo State, Nigeria.

Busari has been in her business for over 16 years and in LAPO for the past 2 years. Busari hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to increase the amount of provisions and shoes she has to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and shoes

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, trabaja como transportista publico con su Taxi, casado con 4 hijos su esposa trabaja como comerciante de comida, viven en casa propia ubicada en la Zona 1ro de Mayo en la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para el mantenimiento de su movilidad la misma que es su herramienta de trabajo así tener asegurado por un buen tiempo sus ingresos para poder solventar las necesidades de su hogar.
 
Es el cuarto  crédito en IMPRO, sus créditos anteriores fueron cancelados satisfactoriamente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Pedro.
texts.en:
Pedro works in public transportation with his taxi. He is married with 4 children. His wife sells food. They live in their own house located in the First of May zone of El Alto City.

The loan is destined for maintenance of his taxi, which is the basic tool he works with. This will assure his income for some time and help him provide the necessities of his home.

This is his 4th loan through IMPRO. His previous credits were paid off satisfactorily. The evaluation qualifies Pedro for approval of the solicited loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR MAINTAINING HIS TAXI

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un joven soltero de 27 años y actualmente vive con su hermana.
Cuando tenía 20 años migró de la sierra a la selva peruana en busca de un porvenir diferente, llegando a esta zona se puso a trabajar como jornalero (en campos de cultivo) desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, durante varios años. Poco a poco fue ahorrando el dinero que finalmente invirtió en la compra de su propio terreno, allí construyó su casa de madera, y esto le dio mayor estabilidad.
