De entonces Juan trabaja más tranquilo y hace un año alquiló  terrenos fértiles donde sembró sus primeras plantaciones de café y cítricos (naranjas) y ahora trabaja en sus propios cultivos, con el anhelo de realizar buenas cosechas, y con esas ganancias, comprar sus propias chacras y evitar pagar el alquiler de la tierra.

Esta es la primera vez que accede a un crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy agradecido por la confianza brindada, y como respuesta a ello, pagará puntualmente todas sus cuotas a tiempo. El dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus chacras.
texts.en:
Juan is a single young man who is 27 years of age and currently lives with his sister. When he was 20 years old, he moved from the mountains to the Peruvian jungle in search of a different life. When he arrived in the area, he found a job as a field laborer working from 7am to 6pm. Over time he saved enough money to finally purchase his own land on which he built a house. He now has greater stability.

Juan currently works under much calmer conditions. A year and a half ago, he rented some rich farmland where he planted his first coffee plants and orange trees. Now that he manages his own crops, Juan hopes to experience good harvests. With his earnings, he plans to acquire his own farm so that he can avoid renting land.

This is his first time to access a loan from MFP. Juan is grateful for the confidence placed in him, so in return, he plans to make his payments on time. The money he is requesting will be used to buy chemical fertilizers to apply to his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Purevtogtoh

texts.en:
Purevtogtoh is 41 years old aN. lives with his wife aN. three childreN.iN.Ovorhangai province, oN. of Mongolia's central provinces. Al of his three daughters are high school students. He has a small truckiN. business. He currently owN. a truck aN. he uses his truck to carry various cargo amoN. nearby towN.. He says that his truck is the maiN.source of income for his family aN. he is well-knowN.for his reliability aN. good service amoN. local customers. With earnings from his business, Purevtogtoh pays for his childreN.s tuitioN.aN. household expenses. Purevdorj is a humble aN. hard workiN. person.  He requests a loaN.to purchase necessary accessories for his car. 

About XacBaN.
XacBaN. was founded iN.2001, aN. listed its first loaN.oN.Kiva iN.January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organizatioN.iN.Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operatioN.. XacBaN. has the vision, scale aN. innovatioN.to develop aN. implemeN. new solutioN. to poverty. It is currently utiliziN. Kiva’s 0% lendiN. interest rate to returN.9% of interest paid from borrowers to them iN.the form of a savings accouN. at the eN. of their loaN.. This not only allows borrowers to gaiN.financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBaN., please joiN.our lendiN. team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To leN. to more MongoliaN.borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryStriN.=Mongolia&status=fundRaisiN.&gender=All&sectors[]=All&regioN.[]=All&sortBy=ExpiriN.+Soon

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice, 38 years of age, is married and mothers two children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist attraction community in the central region of Ghana on the coast.  As a result, the major occupation of the people is fishing. Beatrice is a trader who runs a provisions store by the roadside in the community. She buys her goods from Accra. Beatrice has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk.

loans.name: Sadik

texts.en:
Sadik is fifty years old. He is married and has five children who are all in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is commerce. As the man of the family, Sadik works very hard to be able to cater for the household. He sells wrist watches. He says he hawks and sometimes treks to nearby communities to sell.

Sadik procures his goods from Accra. He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase his stock.

loans.use: To buy wristwatches to sell

loans.name: United Sisters Group

texts.en:
Victoria T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Sisters. She is 40 years old and is married with six children aged from one year seven months old to 20 years old.  Victoria also cares for a niece.  Many of her children are in school, and their educational levels are nursery school to 7th grade.  Victoria herself only recently finished high school by taking classes at night school.  When she was younger she had to stop her schooling because of poverty.

Victoria and her family live in the Pipeline Community, and she works in the Red Light Market, Liberia's largest market which is near the capital, Monrovia.  Her business is the sale of fruit, such as plantain, bananas, oranges, etc. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail from a table in the Red Light Market.  She has been running this business for more than 20 years and hopes to become an exporter of Liberian plantain, banana, oranges and other fruit.

Victoria originally started her business with 500 Liberian Dollars as her working capital but with hard work, her business has grown.  She sells good, ripe fruit in order to encourage her customers to continue buying from her.  Victoria needs this loan to purchase more fruit for her business.

She dreams of being able to help educate her children so that they have a good foundation for their future.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Victoria is the one holding the sign.  Despite the group's name -- United Sisters -- there is one male member, Sungar S., who joined after the initial members had decided on the name.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en:
Mrs. Pascuala T. has been married to her husband, Manuel, for 46 years now. She is 64 years old and has six children, most of whom have their own families already.

At her age, Pascuala still works on her rice farm because she wants to support her family financially. She does not mind spending most of her time on the farm. She also joined CEVI upon hearing good feedback from her fellow farmers. She thinks its program is really helpful to farmers like her who are in need of additional capital.

Pascuala is requesting to loan of Php 6,000. She told CEVI that this loan would be spent on farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
En Barnaoa,  segundo municipio del Departamento del Atlántico, todos conocen a Orlando Suarez S. Bolívar, porque hace bloques  para la venta;  su negocio lo inició en el año 2003 al construir una casa familiar,  con bloques que él mismo elaboró  utilizando un molde arrendado;  desde ese momento se dispersó en el pueblo su saber y la demanda  de este producto fue en aumento, porque los pedidos de sus  vecinos no se hicieron esperar, así como los de algunos  negocios cercanos  como ferreterías, con  las cuales aun sigue negociando;  así comenzó su bloquera, una vez adquirió sus propios moldes y herramientas de trabajo y desde entonces  no ha dejado de trabajar en esta empresa de donde salen todos sus gastos y diariamente brinda satisfacciones al sentir que las viviendas son construidas con sus bloques . Esta es la razón por la cual aplica a un crédito por valor de $800.000 que invertirá en la compra de materia prima para elaborar  los bloques que vende,especialmente de cemento y arena.
Su sueño es organizar su negocio mediante la construcción de un local donde montar su proceso y mantener una mayor producción. Su desafío constante es el no tener mucho capital de trabajo para este propósito, pero sabe que poco a poco con disciplina lo irá construyendo.
texts.en:
Everyone in Barnaoa, Atlántico department's second city, knows Orlando Suarez S. Bolívar because he manufactures and sells bricks. He started the business in 2003 with the construction of a house using bricks he, himself, made with a leased mold. From that day forward, his repute swept through town and demand for his product grew. Orders from his neighbors, as well as from nearby hardware stores (with which he is still in business), were quick to appear. Thus started his brick factory. Once he got his own molds and work tools he hasn't stopped working in this firm, which produces enough income to meet all his expenses; in addition, it daily provides him with the satisfaction of knowing that homes are built with his bricks. This is the reason behind his asking for funding, in the amount of $800.000, to buy raw materials, particularly cement and sand, to make the bricks he sells. His dream is to organize his business in a site where he can both set up his production process and keep a larger stock of product. His constant challenge is not having sufficient capital for this purpose but he knows that, with discipline, he will gradually build it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brick-making raw materials, especially cement and sand.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria V. de 55 años es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 23 años de edad. 
   Doña Maria tiene este negocio  desde aproximadamente  1.974; ella comenzó con un pequeño capital que su familia le regalo, para poder trabajar como vendedora ambulante, tiempos después ya que tenia suficiente mercaderías, se compró una casilla en el mercado, que le dio resultado positivo, y en la actualidad ella ya compro mas de tres salones para la exibision de sus mercaderías.
   Ella utilizaría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías atendiendo que se acerca la temporada de la venta de uniformes para escuelas y colegios.
texts.en:
Senora Maria V., 55, is a single mother with one daughter of 23. Doña Maria has had this business since approximately 1974; she started with a little capital that her family gave her, to be able to work as a street vendor. Some time afterwards, when she had sufficient merchandise, she bought a booth in the market, which brought positive results, and currently she has bought more than three rooms to exhibit her merchandise. She will use this loan to buy additional merchandise, keeping in view that the season to sell uniforms for schools and colleges is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una trabajadora mujer de 47 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus dos hijas. 
Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de diversos artículos para el hogar, todo lo novedoso que pueda encontrar, puesto que esta característica es la ventaja que tiene sobre las demás vendedoras. Vilma viaja durante casi 3 horas hasta el centro de la ciudad para visitar uno de los mercados más grandes y con mayor cantidad de productos para adquirir su mercadería. Es así que se abastece de lo más variado y de buena calidad que pueda encontrar y posteriormente lo vende en un puesto que tiene en la cuadra de la zona donde vive. Le va muy bien porque además de su mercadería, su facilidad de palabra y su gran poder de convencimiento han hecho de ella una gran vendedora, lo cual la tiene muy contenta con su trabajo. En un futuro, espera tener una tienda en su casa o en algún mercado donde pueda exhibir mejor sus artículos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido una persona muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para la época escolar, es que cuando sabe, obtendrá mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Vilma is a hard-working, 47 year old woman. She lives with her two daughters in her own house. For eight years she has been selling various household items. She sells everything new that she can find. This is the trait that gives her the advantage over the other sellers. Vilma travels almost three hours to the center of the city to visit one of the largest markets in order to get her merchandise. That is how she stocks up on the biggest variety and the best quality she can find. She previously sold from a stand she had on a block in the area where she lives. It is going very well for her because in addition to her merchandise, her ability with words and her great power to persuade have made her a great saleswoman. That makes her very happy with her work. In the future she hopes to have a store in her house or in a market where she can better display her items. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual with all of her payments. She will use the money she is now requesting to buy a greater quantity of merchandise for the school season. That is when she will have greater sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Sembradoras Group

texts.es: Doña Candelaria Pú I. cuenta con 3 hijos, 2 nenas y un hombre, el mayor tiene una edad de 8 años y el menor de ellos cuenta con 1 año, ella vive a unos 25 kilometros de la ciudad de Momostenango, actualmente se dedica al servicio de Tienda de consumo diario y un molino de nixtamal electrico, con las necesidades que surgen de darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, necesita un prestamo para el aumento de capital de la Tienda con la que cuenta, para que de esa manera aumenta sus productos de ventas y con el tiempo obtener mejores ingresos economicos, para ello se organizaron con un grupo de personas de la comunidad la cual cuentan con principios morales, y acudieron a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un prestamo por cada uno de ellos, el resto del grupo se dedica a la Crianza de animales domesticos, y otros a la Agricultura como, la siembra de Tomate, Alberja China, Coliflor, Café entre otros.
texts.en:
Candelaria Pú I. has three children, two girls and a boy. The eldest is eight and the youngest is one. She lives 25 kilometers from the city of Momostenango. Currently, she is dedicated to working in her grocery store and an electric corn mill. With the need arising to provide better living conditions to her family, she needs a loan to increase the capital of the shop since she can then increase the products she can sell and, with time, obtain better income. For this, she organized with a group of people in the community who all have moral principles and they turned to the ASDIR association to solicit a loan for each one of them. The rest of the group is dedicated to raising domestic animals and others to farming such as sowing tomatoes, Chinese snow peas, cauliflower, coffee, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben B. is 54 years old and lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area, with his wife. He has two sons who live in Yerevan. Ruben is an economist, and now works as an accountant in the Tsovagyugh village administration. At the same time, he is engaged in animal husbandry and land cultivation. On his farm, Ruben has cows and calves, pigs and piglets. His wife helps him on the farm and they use their farming income to provide for their family's needs and increase the number of their farm animals.
Ruben is asking for a loan of 1,100,000 AMD to buy fodder for his farm animals, seeds and fertilizer. He intends to spend his future income on reconstructing and repairing his house.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Erlinda Bergado's Group

texts.en:
Erlinda B. (left), 58 years of age and married, is a resident of Dimalco, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Erlinda is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Erlinda B.’s Group. 	
Erlinda is married to Remegio, 63 years old and a farmer. They are blessed with 13 children; 11 are now adults and two are now school age. To help her husband, she decided to operate a retail store. For six years, she has been able to maintain the business. She is earning an average net income of not less than P 3,500 a month, which is very helpful to their family income.  She joined the cooperative in the year 2009. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting  P 5,000.00 as her second loan to add capital to her existing sari-sari store business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions of her family, to meet their basic needs and savings for future use. She is hoping that someday her business will become more progressive. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing sari-sari store business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman from Lebanon with two children. Ten years ago she opened her own clothing store for the neighboring areas in order to help her husband with the family expenses. She is now well-known in the area.

She is now requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Cristino Raúl

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristino es contratista de obras viales, reside en la ciudad de San Ignacio, es casado y vive con su señora y dos hijos menores, es un hombre trabajador y su familia lo apoya en sus  emprendimientos profesionales.
Solicita el crédito para adquirir una maquina que necesita para su trabajo el cual es un roturador de piedras.
El Cliente manifiesta que esta máquina será importante para   realizar un trabajo bueno y mas rápido.
texts.en:
Cristino is a roadworks contractor who resides in the city of San Ignacio. He is married and lives with his wife and two young children. He is a hard worker, and his family supports his professional activities. He is asking for credit to buy a jackhammer, a machine that he needs for his work. This machine will help him work better and more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a jackhammer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a blacksmith machine

loans.name: Jackilou

texts.en:
Jackilou P., 24 years old, is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. Jackilou is single and has an infant child.

To make a living Jackilou operates specialized retail business. Her main source of income comes from selling and being an agent of personal and home products from various suppliers. Jackilou has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Jackilou joined HSPFI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jackilou is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, zinc sheeting, wood etc.

loans.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es: Juana De Jesús de 52 años, vende cosméticos, Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano, vende pinturas de uñas, desodorantes, perfumes, cremas, jabón, pintura de labios y tratamientos. Lleva17 años en este negocio, su negocio está ubicado en las afueras del mercado, en donde transitan muchos clientes a diario, por lo que ella siempre se esmera en atender muy bien a sus clientes. Esta oportunidad de financiamiento la solicita para la compra de materia prima para comprar nuevos productos y así ofrecer una  gran variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana De Jesús, 52, sells cosmetics. She works alone from very early in the day. She sells nail polish, deodorants, perfumes, creams, soap, lipstick and beauty treatments. She has been in this business for 17 years. Her business is located outside the market were many people pass by daily. She always takes great pains to tend to her customers very well. This loan will be used to buy raw materials, new products, in order to offer a wider variety of goods to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita B. is from the village of Tabon. She is 56 years old. Anita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Anita owns and operates an agricultural business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Anita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Anita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir is married and has two children. He is an energetic small-business entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Volodimir owns real estate and rents his property to legal entities and individuals. The facility he offers for rent is located in a good area of his home town which unfailingly attracts customers who are willing to pay a high rental fee. Volodimir has been in this business for five years.

Volodimir is seeking a loan of 8,000 UAH to do maintenance on the facility he owns and leases. He is hoping to improve the plumbing system in the building to make it more comfortable and attractive for existing and new customers. Volodimir has proved to be a responsible and reliable client with a solid credit history.

loans.use: To do maintenance on his rental property

loans.name: James Gichuki

texts.en:
James is married; he and his wife have two children whom they support. He has been in the business of selling and repairing electrical items for four years with a good income. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. through existing clients; this will be his first loan from any MFI.

James' business is located in a densely populated area and he serves many customers who are mostly the residents of Dandora. With this loan he plans to buy more electronic tools to enhance his work. He plans to plough any extra profits back into the business to increase its stability.

James hopes to expand and have other branches, as he believes he is hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: The loan will be used to add more stock.

loans.name: Gemma's Group

texts.en: Gemma Y. is from the village of Tandul, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Gemma is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products inside the school campus. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lyka

texts.en:
Lyka B. is from the village of Barangay Ibung, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old. Lyka is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lyka joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. 

Lyka is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Elena; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida en el mercado de San Pedro que queda en una de las calles del Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para construir su casa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the “Manos Juntas” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Maria Elena is 33 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food in San Pedro market which is in one of Cusco's streets.  She would like to expand her business.  She is grateful for her loan which she will use to buy materials for building her home.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials to build her house

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
María Consuelo es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Fundo Los Ayala del caserío Punto 9 del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona agrícola poblada por gente humilde  y trabajadora. Se encuentra ubicada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con algunos animales menores, los cuales cría en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los alimenta en base de granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es la más importante fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta, gracias a ella ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. 

Actualmente desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de estos animales y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas, sobretodo durante esta temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Consuelo is a 38-year-old mother who lives with her husband and their children in the Fundo Los Ayala area of the Punto 9 settlement in Lambayeque District.  This is a farming area populated by humble, hardworking people.  It is located more than a half hour from the city of Chiclayo.

María has some small animals which she raises in an area behind her house.  She feeds them natural grains and grasses, and when they grow to a good size she offers them for sale to the businessmen who often visit the area where she lives.  This is María's most important source of income, and thanks to it she helps her husband, who is a farmer, to support their family.

Right now she wants to buy balanced feed to improve the animals' growth so she will earn more from their sale, especially during this Christmas season, which is when demand increases.  For this reason, she decided it was a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 new soles to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: Buy balanced feed to improve business raising and selling animals

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua N. prepares tea and serves it with fried eggs. She also sells soft drinks at Takoradi market. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional soft drinks for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Ruth M. M. vive en la Col. Centro de Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos, México. Ella tiene 39 años de edad  concluyo la educación básica. El crédito lo va a utilizar para ampliar su negocio, ella vende artículos de mercería, regalos y muñecos de peluche, ella va a comprar con su crédito muñecos de peluches, bolsas para regalo, mercería y juguetes para los reyes magos. Ella aprendió el negocio por su papá que tenía un negocio igual en la plaza de Axochiapan de venta de regalos. Ella desde pequeña acompañaba a su papá a comprar la mercancía para surtir su negocio y conoció donde comprar los artículos para el negocio. Ella inició hace 15 años con su esposo es herencia de su papa cuando ella era soltera se encargaba del negocio de su papa ya después comenzó de poquito vendía en una mesita afuera de su casa, fue cuando decidió invertir  con los prestamos fue creciendo fue comprando mas mercancía para surtir su negocio y creció poco a poco, ella tiene su negocio en su casa, se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio, también nos comenta que de su negocio obtiene para sacar adelante los gastos de su casa y se siente feliz porque a pesar de que hay temporadas de bajas ventas su negocio siempre le deja buenas ganancias. Algunos de los desafíos que enfrenta son el aumento de los precios y de la competencia, pues nos comenta que en los quince años que lleva vendiendo, se han instalado en su misma calle otros cuatro negocios del mismo giro, por lo cual planea ampliar su negocio y lo piensa lograr con los préstamos de KIVA y Fundación Realidad, ella piensa en solicitar un préstamo mayor y así poder comprar mas mercancías y tener un negocio competitivo.
La señora Ruth es casada, su esposo trabaja en su casa en electrónica repara televisiones, modulares, Dvd, tiene dos hijos José  Manuel de 6 años de edad estudia la primaria  y Yoselin de 14 años de edad estudia la secundaria. Su esposo y su hija le ayudan en el negocio atendiendo en algunos momentos del día. Ella considera que su negocio le ha ayudado mucho a salir adelante con su familia y  hacer mejoras en su vivienda. Entre los planes que tiene a futuro son el de ampliar su negocio colocando una cortina para que su mercancía se vea más bonito que estemos bien de salud y que haya buenas vetas. Las mejoras que desea para el futuro de sus hijos que le echen ganas al estudio Entre las mejoras que tiene planeado realizar en su negocio son repellar su casa, pintarla, etc. la señora Ruth se siente muy feliz con el préstamo que recibió ya que de esa manera ha podido hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. La señora Ruth quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por la oportunidad, más que nada por la confianza que nos dan ya que no nos conocen y nos prestan, gracias a eso hacemos crecer nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
Ruth M. M. lives in Col. Centro, Axochiapan, in the State of Morelos, in Mexico.  She is 39 years old and completed her basic education.  She will use her loan to expand her business selling sewing supplies, gifts and cuddly toys.  She will use her loan to buy cuddly toys, gift bags, sewing supplies and toys for 'Reyes Magos' (a holiday which is celebrated in Mexico on January 6th, when children receive gifts from 'The Three Kings').  Ruth learned the trade from her dad who had an identical business in Axochiapan town square where he sold gifts.  Since she was small, Ruth used to accompany her dad to buy the merchandise to stock his business and so she knew where to buy products for her business.

Ruth started her business 15 years ago with her husband.  It was an inheritance from her dad.  When she was single she would look after her dad's business and then she started, little by little, selling on a small table outside her home.  When she decided to invest with loans, her business grew and she was able to buy more merchandise with which to stock her business.  It grew gradually.  Now Ruth has her business located in her home.  She feels proud to have her own business and she also tells us that it helps her to cover her household expenses.  She feels happy because, in spite of the fact that there are seasons when her sales are low, her business always makes good profits.

Some of the challenges that Ruth faces are rising prices and competition.  She tells us that in the fifteen years she has been selling, another four similar businesses have set up in her street.  For this reason, she plans to expand her business through loans from KIVA and Fundación Realidad.  She is thinking of requesting a larger loan so that she can buy more merchandise and have a competitive business.

Ruth is married.  Her husband works from home fixing televisions, modulars, DVD players, etc.  She has two children.  6 year-old José Manuel is in elementary school and 14 year-old Yoselin is in high school.  Her husband and her daughter help her in her business, serving customers at different times of day.  She considers that her business has helped her a lot in getting her family ahead in life and making improvements to her home.  She has a number of plans for the future, including expanding her business and putting up a curtain so that her merchandise looks nicer.  She wants to continue enjoying good health and to continue making good sales.  The improvement that she would like to make in her children's futures is for them to want to study.  Other improvements that she would like to make include plastering and painting her house.

Ruth feels very happy with the loan that she received since it has enabled her to grow her business and increase her sales.  She would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the opportunity.  Above all, thank you for the trust that you place in us since you don't know us and yet you still lend us money.  Thanks to this, we are able to grow our businesses".

loans.use: Compra de munecos de peluche, bolsas para regalo, merceria y juguetes

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua K. is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She sells porridge and secondhand clothing in Elmina. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the family. The loan will be used to buy additional maize to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua plans to educate her children.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy additional maize to prepare porridge for sale.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalinda D., 63 years old, is married and has 4 children. She lives in Maular, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. After hearing some news about Paglaum Muti-Purpose Cooperative, she became interested in it and she then joined the coop. She has availed herself of loans and started her pig raising project. 

Mrs. Rosalinda D. is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs. She dreams of building a decent home for her family. She also hopes that someday her business will become successful and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 44-year-old married man living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He longs to build a permanent house for residence. He has been growing tomatoes for the last 20 years amid the challenges of high costs of transport and sprays. His dream is to own at least 10 acres of tomato garden. Francis needs the loan to grow tomatoes.

loans.use: Growing tomatoes.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia, tiene 42 años de edad, es padre y madre para sus cinco hijos, ella nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Delia es una madre  trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa en un mercado informal de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 20 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Delia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo ropa para niños, adultos y mujeres. 

Delia pertenece al banco comunal “Sol de Oro” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Delia is 42 years old and assumes the role of both father and mother to her five children.  She was born in the city of Cusco and still lives there to this day.  Delia is a hardworking and enterprising mother who succeeds on behalf of her family.  She has a small clothing stand at an informal market in the city of Cusco.  Delia has been in this business for twenty years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work.  She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more merchandise such as clothing for children, adults, and women.  

Delia is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol de Oro” (Golden Sun), which is part of Asociación Arariwa.  She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Yonni Traders Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org, in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Yonni Traders” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,800,000.00 in order to invest in their businesses. 

Hawa K. is the leader of this group. Hawa is 34 years old and married, with 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Hawa sells cooked rice, meat and vegetables. With the help of this loan,  Hawa will invest in her business by buying cooking ingredients - rice, palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), fish, etc, in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients: rice, palm-oil, margi, fish, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es: La Sra. P. es casada, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, es trabajadora activa de una empresa de venta de fertilizante tiene doce años de trabajar para esta empresa como gerente, se le han financiado seis crédito los cuales lo ha invertido en su casa para mejora este ultimo crédito lo solicita para hacer un cuarto para la compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento y hierro, todos estos crédito le han beneficiado mucho ya que ha podido terminar de hacer su casa y se siente muy bien trabajar con ceprodel.
texts.en: Mrs. P. is married, has 3 grown children, and is an employee at a fertilizer sales enterprise where she has been working for twelve years as a manager.  She has received six loans, which she has invested into making improvements to her home.  She is requesting the current loan to build a room, and the purchase of construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, and steel.  All the loans have benefitted her greatly, allowing her to finish her house.  She feels very good about working with Ceprodel.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, lumber, steel and cinderblocks.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua H. is widow and has six children. As the sole breadwinner of her family, she makes a living selling banku, a Ghanaian staple made from fried fish and a mix of corn and cassava dough. She runs her business from Mfuom, which is near Abura (a town in the Central Region).  

With her loan from Kiva, she plans to purchase more ingredients to increase the volume of food she sells. The increase in her earnings will allow her to set aside money to save up for her children’s education, which is her highest priority.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to increase the volume of food she sells.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Насимов Хасан житель  Гиссарского района. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Старший сын предоставляет услугу, такси. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа коровы и мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Hasan N. lives in the Gissar area. He is fifty years old, married, and has six children. His wife is a housewife. His oldest son drives a taxi. He makes a living by raising cattle. He raises cattle for resale.  He is taking out a loan to buy cows and smaller livestock (sheep or goats).

loans.use: to buy cows and smaller livestock

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 34 years old, married and a father of three lovely children. He lives in Kitale, where he sells second-hand clothes. He has been in this business for two years now, and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings.
This will be Henry's second loan from Kiva partner, KADET. He plans to use the entire loan to buy a bale of clothes so that he can add to his stock. With the income that he will get, he plans to invest in his motorbike business. In the future, he wants to educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Oneida

texts.es: Oneida  de 47 años es una mujer casada que vive en el municipio de Soledad, con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 22 años. Desde hace 12 años una amiga le propuso dedicarse al comercio mediante guías especializadas de productos, y ella empezó a vender interiores y cosméticos principalmente; inició con 6 clientes y gradualmente mediante referidos, fue ampliando su mercado así como diversificando sus productos, pues accedió a nuevos catálogos, con los que le ha ido tan bien,  que desde hace 7 años  lidera un equipo de comerciantes.  Oneida tiene muchos sueños y es una mujer muy trabajadora,  por eso ahora está empeñada en adquirir una casa de mayor tamaño, porque la que tiene es muy pequeña para  sus expectativas de bienestar. Su mayor desafío ocurrió cuando por inexperiencia en la selección de su clientela,  perdió dinero porque otorgaba créditos sin previa selección de sus clientes. Su credikiva es el séptimo financiamiento con el cual comprará  perfumes, cremas, jabones líquidos, productos para el hogar, suéteres, tintes, labiales ropa interior, que tiene encargado por sus rentables clientes. Con sus financiamientos anteriores ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo y responder oportunamente a sus principales clientes, que son sus compradores permanentes y le han ayudado a sostenerse en el mercado.
texts.en: Oneida  is 47 years old. She is a married woman who lives in Soledad with her husband and two children, aged 19 and 22. 12 years ago, a friend proposed to her that she open a business with via specialized product guides. She began to sell mainly underwear and cosmetics. She began with 6 customers and gradually, with referrals, she widened her market and diversified her products by accessing new catalogs. It has gone very well for her and for 7 years, she has been a leader of a group of merchants. Oneida has a lot of dreams and she is a very hardworking woman. That is why she is now striving to acquire a larger house, becasue the one she has is too small for her expectations of wellbeing. Her greatest challenge occurred when, due to a lack of experience for choosing clientele, she lost moeny because she gave credit without screening her custoemrs first.  Her Kiva loan is her seventh loan and with it she will buy perfume, cream, liquid soap, household products, sweaters, dyes, lipstick, underwear- all on order from her profitale customers. With her previous loans, she has been able to increase her working capital and reposnd quickly to her main customers. They are her permanent buyers and have helped her sustain herself in the market.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, items for the home, and underwear.

loans.name: Libertad

texts.es:
La señora Libertad es socia del banco comunal Mujeres solidarias, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad y está casada.
Los años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos le han servido para poner su negocio, ella birnda el servicio de copias y venta de algunos artículos de librería. Ha trabajado bastante para poder tener este negocio, uno de sus hijos le ayuda en su negocio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 millares de papel bon, 2 cajas de lapiceros, 1 caja de plumón indeleble, 1 caja de clips, 1 caja de cinta Scott, 1 caja de tiza, 1 ciento de folder de manila, 1 ciento de fas tener, 1 caja de borradores, 1 caja de regla chica.
Con  este préstamo implementará un poco más su negocio. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por facilitarle los préstamos que le permiten continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Libertad is a member of the “Mujeres Solidarias” (Mutually Supportive Women) in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 65 years old and is married.

The years she’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans have served to set up her business.  She provides copying services and sells a few stationery items.  She’s worked quite a bit to be able to have this business; one of her children helps her with it.

She will use the new loan of 3000 new soles to buy:  6 reams of bond paper, 2 boxes of mechanical pencils, 1 box of indelible marker, 1 box of paper clips, 1 box of Scotch tape, 1 box of chalk, 100 Manila folders, 100 fasteners, 1 box of erasers and one box of small rulers.

She will stock her business a bit more with this loan.  She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing the loans that allow her to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy paper, school supplies and office supplies.

loans.name: Solidario La Providencia Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario la provedencia: este grupo esta formado por nueve señoras la cuales tiene su negocio en diferente punto Doña Bertha es la lider D. este grupo ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa nueva al igual que las otras socias ella noe cuenta que nececita el credito para la compra D. ropa nueva ya que esta conciente D. que nececita mas capital para trabajar, el grupo en si nececita este credito para la compra D. ropa nueva para la venta el sueño D. ellas es agrandar mas su negocio y tener un local mas granD. para aumentar sus ganancias,
texts.en:
'La Providencia'

This group is maD. up of nine ladies who each have their own business.  Bertha is the group's leader.  She sells new clothes as do the other group members.  She tells us that she needs a loan to buy new clothes as she is aware that she needs more capital in order to work.  The group as a whole needs this loan to buy new clothes to sell.  Their dream is to further expand their business and have a larger sales location so that they can increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
64-year-old Mkhitar lives in Ddmashen village, in the area of Sevan, with his wife. Mkhitar’s 3 daughters and son have already married and they live separately from their parents. For 30 years Mkhitar had worked as a lorry driver in different organizations.
 
He has been running a farm for about 12 years. On his farm he has cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. He also grows potatoes. With his wife’s help, Mkhitar manages his farm and sells his farm produce (milk, fermented milk, cheese, potatoes) in the Yerevan food market. He and his wife like their occupation and they work very hard, so they were able to organize their children’s weddings, and now they support themselves independently.

Mkhitar needs an 800.000 AMD loan to increase his number of sheep, which will lead to his family’s income growth in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more sheep.

loans.name: Guilda

texts.en:
Guilda is a 27-year-old married woman and mother of two precious children. She works hard to provide them with a good and healthy life.

Guilda began selling clothes two years ago; she sells children's wear and accessories. She started the business to help her husband by increasing the family income to cover their expenses. This is Guilda’s first experience requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. She is preparing to for the holy month of Ramadan celebration, when all kids have to wear new clothes and celebrate the month.

Guilda hopes to expand her business more and more and to introduce women's and men's clothes to her shop as well.

loans.use: To increase her clothing stock for the Holy Ramadan celebration

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es: Adonay, tiene la edad 46 de  años, está casada y vive con su esposo e hijos. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado para el engorde de cerdos. Ella cuenta con varios cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para obtener un engorde más rápido. Ella quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal en un corto plazo para su posterior venta en el mercado local. Elal quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Adonay is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children. With this loan she hopes to purchase concentrate to fatten up her pigs. She has several pigs and she wants to give them food with concentrate so that they will fatten up faster. She wants her animals to reach an ideal weight in a short time period so that she can then sell them in the local market. She wants to generate a greater amount of income for her well-being and for that of her family and to expand her business raising pigs.

This is her first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously she had not received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR granted her this loan with more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to fatten pigs.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa works hard to support five children. She is married and has a buying and selling of corn business in the Philippines.

Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick up from her surroundings.

Ma. Luisa is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cookstove

loans.name: Vyreak

texts.en:
Vyreak (in the photo) and his wife, Seangly, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and one daughter.

Vyreak is a farmer and drives a motor taxi when he is free from farming. His wife is a weaver and also assists her husband in farming. Vyreak is requesting a loan of $200 to buy a water pump and to repair his motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Simiona

texts.es:
Simiona nació en la provincia de Urubamba en la comunidad de Racchi y tiene 46 años de edad,  ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. 

Actualmente, Simiona vive en la misma comunidad donde nació y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la agricultura por lo tanto siembra cebada, trigo, cebada, maíz y otras cosas más, ella se dedica a la crianza  animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. 

En esta oportunidad Simiona requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizante. 

El Banco Comunal “Qorihuayrachina” se reúne cada treinta en la comunidad de Racchi de la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Simiona was born in the province of Urubamba in the community of Racchi and is 46 years old. She is married and has four children.

Currently, Simiona lives in the same community where she was born and where she works. She is a farmer and plants barley, wheat, corn and other crops. She also raises small animals, such as guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.

At present, Simiona needs a loan to buy compost and fertilizer.

The “Qorihuayrachina” communal bank meets every 30 days in the community of Racchi, in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known as a tourist area and for its trade and its traditional celebrations of Inti Raymi and also because one finds here one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 28 years old with two children, none of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business of selling sugar, soda and beer in Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, soda and beer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is married with 5 children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Alma is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 18 years. She requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more feed. Alma has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 7 years. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her livestock

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
Foday, a 42-year-old married father of two children, ages 12 and 18, both of whom attend school, runs a clothing store in Fullah town, located in the central area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. In this business for 25 years, Foday sells trousers, shirts, blouses and bags at his store. His wife conducts a business importing products from the United States of America. His main business challenges are price inflation, stock shortages, and transportation difficulties.

Foday has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothing items. He says that the resulting extra income will help improve his family's living conditions. Grateful for your support, Foday would like to invest in a variety of locations In the future.

loans.use: to purchase more trousers, shirts, blouses ans bags.

loans.name: Upendo A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo A Group in Western Kenya!  Evalyne is the facilitator of the Upendo A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Evalyne takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and in order to have a good harvest. In the recent 2011 season, Evalyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Evalyne was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evalyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Evalyne will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Upendo A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Evalyne is pictured with her group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is 45 years old and married, and the couple has two children. He deals in produce business and has been doing it for two years. Solomon has a challenge of price fluctuations and his business goal is to buy land for crop production. His personal goal is to educate his children. Solomon needs a loan to buy groundnuts and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts and rice to sell.

loans.name: Niven

texts.en:
Niven is a 26-year-old, single woman from Ramallah. 

On January 1st, 2011, together with a partner, Niven opened a salon for women. She would like to have her own salon, which is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to have her own salon.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José es chofer  asalariado afiliado en una de las líneas de radio taxis que operan en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo  requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, pues es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a la familia. José es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en  la zona  de Pasankeri  Sur de la Ciudad de La Paz. Una vez efectuado el análisis financiero el resultado indica que José es sujeto de crédito y puede acceder al mismo.
texts.en:
José is a salaried driver in one of the radio dispatched taxi services operating in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to service his vehicle because it’s his only source of income to support his family.  

Jose is married and has a son.   He lives in his parents’ house located in the Pasankeri zone in the southern part of the city of La Paz.  

The financial analysis done indicated that José qualifies for the loan and can access it.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Аваз проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Аваз занимается шитьем и торговлей чехлов для машин. Этим видом деятельности занимается 18 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Avaz lives in the city Isfara. He is 36 years old and married. He has two children. Avaz works with sewing and trading covers for cars. He has been in this business for 18 years. He takes out a loan to purchase fabric.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Ana Julieta

texts.es: Julieta, nuevamente se decidió a obtener otro préstamo, porque necesita invertirlo en su negocio y comprar más mercadería como: conos, vasitos, sorbeletas y de esa forma podrá tener mejores ventas, con el préstamo anterior pudo observar la diferencia porque mejoro su inventario y aumento en clientes, ayudando mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Julieta has decided to get another loan. She needs to invest in her business and buy more merchandise such as: cones, plastic cups, and straws. This way, she will have better sales. With the previous loan, she was able to see the difference because she improved her inventory and increased her customers, helping to improve her family.

loans.use: to buy cones, plastic cups and straws.

loans.name: Yeny Nancy

texts.es:
Yeny es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene 42 años de edad pero se siente como una joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus playas preciosas y sobre todo por la pesca, yeny como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida, pero el palto que le gusta mas que cualquiera es el riquisimo Caucau, no se cansaria de comer este platillo a diario nos comenta; Yeny solo estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria debido a que sus padres no tenian los suficientes medios economicos, ella desde joven tuvo que trabajar porque tenia la necesidad de aportar en casa.

Yeny trabaja actualmente en su propio negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 40 clientes por dia; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazon para la preparacion de sus platillos, asi como tambien por la amabilidad con la que trata a loa clientes.

Yeny esta muy feliz y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda proporcionada ella podra comprar mesas, sillas, ventiladores para su negocio, con esta mejora sus clientes tendran mas mesas para poder disfrutar de la comida que vende Yeny y estaran mucho mas comodos, con ello podra tener mayores ingresos para asi seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su gran sueño: "tener su local propio de comida"
texts.en:
Yeny is a very hardworking woman who is 42 years old, but feels like a youth of 20.  She lives in the city of Pisco, which is known for its beautiful beaches, and most of all, its fish.  Yeny, like a good Peruvian, enjoys food very much, but the dish that she likes the most is the delicious "Caucau" (tripe stew), which she would never get tired of even if she ate it every day.  She tells us that she has only a 5th grade education, because her parents did not have sufficient resources for her to study more.  Ever since she was young, she had to work in order to contribute to the household.

Now Yeny works in her own business selling food.  She works about 8 hours a day, and she is able to serve up to 40 customers a day.  She believes that her business is doing well because she makes really delicious food, and also because she provides very friendly service to her customers.

Yeny is very happy and appreciative of the Kiva lenders, because with the help that they provide, she will be able to buy tables, chairs, and fans for her business.  With this improvement, her customers will have more tables where they can enjoy the food that Yeny sells, and they will be much more comfortable.  As a result, she will have better earnings so that she can continue to save for her biggest dream - which is to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and fans

loans.name: Sanai's Group

texts.en:
Sanai,a simple lady standing to the right hand side in the photograph hails from a small village of Koraput district,Odisha,India. She lives with her husband who works as an electrician in a local shop and a daughter who is in secondary school. 

Sanai a hardworking woman who for many years has made decorative pieces to beautify homes. She sells them to the people in her community and in the local market.She has a good number of customers due to her polite behavior and unique designs.

She along with her group member has requested a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. Sanai will use her portion of the loan amount to buy paint brushes, paint and good-quality clay. She has a plan to use her income in painting her house and renovate the roof top of the house.Sanai is in dire need of your kind help and support.

loans.use: to buy paint brushes, paint and good-quality clay

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
This description was written by Moses, who represents Village Enterprise Fund and Kiva in Uganda

Village Enterprise Fund (VEF) donated 100$ grant to her in the year 1998. She started with a small business of tomatoes selling and onions. Her business went on well for a period of one year and she was realizing good profits.

In 2000, VEF organized a business training course for all the beneficiaries. She happen to be lucky to be one of the participants in the training.

She was able to learn a lot in a housing profitable business, marketing, book keeping and business strategies. She then divided to change to another business of produce selling. Here she has got better market where by her business is doing well and it has enabled her to buy a lot of produce and feeding together with education of her Children.

The new produce is got from or bought at the rural markets deep in the rural communities. In most cases she buys directly from the farmers who bring their produce in small quantities and sell using cups or basins. These farmers are found in deep rural areas far a way from town. Most farmers grow produce like goundnuts, millet, beans and others in very small scale on individual home basis their are no farms.

Given a loan of US $500 She will be capable of doing so well in her business by expanding her stock and also to meet the high demand of produce in the area.

Being a wife with a vision for the family, I know she will be greatly be helped to develop her family.

loans.use: Increase Stock of Produce

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Five years ago, Pedro lost his job, so he looked for an alternative to earn the necessary income to provide his wife and children with what they needed. This is how he became a taxi driver, an activity he does everyday. He’s had to face difficult times. However, thanks to the huge love he has for his family, and to his great sense of responsibility, he has been able to stand up and continue, always with courage and integrity.

Pedro needs to buy parts for his taxi, which he uses to work. To be able to do this, he needs a loan in the amount of US$475, which he plans to pay back in approximately 5-10 months. Help Pedro and his family, they need your support. Don’t hesitate any longer, they will thank you.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Gabriela Urricariet], Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 5 años Pedro se quedó sin empleo y ante la necesidad de llevar lo necesario a su esposa e hijos, buscó una alternativa que le generara los ingresos necesarios. Es así como comenzó con la actividad que hoy lleva a cabo día a día, taxista. El ha tendido que enfrentar momentos difíciles, pero gracias la enorme amor que le tiene a su familia y al gran sentido de responsabilidad que posee ha podido levantarse y continuar, siempre con la fuerza y entereza necesaria.

Pedro necesita comprar refacciones para el taxi, que es su instrumento de trabajo, pero para poder hacerlo necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que planea regresar en un periodo de 5-10 meses aproximadamente. Ayuda a Pedro y su familia, ellos necesitan de tu apoyo, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo va a agradecer.

loans.use: purchase refactions

loans.name: Noris

texts.en:
Noris G. lives and raises her two daughters, 10-year-old Joann and 5-year-old Yomydi, in the rural town of Restauracion in the province of San Pedro de Macoris, located on the south coast of the Dominican Republic. She runs a business selling filtered water packets and coconut-flavoured ice cream. Since potable tap water is not available in most cities throughout the Dominican Republic, filtered water is in high demand, whether for rehydrating against the high Caribbean temperatures or to wash and prepare food.

This loan will allow her to increase her inventory of water, which is filtered and sealed into plastic bags in about 6-ounce quantities. She will also be able to purchase ice and ingredients for making frozen sweets so that she can take full advantage of her new refrigerator.

NOTE: This $1,000 loan will go to fund Noris' business, as well as four other businesses within her solidarity group. She and four other micro-entrepreneurs in her community came to Esperanza and formed their own group, which they named 'Por Fe Vivimos' or "We Live by Faith." They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive shares of this $1,000 loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the success and struggles of the other members in their group.

loans.use: Purchase filtered water packets and expand inventory of four other businesses.

loans.name: Amina Hassan

texts.en:
Amina is married and has two children. She lives in the Zakheem area in Dar es Salaam. Amina owns a small canteen near the KTM Textile industry in Dar es Salaam. She sells cold drinks, breakfast and lunch to mostly industrial workers. Amina has received entrepreneurship and business training from Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO) in Dar es Salaam. This training has helped her a lot. She knows how to keep records of her business and utilize opportunities that come around.

In usual working hours, her business is normally flocked with customers in need of services. Inadequate facilities hamper her efforts. She needs to expand her business by adding dining chairs and tables, food serving dishes and a stock of cold drinks. To facilitate this expansion she is in need of USD 750 as working capital. Amina's dream is to have one day a professional catering business.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and food storage dishes

loans.name: Py

texts.en: Py K. is a 21 year old widow who works at a hotel, with a daily income of $2. She has 3 children, all of whom are students. She would like to take out this loan so that she can purchase a motorbike so that she can get to work without having to pay for a moto-taxi. In the long run she believes this will save her money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to go to work

loans.name: Vuth

texts.en: Mrs. Vuth A., age 39, works as a farmer, selling her vegetables in her community for about $3 per day. Her husband works grinding rice crops for the villagers, earning about $3 per day as well. They have five children. Two children are employed in a garment factory making about $70 per month each, and three children are students. In order to purchase a hand-tractor to more efficiently till the soil in her field, she would like to borrow $1,100. This will allow her to increase her crop output and thus increase her income to provide an education for her children. Her husband is pictured in front of the tractor she would like to purchase for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor for farming.

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es:
Elvin is a hard-working man that has sacrificed much and dedicated himself to his business since its inception. His initial investment capital was the result of a family collection, as his economic situation was not good at the time.

Today, his sacrifice has borne out, and besides being a respected worker and owner, he is also a model father to his to children (one in primary school and one infant). His wife, for her part, encourages him to continue forward for himself as well as for the well-being of the entire family.

Since starting to work with CEPRODEL, Elvin’s business conditions have improved; he has seen additional gains since managing to acquire furniture and equipment for the store as well as increase his inventory. His record consists of thirteen credits in two years.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Elvin es un hombre trabajador que se ha dedicado a su negocio desde sus inicios con mucho sacrificio. Su primer capital invertido fue fruto de una recolecta familiar, ya que su situación económica no era nada buena en ese momento.

Hoy en día su sacrificio ha dado fruto y ademas de ser un digno propietario y trabajador, es a la vez un ejemplo de padre para sus dos hijos (1 estudiante de primaria y un bebe). Su esposa por su parte lo alienta a seguir adelante tanto por el mismo como por el bienestar de toda su familia.

Para Elvin, desde que inicio a trabajar con CEPRODEL sus condiciones en el negocio han mejorado, ha sido que ha tenido ventajas ya que ha logrado adquirir mobiliario y equipo asi como incrementar su inventario. Su récord es de 13 créditos en 2 años.

loans.use: Purchase of products and goods

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti A. is 23 years old, married with one child aged 8. Her husband, Hendra, has no fixed income. So, to provide the family's needs, she sells cellphone accessories and prepaid phone vouchers at her small kiosk. She usually earns about US$ 20 per week and that is not enough to cover her family's daily needs. She's requesting a loan to expand her business. Siti A. is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business selling cellphone accessories

loans.name: Comité Las Amigas Group

texts.en:
The committee is comprised of 22 working women of the Kennedy neighborhood who all own small informal businesses. Together they received some money, about $150 USD for each group member, from a group of businesswomen. There are very demanding standards for this group of Caacupé women. They are expected to be punctual to every meeting and seminar held. If they are not able to attend the meeting they are to give a reason why, and if it is not sufficient, the woman must pay a monetary fine.

The committee also does many good things for the community including putting on festivities for Children’s Day, in the chapel of the neighborhood. They serviced over 200 children with goodies and sweets, a gift raffle and fun games in 2007. They also organized the cleaning of the blocks in their neighborhood.

This group of women has the objective to demonstrate that in this neighborhood there is an organized and caring group of women who want to see change for the better. They have come up with a budget for their business expenses and are asking for a loan in order to purchases more goods to make Chipas along with groceries and clothes to sell.

loans.use: Some women will buy  material to make Chipas, famous and popular Parguayan snacks which are made from starch, cheese, and vegetable oil.  Other women will purchase clothes to sell, while some need to purchase food and merchandise like food and refreshments.

loans.name: Ramón Filadelfo

texts.es:
Since 25 years Ramón M. has been a livestock farmer, he breeds calves, cows, heifers and bulls in Villanueva, municipality of Chinandega in Nicaragua.

He is married and has 5 children whom he needs to support and give a proper education to.

Ramón M. has improved his financial situation because he has been able to wisely use the loans he has received from Ceprodel to breed his animals. Nowadays, his biggest dream is to expand his business and to also offer animal derivates (as dairy products) in the surroundings of Chinandenga.

Therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramón M. desde hace 25 años se dedica al trabajo de la ganadería y agropecuaria criando terneros, vacas, vaquillas y toros en Villanueva municipio de Chinandega en Nicaragua. Es casado y con 5 hijos de los cuales debe de alimentar y proporcionarles la educación requerida.

Ramón M. ha logrado mejorar su situación financiera por el hecho de que ha sabido hacer uso de los créditos que Ceprodel le ha brindado para la crianza de los animales. Hoy en día su mayor sueño es expandir su negocio y ofrecer los productos derivados de los animales en las afueras de Chinandega. Su mayor necesidad hoy en día es la adquisición de dinero par la compra de vacas.

loans.use: To buy more cows in order to sell dairy products

loans.name: Hidawa's Group

texts.en: Hidawa H., Fatuma M., Sharifa Hamis make up the Jiendeleze group. For the past six years, Hidawa, the group leader, has run a stationery shop, in the Tabata area.
