Next to the shop, she also sells soft drinks and snacks. All members of this group are requesting a loan to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: Expand stationery shop and secretarial services

loans.name: Katherine's Group

texts.en:
Katherine resides in Mian Channu, a small city in Pakistan, with her family consisting of her husband and four kids: three boys and one girl. Katherine is a lady health worker and provides health services to the people of her community while her eldest son runs a grocery store in a nearby busy market and her husband is a farmer. They would like a loan to improve their grocery store.

Katherine has few other members in her group: Noora will use the loan to expand their little grocery store; Suriya wants to buy wood; Sakina and Mukhtara both want to buy cattle for their businesses.

loans.use: Improve their grocery store

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru:
Zarina K. lives in Tursun-Zoda in Tajikistan. She is 23 years old and makes a living selling children's clothes. Her market stall is located at the "Sahovat" market in Dushanbe. Zarina has been managing her business for the last 5 years. She lives with her parents and helps them support the family. Right now Zarina wants to purchase new inventory and needs to take out a loan to finance the purchase. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Каримова Зарина проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 23 года. Занимается торговлей детской одежды. Торговая точка находится на рынке « Саховат» города Душанбе. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 5 лет. Живет с родителями и помогает им обеспечивать семью. Сейчас хочет завести новый ассортимент товара , поэтому решила получить кредит. Погасить его она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim E. S. is 53 years old and lives in Saida South, Lebanon, where he owns a photography studio, photographs events and is a specialist in picture "montage". This is Salim’s first loan request from Al Majmoua. He needs $1,100 as working capital to purchase cameras, film rolls and photo frames. Salim, a hard worker, devotes very long hours to his livelihood to cover events and increase his revenues, thereby providing good living conditions for his wife and three children.

loans.use: To purchase cameras, film rolls and pictures frames.

loans.name: Colombiano

texts.fr:
Born around 1973 in Pobè in Plateau County in the southeast of Benin, Mr. Colombiano D. S. is married and the father of two children, Abdel (12) in 7th grade and Nazaire (7) in second grade. Trained carpenter, he purchases massive wooden beams in Tchèti, a village in the center of Benin, to use for making furniture which he then sells. He also sells charcoal. He is asking for this loan for financial reasons so that he can fill some orders he has received.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1973 à Pobè dans le département du Plateau au Sud-est du Bénin, Monsieur D. S. Colombiano est marié et père de 2 enfants Abdel âgé de 12 ans en classe de Sixième au secondaire et Nazaire âgé de 7 ans est écolier en classe de CE1. Menuisier de profession, il achète à Tchèti un village du centre Bénin des madriers pour la fabrication des meubles qu'il revend. Il vend également du charbon de bois. Il sollicite ce crédit pour des raisons financières afin d'exécuter les commandes qu'il a reçues.

loans.use:
Purchase of 6 massive wooden beams and 20 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 6 madriers de bois massif et de 20 sacs de charbon.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Dame H. Emilienne est née le 20 Décembre 1964 à Houéyogbé dans le département de l'OUEME au BENIN. D'ethnie XWLA, elle est mariée à monsieur ADAM Mathurin, agent comptable dans une société de Cotonou. Elle vend dans son quartier repas prêt à manger tels que de la pâte faite à base de farine de maïs et du riz au gras près d'un gros magasins de stockage de ferraille. Compte tenu de l'exigence de sa clientèle composée pour la grande majorité de chargeurs, elle compte varier son offre. Elle vient solliciter son troisième prêt pour répondre aux attentes de ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilienne H. was born on December 29, 1964 in Houéyogbé in the department of OUEME in BENIN. She is an ethnic XWLA and is married to Mr.Mathurin ADAM, an accountant in a company in Cotonou. She sells ready to eat meals, such as a paste made with corn flour and fatty rice. She is located in her neighborhood, near a large scrap metal store. Recognising her highly demanding customers, who are for the most part loaders, she is hoping to vary her offerings. She is requesting her third loan to fulfill the expectations of her clients.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one bag of manioc, one bag of rice and half a bag of varied seasonings.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 52-year-old Mwanahamisi S., a widow with eight children. She started a business of selling cereals such as maize, millet, sorghum, etc., which are all widely available in Tanzania because the economy is 70% agricultural and these cereals comprise a primary portion of the local diet. She now focuses on selling maize because it is the most marketable, being used to make ugaali, a staple food in this country. She earns about 180 USD in profit monthly from this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase maize in bulk. In the future, she hopes to increase the scale of her business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk for resale

loans.name: Nith

texts.en: Nith S., 35, is married with six children living at home in the Kampong Cham province. She works in construction, typically making US$1 each day and her husband has a business operating a motor-taxi. Her husband typically makes about US$3 each day. Nith S. would like a loan of US$500 to breed cows to sell. This loan would allow their family to increase their profits from raising the cow along with their daily income.

loans.use: Nith would like to breed cows to sell.

loans.name: Katy Karina

texts.es:
La señora Katy pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en el Jr. Callería Nº 670, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de  hijas menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pescado.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, la venta de pescado. Trabaja de Lunes a Sábado de 6 a.m. a 7 p.m. y los Domingos de 6 a.m. a 1 p.m. 

Con este préstamo de S/1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 4 bandejas de pescado para vender a sus clientes.  

Katy se siente feliz porque pertenece a un banquito comunal de mujeres trabajadoras y responsables. Desea seguir surgiendo en la vida.
texts.en:
Katy belongs to the Community Bank 'Nuevo Eden', located in the Jr Calleria No 670, in the district of Yarinacocha, in the province of Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali. She is 29 years old and she has young kids who depend on her. She is married and her husband is independent in his work. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in selling fish.

Currently she has the same business - selling fish. She works from Monday to Saturday from 6am to 7pm and Sundays from 6am - 1pm.

With this loan of 1000 soles, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy 4 trays of fish to sell to her clients.

Katy is happy because she belongs to a community bank for hard-working and responsible women. She wants to keep going on in life.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 4 trays of fish/Comprará 4 bandejas de pescado.

loans.name: Naqibullah

texts.en: Naqibullah, a hard-working young man is 20 years old and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is always busy with the work on the land, doing cultivation to support a family of 7 members. He has worked since 2006 on this land, so he has got all the responsibility for his family. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afs to buy some needed tools specific to agriculture and seeds so as to have more profit and a good monthly income.

loans.use: buying tools and seeds for the land

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es: Marcia tiene 43 años, es madre de una hija quien cursa estudios universitarios y vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda en lo posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, en las instalaciones de su vivienda, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 2 años atrás, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente, con quienes trata sobre diferentes temas. Este negocio le es rentable porque ella no paga alquiler de local, además, cuenta con una clientela selecta y fiel a su bodega. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos en los créditos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita ampliará su tienda y comprará más productos para surtir mejor sus estantes.
texts.en:
Marcia is 43 years old and has a daughter studing in university. She lives with her husband who helps her as much as he can. She sells groceries and staple products from her home. She has been in business for 2 years and she enjoys meeting all the people with whom she can speak about all sorts of topics. The business is profitable because she does not have to pay rent for the premises, in addition she has a good customer base who are faithful to her store. This is her 4th loan with MFP; she has shown that she is responsible with her previous loans. She will use this loan to expand her store and purchase more products in order to better stock the shelves.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the products of her store.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina tiene 32 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con su hijo Alex de 7 años en la casa de unos familiares. Se dedica desde hace 4 años al negocio del servicio de lavandería para mantener a su pequeño hijo debido a que debe hacerlo sola. La jornada diaria de Reina empieza desde las 6 de la mañana y termina a las 6 de la tarde, realiza el lavado de las prendas del centro de salud de la ciudad de Juliaca, las cuales debe mantener limpias durante todo el día como es necesario en un hospital, es así que luego de su trabajo regresa muy cansada, pero felizmente la remuneración es buena, dándole esperanzas a Reina de un futuro mejor. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, el dinero solicitado le servirá de capital para un nuevo negocio que pueda desarrollar paralelo a su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Reina is 32 years old, is separated from her partner, and lives with her 7-year-old son in a multi-family house. She has been running a laundry service for 4 years, in order to provide for her young son, which she must do alone. Reina's daily routine starts at 6 in the morning and ends at 6 in the evening, since laundering clothing is at the center of health in the city of Juliaca, and clothing should be kept clean all day, as is necessary in a hospital. Because of this, her work makes her very tired, but, happily, the reward is good, giving hope to Reina for a better future. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and the money from the loan will serve as capital for a new business, which she can develop parallel to her daily work.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for a new business

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina S. owns a vending facility in the central city market selling women’s clothing. She has been in this trade for 3 years. Her turnover capital has doubled since she started her small business.She is divorced with a 6-year-old son Sergei. She lives in Kherson, Ukraine

Yekaterina has a perfect credit history in Nadiya, Ukraine. She has repaid all her loans without any delinquencies. Yekaterina believes a loan of 5,000 (UAH) will help her increase her working capital and profits. She wants to purchase more variety of women's clothing and expand her marketing area. Yekaterina has become a entrepreneur through hard work and dedication and believe this will help her succeed in the future.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothing items

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Cette femme  habite le quartier d’agoè au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle est une femme très dynamique, n’étant pas mariée elle  travaille  dur pour subvenir aux charges de ses deux enfants. Elle vend de la boisson locale appelée « toucoutou », cette boisson est très appréciée au nord Togo et est faite à base de farine de mils. Actuellement son stock de mil est épuisé, elle demande son premier prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de mils.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the Agoè neighborhood, in the north of the city of Lomé. She's a very energetic woman, who works hard to support her two children since she's unmarried. She sells a local beverage called "toucoutou", made out of millet flour and very much appreciated in North Togo. She's currently out of stock of millet, and she's seeking her first loan to buy 10 sacks of millet.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of millet

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric O. has sold shoes in Cape Coast since 1999.  He is married with one child and has received his senior high school degree. His wife works as a trader.  

He is responsible for paying rent, utilities, and other household necessities.  Eric's loan will be used to buy more shoes to expand his business.  He hopes to use the new profits from his business to buy land.

loans.use: Buy more shoes to expand his business.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 33 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos en edad escolar. Implementó su negocio en su propia casa, se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, ella es Técnica en Enfermería de profesión, y también brinda el servicio de aplicar inyecciones, pero solo bajo receta médica. En esta actividad tiene un periodo de 2 años, y atiende durante todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus pacientes, los mismos se sienten bien y la recomiendan. Más adelante, Luz quiere ambientar un consultorio con todo lo necesario, así como un espacio para la venta de medicinas para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Con este, ya son 5 préstamos que trabaja con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque los integrantes se ayudan entre sí y son organizados. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más medicamentos para ir implementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is 33 years old. She lives with her partner and father of her 4 children, who are all in schooling age. She implemented her business selling medications at her own home. Her profession is Nurse Technician so she can also apply injections under medical prescription. She has been doing this type of activity for two years. She receives patients all day long. What Luz likes about her job is that she can give her patients a good attention, which makes them feel well and recommend her. Luz wants to eventually have her own clinic with all the equipment necessary and have a different space to sell medication and give her patients a better reception. This loan would be her 5th with MFP. She likes working with her communal bank because the members help each other out and are organized. Luz will use this loan to purchase medications to keep on building her business.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en: Ngen N. is 41 years old, a widow with two children and resides in the Kampong Cham. She sells cakes, desserts and groceries. On average, she is able to make US$8 in revenue. One of her children is a student and the other one is a worker. Nhen N. is asking for a loan to purchase ingredients and rice so that she can make cake and dessert to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and rice.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses K. is 29 years old. He is single and lives independently. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. He takes care of some younger siblings. Moses is a trader of hardware such as cement, plywood, nails, roofing sheets, etc. He sells in a store on one of the streets in his community. Moses procures his wares from suppliers in the big cities. He wants a loan to procure materials such as plywood, foam, nails, etc., in bulk. He has been in business for one year. He is hoping to expand his business and save for his future before he gets married.

loans.use: To buy hardware

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Al Progreso Group

texts.en:
This group has been with Fundación Paraguaya for more than two years and are in their tenth cycle of operation. Each woman took out a loan of between 300,000 and 1,000,000 Gs. They have group saving of 3,321,080 Gs (approximately $665). They are all neighbors and live just outside the city of Ciudad del Este. This group also has weekly quilting and crocheting activities, for the benefit of the group.

1. Victorina Cardoso ..... Food sales 
2. Carmen B. ..... Food sales 
3. Claudia B. ..... Food sales 
4. Cristina E. ..... Crochet sales 
5. Egresielda A. ..... Undergarment sales 
6. Celia G. ..... Fruit and vegetable sales 
7. Gilda Lezguizamon ..... Perfume sales 
8. Mirta S. ..... Hair salon 
9. Maria M. ..... Clothing sales 
10. Norma L. ..... Chicken and vegetable sales
11. Lourdes J.  ..... Clothing sales 
12. Virginia A. ..... Food sales 
13. Gladys Z. ..... Jewelry and silver sales 
14. Gerarda Cardoso ..... Dressmaker 
15. Constancia G. ..... Small grocery store 
16. Mirian Cardoso ..... Small grocery store 
17. Angela G. ..... Clothing sales

loans.use: To purchase items for their individual businesses

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha :  Juana María A. M., Sandra del Socorro J. Velásquez  y  Eugenia Martínez.

Doña Juana María es comerciante de sandalias de mujer, ofrece en todos los estilos, ella comercializa en los departamentos de Rivas, Managua y Masaya. Le ayuda su esposo con los gastos de la casa, trabaja en una zona franca. Tiene a su cargo dos hijos. Sueña con mejorar su casa y dar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.

Doña Sandra del Socorro es la coordinadora del grupo, es persona muy responsable y líder del grupo. Se dedica a la venta de ropa interior y cosméticos, tiene muchos clientes que le piden encargos para sus hijos y familia. El préstamo lo ocupa en comprar ropa por docena en el mercado Oriental de Managua, compra ropa de mujer y de niño porque es la que mas vende.
Ella sueña con mejorar algunas partes de su casa y tener mejores ingresos.

Eugenia Martínez vende zapatos de forma ambulante, le ayuda su hijo que ya es joven, se dividen zonas de los departamentos para vender más, ella compra el calzado en los talleres de Masaya a buen precio, tiene muchos clientes. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar porque trabaja como obrero en una zona franca.
Ella sueña con poder tener mías clientes para su producto y ayudar a su hijo a estudiar
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Juana María A. M., Sandra del Socorro J. Velásquez and Eugenia Martínez.
Juana María sells women’s sandals in all styles. She works in the Rivas, Managua and Masaya districts. Her husband helps her cover household expenses and works in a free trade zone; they have two children. She dreams of making improvements on her home and improving her children’s quality of life.
Sandra del Socorro is the group coordinator. She is a very responsable person and leads the group. She sells underwear and cosmetics, and has many customers who make orders for their children and families. She is using the loan to purchase garments by the dozen in Managua’s Oriental market. She buys women’s and children’s clothing because they are the most profitable. She dreams of making improvements on parts of her house and of increasing her income.
Eugenia Martínez sells shoes as a street vendor and her son, who is already a young man, helps her. They divide up the district zones in order to make more sales. She buys footwear from the Masaya shoemakers at a good price, and has many customers. Her husband helps her pay the bills because he works as a labourer in a free trade zone. She dreams of having more customers and of supporting her son’s studies.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes to sell as street vendors

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.
Timotea es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Timotea junto a sus hijos tiene un taller D. elaboración D. artesanías como tejido D. carteras y tallado en piedra D. Huamanga (alabastro), productos que son comercializados a la ciudad D. Lima y también en el mercado artesanal en donD. tiene un puesto.
Timotea necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. piedra D. Huamanga.
Los sueños D. Timotea son ser una empresaria en artesanía, vender directamente sus productos y tener un puesto en la ciudad D. Lima.
texts.en:
Timotea is a member of the communal bank group “Azucenas” (the Lilies).

Timotea is 48 years old, married and has 6 children. Together with her children, she operates a handicrafts workshop where they make cloth handbags and Huamanga stone carvings (maD. of alabaster). They market their products in the city of Lima and also in the arts and crafts marketplace where they have a vending post.

She needs a loan of 1800 soles to purchase Huamanga stone. She hopes to continue in the crafts business and would like to have her own shop in Lima where she can sell her products directly to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Huamanga stone

loans.name: Komadia 1 De Sogola Group

texts.fr:
Composé de dix  femmes mariées, les membres du groupe KOMADIA 1 ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux, dans le village de SOGOLA de la commune urbaine de BOUGOUNI relevant de la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de mariage. 
Pour mieux entretenir leurs exploitations agricoles afin d’améliorer leur production elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt agricole et tous les précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt ces femmes comptent acheter 15 sacs d’engrais dont 10 sacs de complexe céréales et 5 sacs d’urée, 200kg de semence d’arachide et des prestations de charrue pour labourer les exploitations (à savoir 4 hectares d’arachide et 3 hectares de maïs). Tous les intrants agricoles seront achetés sur le marché de BOUGOUNI. 
En fin de campagne, elles comptent sur une production totale de 3 tonnes d’arachide graine et 9 tonnes de maïs. La consommation familiale va prendre une partie dans cette  production et  le reste sera vendu au comptant sur le marché BOUGOUNI pour les permettre de rembourser le prêt et supporter certaines charges familiales. 
Ces femmes espèrent obtenir un bénéfice de 350 000 FCFA en fin de campagne qui sera  utilisé pour soutenir les frais d’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
Composed of ten married women, the group KOMADIA 1 has members averaging 42 years of age and 6 children. The women all live in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children, and spouses in the village of SOGOLA, in the town of BOUGOUNI, belonging to the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. These women know one another by ties of marriage. To maintain their farms better, in order to improve their production, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their fifth farm loan. All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy 15 sacks of fertilizer, including 10 sacks of a blend for grains, 5 sacks of urea, 200 kg of peanut seeds, and plowing services to work the fields (namely 4 hectares of peanuts and 3 hectares of corn). All farm supplies will be purchased at the BOUGOUNI marketplace. At the end of the planting campaign, the group members plan on a total production of 3 tonnes of peanuts and 9 tonnes of corn. Home consumption will take up a portion of this production, and the rest will be sold in cash at the BOUGOUNI marketplace in order to allow for the repayment of the loan and for covering certain family expenses. These women hope to obtain a profit of 350,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting campaign. The profit will be used towards the costs of raising children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting, farm supplies, and the cost of labor

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 45 years old and married with 3 children. She sells building and tailoring materials. She has been in the business for more than 18 years. This business is the source of her income. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more building and tailoring materials to sell.  She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: sales of building and tailoring materials

loans.name: Susana Elisbeth

texts.es:
Susana tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y sus tres hermanos en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año, gracias a sus ahorros y al apoyo de sus padres, ha creado una pequeña bodega – tienda dentro del mercado José Balta, un mercado de la ciudad de Chiclayo, donde vende artículos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y golosinas.

Ella atiende en su puesto todas las mañanas y parte de la tarde, y durante la noche, estudia Inglés en un instituto de la ciudad, lo recaudado en su negocio lo utiliza para pagarse sus estudios y para apoyar en casa con la educación de sus tres hermanos.

Susana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, por este motivo se encuentra solictando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su mas grande anhelo es seguir ayudando a sus hermanos y hacer crecer su negocio para tener, en el futuro, una fuente de ingreso económico estable para sustentar a su familia.

Ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, tanto de su barrio como del mercado, los que la consideran una chica alegre y optimista.
texts.en:
Susana is 19 years old, single, and lives with her parents and three siblings in the José Leonardo Ortiz district, located 5 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year, thanks to the help from her parents, she has created and run a small store inside the José Balta market, which is a market in Chiclayo where she sells necessities such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil. She also sells groceries and little candies. Susana stays with her shop every morning, part of the afternoon and through the night. She studies English in a city institute, and uses what she makes from her business to pay for her classes and to support her household and especially the education of her three siblings. Susana wishes to expand her business by buying a larger variety of products to offer to her clients, and for this reason she is asking for 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) that would help her accomplish her goal. Her greatest longing is to keep helping her siblings, and grow her business to have, in the future, a stable source of income to support her family. She is very well known and esteemed by her neighbors, so much that the vendors around her consider her a very happy and optimistic girl.

Translated from Spanish by Mitchell Usher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying necessities and groceries to sell

loans.name: Zenaida Lidia

texts.es:
Zenaida es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Zenaida es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Zenaida tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual tiene un conductor y ella se encarga de la cobranza.
Zenaida necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento del carro.
Los sueños de Zenaida son educar a sus hijos y ahorrar para ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Para el mantenimiento del carro.

loans.name: Rosa Armida

texts.es:
La señora ROSA tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de SALPO, provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3ero de primaria porque de niña se dedico a trabajar en el campo.
ROSA es conviviente   y tiene 3  hijos todos  quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
ROSA se dedica a la venta de  productos alimenticios en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
Compra arroz,azucar,fideos,atun,aceite,gaseosa,golosinas,galletas,detergente,jabone,etc en la cuidad de Trujillo en donde los compra a menor precio para así poder obtener mayores ganancias.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos alimenticios al por mayor para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
Este crédito de 700 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de productos alimenticios al por mayor así como también de cerveza.
ROSA   sueña con ampliar su tienda y aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: lo utilizará en la compra de productos alimenticios al por mayor así como también de cerveza.

loans.name: Roke M.

texts.en:
Roke M. K. is age thirty-five, is married to a businesswoman, and they have four children who are attending primary and secondary schools.

Roke is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to pay school fees for his children and to invest in his business. He has sold slippers and flip-flops and used clothes for over four years now.

loans.use: To pay school fees and to invest in his business

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr:
Monsieur D. Traoré est un homme marié de quarante ans ayant  cinq enfants et vivant dans une famille monogame traditionnel à Dangassa, un des villages (située à 70  kilomètres de Bamako) relevant de la deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.  
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel et le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter, une tonne d’arachide et 600  kilogrammes  de maïs qu’il vend au marché de Dangassa où il s’approvisionne également deux fois par mois auprès des producteurs et des grossistes.
Il espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen trimestriel de 170. 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer l’échéance du prêt et investir le reste dans son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. D. Traoré is a married man with 5 children and they live in a traditional, monogamous family in Dangassa, one of the towns (located 70 kilometers from Bamako) of the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. With the goal of satisfying his growing clientele, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. This is his second individual loan and he fully repaid his first loan. With this loan he will purchase one ton of peacnuts and 600 kilograms of corn, which he will sell in the market of Dangassa. In Dangassa, he also supplies himself equally twice a month, purchasing goods directly from the farmers and the wholesalers. With this loan he hopes to earn an average quarterly income of 170,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay his loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains

loans.name: Gracierra

texts.fr: A. Gracierra est née vers 1970 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Gracierra vit depuis 25 ans à Ahito à Allada. Mariée à AZANDEGBE Koffi un mécanicien, Gracierra est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Seul le conjoint assure les charges de la famille. Gracierra n’a jamais été à l’école. Depuis près de 30 ans, Gracierra vend des condiments (tomate fraîche, piment, poivre, cube, etc.), des divers (sardine, tomate en boîte, pâtes alimentaire, etc.) et de l’huile de palme à son domicile. Gracierra s’approvisionne à Allada et à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Gracierra est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédit dans l’institution et qui les a bien remboursés. Gracierra voudrait agrandir davantage son activité afin de couvrir les besoins de ses clients en période de fêtes. C’est pourquoi Gracierra sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Gracierra A. was born around 1970 in the Atlantic Department of Bénin. For 25 years Gracierra has lived in Ahito in Allada. She is married to Koffi AZANDEGBE, who is a mechanic. Only one spouse supports the family. She has 5 children. Some of them are students. She never attended school. For more than 30 years, she has earned a living selling miscellaneous food from her home, including condiments such as fresh tomato, chili pepper, black pepper, and seasoning cubes, as well as canned sardines and tomatoes, pastas and palm oil. She buys her goods in Bénin’s economic capital, Cotonou. As one of ALIDEé’s long-term clients, she has already received and repaid three previous loans. She wants this 4th loan to stock up for her clients’ needs during the upcoming year-end holidays.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 1 of peppers, 4 crates of canned conserves.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mr. Thol P., 38 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthy Lac, 31 years old, (pictured together) were married in 1996 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both in school. They live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Thol and his wife are farmers. They grow corn, bitter gourd and green beans. The couple doesn’t have enough capital to maintain their farm, so Thol is asking for his first loan of $500 to pay plowing fees and to purchase fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To pay plowing fees and to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Mr. Seik Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Seik K. is the village bank president for a group which consists of thirteen people who are located in the village of Kampao in the province of Takeo.  All the members will use the loan for different purposes.  

Mr. Seik K. is an ice cream seller. Aside from this business, he is also a palm juice collector. He currently needs money to buy equipment to make palm sugar to sell. His wife, Mrs. Kim Oun, is a farmer who owns a small plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Seik K. is 37 years old and the father of four children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy equipment to make palm sugar to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is forty-one years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community.

Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in yams. She procures the yams from nearby farming communities and supplies to food vendors and retailers in her community. Elizabeth has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy yams for resale

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es:
Isaac, de 25 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador. Vive en su casa propia junto a su madre, Luz de 52 años, a quien desea dar una vejez tranquila.

A su corta edad es el encargado de administrar los dos negocios que su madre comenzó hace algunos años atrás. Con mucho trabajo a logrado sacar adelante la bodega y el restaurante que le han dado los ingresos necesarios a su familia para vivir, es por eso que pone todo su empeño en brindarles a sus clientes la mejor de las atenciones, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el progreso de sus negocios.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que le permite realizar sus estudios universitarios al mismo tiempo que cumple con sus negocios, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse muy temprano para limpiar y arreglar el restaurante. 
Para más adelante, espera que sus negocios sigan creciendo y le puedan brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Isaac con MFP y tiene el firme compromiso de no fallar en sus pagos y de ser responsable con el resto de las socias de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Isaac, 25 years old, is a very cheerful and hard working young man. He lives in his own house next to his mother, Luz, who is 52 years old and wishes to have a tranquil life as she grows old. At his young age, Isaac is in charge of running the businesses that his mother began years ago. Through a lot of hard work, he has been able to get ahead with his bodega and restaurant which earn the money necessary to live. For this reason, he puts all of his effort towards offering his customers the best service possible, especially since he knows that they depend on the progress of his businesses. What he likes best about his work is that it allows him to complete his university classes at the same time as running his businesses. He has been doing this for seven years and considers the most difficult thing to be having to get up very early to clean and arrange the restaurant. For the future, he hopes that his businesses continue growing and provide him with a higher income. This is his first loan with MFP and has a firm commitment to not default on his payments and to be responsible with the rest of his community bank's partners. With the 1,000 Nuevos Soles he is requesting, he will buy more products to incorporate into his grocery store's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of Merchandise

loans.name: Lucena Guisihan Group

texts.en:
Lucena G. is from the village of Poblacion, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Lucena is the group leader for a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lucena is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucena owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lucena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lucena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Antonia del Carmen V. elabora y vende tortillas, doña Toña como cariñozamente se le conoce en su barrio tiene que levantarse muy temprano para elaborar sus tortillas y que esten bien calientitas antes de que los clientes se vayan a sus centros de trabajo. este negocio es muy bueno aqui en la zona ya que la mayoria de los pobladores consumen tortillas.
imaginence ustedes que hay personas que no pueden llevarse un poco de comida si no es con tortillas..
la tarea de Doña Toña como madre ya termino, pero tiene dos nietos a su cargo los que ella cuida ya que su hija trabaja fuera de casa.
necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para la produccion de sus tortillas,.
texts.en:
Antonia del Carmen V. makes and sells tortillas. DoñaToña, as she is affectionately called in her neighborhood, has to get up very early in the morning to make the tortillas so that they will be nice and hot before her customers go off to their work sites. This business is very good in the area because most of the inhabitants eat tortillas; just imagine that there are people who are incapable of eating even a small bite of food if they can't do it with a tortilla. Doña Toña's work as a mother has ended; however, she has two granchildren under her care because her daughter works outside the home. She needs funding to buy tortilla raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour, lime powder, firewood, water.

loans.name: Josefina Amanda

texts.es:
Josefina tiene 37 años de edad, es separada y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive en el sector El Sausal, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en su domicilio. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para mantener a su pequeño hijo y sacarlo adelante, por lo que mantenerlo es de suma importancia para ella, este es el motivo por el que Josefina siempre da lo mejor de si para mantener su negocio ofreciendo productos de calidad y dando buen trato a los clientes.

El negocio esta teniendo buena acogida y su clientela se esta aumentando, por ello Josefina ha pensado en comprar mas abarrotes para ampliarlo, para lograr su objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada por los vecinos de la zona, ellos la consideran una persona luchadora, reponsable y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Josefina is 37 years old, separated from her spouse, and has a dependent child. She lives in the sector of El Sausal, a marginally urban area of the city of Lambayeque, located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, Josefina has been selling basic necessity products and groceries from her home. This business is the only source of income by which she is able to support her young son and get ahead. Providing for her son is of great importance to her. For this reason, Josefina always gives her best to maintain her business by offering quality products and giving her customers good service.

Josefina’s business has been well-received and her clientele is growing. She is thinking about buying more groceries to expand her inventory, but in order to achieve this objective, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 PEN. Josefina is well-known and respected by the neighbors in her area. They consider her to be a determined, responsible, and trustworthy person. Her greatest wish is to continue developing as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to expand her inventory

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua B. is married and has two children. She has not received any form of education. Akosua is a seamstress, selling clothing materials and beans as well at Jukwa. Her husband is a commercial driver. Akosua’s income is used to help her husband maintain the welfare of their home. Akosua will use her loan to purchase more clothing materials and other sewing supplies to sew for her demanding customers. With the new income from her expanded business, Akosua plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita C., from the village of Tolon, is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elenita has been selling jewelry for over eight years, earning a monthly net income of about 10,000.00.

In 2006, Elenita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC that was used as additional capital for her business, she is requesting a new loan, her eighth, of 50,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Mas

texts.en:
Mas T. is 35 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than seven years. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier or at the river, which is full of fishermen.

She married but then divorced her husband when her two children were very young. Mas T. uses her old motorcycle that has often broken down when she delivers her fish. She wants to replace her old motor but she doesn't have money to do that. This is why Mas T. decided to request a loan of $800 from Kiva's field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To replace her old motor.

loans.name: Alberata

texts.pt:
A cliente nasceu em Maputo, aos 01 de Outubro de 1983. Estudou ate 12 classe e parou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive com o esposo que e policia. Tem dois filhos,envia a mesada para os pais pois vivem com os filhos da cliente em causa. Passou a sua infancia no Bairro de Chamanculo onde se conheceu com o seu marido, casaram e mudaram-se para o Bairro de Nkobe no Municipio da Matola a dois anos e vivem numa casa propria.

A cliente trabalha na Escola Primaria Completa de Chamissava, com a categoria professional de docente auferindo o salario mensal de 5.699,00(cinco mil seiscentos noventa e nove meticais). Este e o primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku, nunca teve emprestimo em nenhum Banco.  Teve o conhecimento dos servicos da Hluvuku atraves dum colega de servico na Escola Primaria complete de Chamissava que tambem e cliente  desta instituicao. Pretende solicitar mais  emprestimos na Hluvuku.

Com este valor pretende comecar coma sua obra no Bairro onde reside, no que sae na foto ela e o seu marido. Tem como desafio ver sua obra concluida e o seu maior sonho e de adquirir uma viatura, pois, da casa da cliente para a paragem, terminal de Nkobe sao cerca de 4km. E mesmo chegando a paragem ha dificuldades de transporte.
texts.en:
Alberata was born in Maputo on October 1st, 1983. She studied until 12th grade and had to stop due to financial difficulties. She lives with her husband who is a policeman. They have two children, and she send money to her parents. She spent her childhood in the district of Chamanculo where she met her husband. They got married and moved to Nkobe district in Matola two years ago, and live in their own house. Alberata works at the Chamissava Elementary School as a teacher, and makes U$164 per month. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, and she's never had a loan with any other bank. She heard of Hluvuku from a workmate who's a client. She intends to start building her house in the neighborhood she lives with her husband, pictured with her. Her biggest dream is to finish that construction and later on buy a car, because it's 4km from her house to the closest bus station.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction supplies

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Patricia U. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para invertir en el negocio en mercaría y arreglos de fiestas y ocasiones especiales. Pero no cuenta con el dinero para invertir ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio es la fuente de ingreso para su familia.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio de ropa y arreglos.
texts.en:
Carmen Patricia U. is thankful for her previous access to credit. She is once again requesting a loan in order to invest her business through the purchase of merchandise and supplies for parties and special occasions. She does not have the funds to make this investment, as she does not want to reduce her business’ capital level, since it is the source of income for her family. She plans to pay for the loan using part of the earnings she obtains through her enterprise’s sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Elbia Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana tiene 59 años ella tiene una hija de 34 años, se dedica al tejido de chompas de lana de alpaca (marca alpaandina) se dedica a esta actividad desde los 19 años de edad, teje en sus ratos libres ya que ella labora en un institución de promoción  agropecuaria,  estudio Biología. El préstamo que obtuvo  lo invertirá para la compra de  lana y palitos de tejer.
Tatiana menciona que la época de verano los pedidos de sus productos. Su meta es tener una tienda o un puesto donde vender sus productos.
Menciona que las capacitaciones que ofrece Finca Perú son muy interesantes ya que gracias a ello, ella es una mejor persona y tiene mayor auto confianza.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 59 years old, and has a daughter who is 34. Tatiana knits woolen sweaters of Alpaca (the fur of the Andean alpaca). She has dedicated herself to this activity since she was 19 years old. She knits in her free time, since she works in an institution that promotes agriculture. She studied biology. The loan she sought will be invested in supplies of wool and knitting needles. Tatiana says that in the summer, orders for her creations increase (for winter sale). Her goal is to have a store or a post where she can sell her products. And she mentioned that the training offered by Finca Peru is very interesting and that thanks to this, she is a better person and has more self confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING ALPACA WOOL AND KNITTING NEEDLES.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian A. feels very happy because she has been able to repay on time the whole amount of the loan she received previously from Kiva through ASHI. Despite the challenge she faced with her previous business of rice retailing, wherein some of her capital was used to sustain her husband’s transportation business, still she feels she made the right decision. It was through the income earned by her husband that she has been able to pay back the amount loaned to her. With what had happen to her business previously, Vivian realized that earnings are greater in the transportation business than in rice retailing. In their community a lot of people are into rice retailing and therefore demand for the rice is low. Now that she has another opportunity to request a loan, Vivian wants to spend it on improving and maintaining her husband’s tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar). She plans to purchase tricycle spare parts and pay for reconditioning. Vivian also wants to venture into another two business which are selling frozen foods (processed foods) and hog raising. After four months of raising her hogs, they will be sold per kilo, either alive or slaughtered, direct to people in their village. Vivian thinks that the frozen foods will be salable because everyone in the community is looking for a convenient way of preparing food for their children before they go to school, just like she did for her children when they were still small. Just like other small children in their village, her apos (grandchildren) are always fond of eating processed food such as marinated pork and chicken and that is why she is inspired to include these in the items she will sell.

loans.use: To recondition her husband's tricycle and to purchase frozen foods to sell and a piglet to raise

loans.name: Millicent Auma

texts.en: Millicent Auma W. is a business lady who sells clothes. She started this business in 2002 to generate income for her and her family as a way of supporting her husband in providing for the family, as she doesn’t believe that it is the responsibility of the husband alone to do so. She travels weekly to Nairobi to purchase her stock. She is married and a mother of four (4) children at the age of 34 years. She stays in Nyalenda Kisumu. Millicent would wish to expand her business, having learned about how loans and savings uplift business people. She would wish to get a loan worth Ksh.50000 that will be used to add more stock to be able to meet the demand that is on the rise for her clothing.

loans.use: To add more clothing inventory

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia reside en la colonia san José departamento de Morazán san francisco gotera, ella vive con su hijo de 38 años el cual tiene problemas mentales y las medicinas se las compra de lo que ella obtiene de la venta de tortillas.
Ella vende tortillas dos veces al día en la mañana comienza a preparar a las 7 y en la tarde a las 3 y termina de vender a las 5 de la tarde, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 29 años. 
El crédito lo invertirá una cantidad para la compra de maíz y leña y la otra parte para ponerle energía eléctrica a su casa porque no tiene y el no tener energía le dificulta para levantarse temprano a empezar el procedimiento de las tortillas.
Esto le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de su hijo y de esta manera salir adelante con su negocio ya que la situación económica está muy difícil.
Sus aspiraciones es tener energía en su casa y lograr tener las medicinas de su hijo a disposición
texts.en:
Cecilia is a resident of the San Jose colony of the Morazan San Francisco Gotera region. She lives with her 38-year old son who is handicapped. The medicines tha the needs are purchased with her earnings from selling tortillas. She sells tortially two times per day, starting to make them at 7 in the morning. She sells at 3pm and by 5pm she has sold out. She has been running her business for 29 years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of corn, firewood, and a part will be used to bring electricity to her home. She has a difficult time getting up to make tortillas in the morning when it's still dark. This loan will help her improve the living conditions for herself and for her son. She would like to see an improved success because their financial situation is currently very difficult. Her hopes are to have electricity in her home and to be able to supply he rson with the medicines that he requires.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn and firewood, and to bring electricity to her home.

loans.name: John M.

texts.en: John is married to a trader and has four dependents. He sells used bags in Makeni. John has over 15 years of experience in this type of business and has a reputation for being both honest and reliable. John initially got his start-up capital from the sale of his livestock in the city. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy used bags at wholesale prices. John plans to use the proceeds to educate his children and to build a house in the future. He thanks you for supporting him.

loans.use: To buy used bags for resale

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda G. is from the village of Victoria. She is 44 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting & selling a variety of vegetables. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services designed to increase her crop yield. This will be Imelda’s 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services designed to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Haidelyn's Group

texts.en:
Haidelyn E. is from the city of Minsubong Tangub City. She is 20 years old. Haidelyn is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Haidelyn is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Haidelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas, corn, sweet potatoes, and cassava for sale. Haidelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Haidelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haidelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Haidelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
This is Norly N., a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is blessed with a child, a young adult who is currently enrolled in high school. By the grace of God, Norly has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to continue sending her child all the way through college.

Norly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies in at a wholesale price and selling at a piece rate. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 200 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Norly dreams to be able to move to another city with more expansion opportunities for her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao K. is a 46-year-old single mother living in a village in Kompong Chhnang Province. She doesn’t have a life partner as her husband divorced her when her child was very small. Mrs. Mao K. has only one child, who is a garment worker and has a proper salary. 

She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited over ten years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops three months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy some sacks of fertilizer for improving her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer for improving her crop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth U. is from the village of Brgy. Ibung, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 30 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rony Albert

texts.es:
Rony tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el centro del distrito de Mórrope, una zona en donde se concentra bastante comercio. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, el compra diversos animales menores en los diversos caseríos que se encuentran cerca de la zona en donde reside, los engorda y luego los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre frecuentan la zona y al público en general, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de su familia.

Rony desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales, asimismo desea arreglar sus corrales, para realizar estas acciones ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Rony es un joven bastante trabajador y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y le consideran un muchacho responsable.
texts.en:
Rony, 22, is single and lives with his parents in the center of Mórrope district, a district where quite a bit of commerce is concentrated.  It belongs to Lambayeque province and is forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He raises small farm animals to sell.  He buys various animals in the areas surrounding his home, fattens them up and then sells them to merchants that frequent the area always as well as to the general public.  Income he earns he uses to cover his personal expenses and to help his parents support the family.

Rony wants to expand his business buying more animals.  He also wants to repair the animal pens.  To do this he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

Rony is quite a hard working young man who very much wants to get ahead in life.  People who know him hold him in high regard and consider him to be a responsible young man.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and repair pens to expand his animal raising and sales business.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a twenty-six-year-old hardworking man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of being able to adequately provide basic needs to his family.  He is employed at a health unit and his meager salary has helped him pay school fees, though with challenges of late payments. Fred needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Akossouwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa is 50 years old and has three children. She is married to a retailer. In order to make a contribution to the household, she sells sundries (food products, kitchen utensils, beauty products and colorful African cloth). She already has 20 years experience in this business. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé and resells at her home. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her business and make a significant profit.
texts.en: Akossiwa is 50 years old and has three children. She is married to a retailer. In order to make a contribution to the household, she sells sundries (food products, kitchen utensils, beauty products and colorful African cloth). She already has 20 years experience in this business. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé and resells at her home. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her business and make a significant profit.

loans.use: Purchase of food products and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda, es socia del Banco Comunal Los Ladrilleros de Compañía, tiene 52 años, esta casada y tiene 7 hijos. Hilda se dedica a la siembra y venta de verduras. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abonos, herbecidas, medicamentos. Hilda vive en la Comunidad de Compañía, donde posee un terreno y siembra todo tipo de verduras como: zanahoria, coliflor, col, poro, lechuga, betarraga, apio, nabo, etc, aprendió de está actividad desde muy niña de sus padres ahora lo práctica con sus hijos, claro cuando ellos disponen de tiempo, porque estudian. Hilda todos los días lleva sus verduras al mercado mayorista Nery García Zarate.
Le gusta Finca, porque accede a los créditos y puede ahorrar y gracias sus ahorros puede educar a sus hijos.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan su propio negocio
texts.en: Hilda is a member of the Los Ladrilleros de Compañía Community Bank. She is 52, married, and has 7 children. Hilda sows and sells vegetables. She will invest this requested loan in the purchase of fertilizers, herbicides and medicines. Hilda lives in the Compañía Community, where she owns a plot of land and sows all types of vegetables such as- carrots, cauliflower, cabbage, leeks, lettuce, beets, celery, turnips, etc. She learned this work from her parents at a young age, and now does it with her children--when they have time, because they are in school. Hilda brings her vegetables to the Nery Garcia Zarate wholesale market every day. She likes Finca because she is getting loans and can save--and thanks to her savings, she can educate her children. Her dream is for her children to be professionals and for her family to have their own business.

loans.use: the purchase of fertilizers, herbicides and medicines

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. sells food items and maize in Elmina. She is a widow taking care of six dependents. She also sees to the general upkeep of the home. 

Her loan will be added to her working capital to expand her maize business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children. 

Adjoa is showing the maize she sells.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: Hannah Wairimu

texts.en: Hannah has practiced dairy farming in Naivasha for the last five years. She is 26 years old, married to Samuel Ndungu and they have four chldren. Hannah was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of KES 30,000 well and in good time. Hannah plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow. In the future, Hannah hopes to develop her dairy business and be able to supply milk in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Neria

texts.en:
Neria is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and a manicure/pedicure/weaving business.  She lives in Bantayan, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.  Neria is borrowing PHP 29,000 to fund the operations of her businesses. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Neria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To fund the operations of her businesses

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda, tiene 35 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella vive en la comunidad de Tambo Real distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La socia Leonarda es trabajadora y emprendedora busca el bienestar de su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de leche y queso. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Leonarda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar leche para hacer ricos quesos andinos. 

Leonarda pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 35 years old and has a son.  She lives in the Tambo Real community in the district of Anta, department of Cusco.  She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who seeks a comfortable lifestyle for her family.  She has been selling milk and cheese for several years and this business is doing well thanks to her hard work.  Leonarda is in need of a loan to buy milk to make rich Andean cheese.

She is a member of the "San Bartolomé de Tambo Real" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy milk to make rich Andean cheese

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice N. is currently in a business selling food. She is 30 years old  and married to a policeman. They have six children, all of them in school. Her future goal is to build a shop.

loans.use: to stock more food

loans.name: Manolo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Manolo; el tiene 34 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de transporte, el realiza servicio de taxi desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el socio por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a su hijo, el socio quiere comprar artefactos para su casa. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una television para implementar su casa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Manolo belongs to the Siempre Unidos (Always United) village bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province in the department of Cusco.

Manolo is 34 years old, married with one child.  He works in the transportation field, running a taxi service from 6 am to 7 pm.  He is able to earn enough to provide for his child.  He would like to purchase appliances for his home.  He is requesting the loan to purchase a television for his home.

He is happy to receive the loan and commits to repay it punctually.

loans.use: to purchase a television for his home

loans.name: Leopoldina Ambrocia

texts.es: Leopoldina tiene 50 años, es una mujer luchadora y alegre, y a pesar de los constantes problemas que afronta, siempre busca la forma de salir adelante. Desde muy temprano se temprano ella se dedica a la venta de dulces, tiene más de 17 años en su negocio. Como todo negocio lo inicio con fondos propios y no fue fácil, ya que después tenía que salir a vender sus productos de manera ambulante. Por lo que solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsas, azúcar, leche, leña, tasas, cucharas entre otros. Sueña con hacer más grande su establecimiento y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leopoldina, age 50, is a determined and cheerful woman. Despite the constant problems she has had to face, she is always looking for ways to move forward. She begins her job selling sweets early in the morning. Leopoldina has been in this business for more than 17 years. Like all other entrepreneurs, she started her business using her own funds. Things did not begin easily since she had to sell her products as a traveling vendor.

Leopoldina is requesting a loan to buy bags, sugar, milk, firewood, cups, spoons, and other supplies. Her dreams include expanding her establishment and making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase bags, sugar, milk, firewood, cups, spoons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha A. O. is 37 years old and a single mother of four. She runs a salon with two employees and has been in business for three years. She has been able to equip her salon with her loans from Faulu Kenya.

Tabitha has requested a loan for 30,000 KES to buy hair weaves and hair chemicals. In the future, she hopes to open another salon in a different area.

loans.use: To buy hair weaves and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Shamam

texts.en:
Shamam lives in Yerevan with her daughter and son. She sells clothes from a rented booth at the city market.

Shamam wishes to sell more clothes and increase her working capital. With the requested loan she plans to purchase more clothing and increase her trade. As a result Shamam will increase her income and be able to insure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Makhir

texts.ru:
Makhir jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Makhir 42 qoda. On uje 4 qoda kak rabotayet taxistom. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mahsini tak kak on ne mojet perevozit kliyentov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi.
texts.en:
Makhir lives in Baku with his family.  He is married and has two children.  Makhir is 42 years old.  He has been a taxi driver for four years. 
 
Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his car since he cannot carry passengers without it.  He started his business with his uncle.

loans.use: to buy parts to repair his taxi

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.
