La  socia Ana tiene 32 años de edad; la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración de su restaurante; la socia tiene su restaurante y ella misma se encarga de la elaboración de platos y del muenu diario, también ve el manejo de las mozas y cobra en caja el dinero correspondiente, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de productos de primera necesidad al por mayor, ella comprara arroz, aceite, fideos y de este modo le saldrá a cuenta los gastos realizados; la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de arroz, fideos, aceite para su restaurante.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the "Sr. de Tayancani" community bank.  She lives in Ocongate district, in Quispicanchis, in Cusco department.

Ana is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her household chores and running her restaurant business.  Ana owns a restaurant and she is in charge of preparing the different dishes and the daily menu.  She also oversees the waitresses and works the till.  She would like to invest her loan in buying essential products (rice, oil and noodles) wholesale.  In this way, it will not cost her as much.

Ana is requesting this loan to buy rice, noodles and oil for her restaurant.  She appreciates the loan that she has been granted and is infinitely grateful for it because it will allow her to grow in her business and improve her quality of life.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying rice, noodles and oil for her restaurant

loans.name: El Bosque Group

texts.es: La señora Margarita es natural D. Lima, tiene 57 años, casada y con 03 hijos, tiene un negocio familiar dedicado a la venta D. materiales D. construccion  especialmente a la venta D. ladrillos empezaron aproximadamente hace doce años, la señora Margarita al inicio vendia pollo en el mercado y su esposo era chofer D. camion, juntaron un buen capital y compraron su primer camioncito luego empezaron a realizar servicio D. carga y finalmente se dedicaron D. lleno a la venta D. materiales D. construccion. Su meta es poder tener una cadena D. ferreterias.
texts.en:
Margarita is a native of Lima, 57 years old, and married with 3 children. She has a family business dedicated to selling construction materials, especially bricks. The business began approximately 12 years ago. 

Initially, Margarita sold chicken in the market and her husband was a truck driver. They gathered a good amount of capital and bought their first small delivery truck. Then they began to haul goods and, finally, they dedicated themselves full time to selling construction materials.

Their goal is to have a chain of hardware stores.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, mainly construction products.

loans.name: Falidah's Group

texts.en:
Falidah's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Falidah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Kampala, Central Region, Uganda. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Falidah's business is a market stall that sells vegetables, which she has had for less than one year. She sells charcoal as a second business.  

To help expand her business, Falidah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase vegetables and charcoal for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Falidah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Falidah hopes to expand her business and fry some fresh fish. Falidah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns an average of PHP 43,000 every harvest. He is already 57 years old and is married with three children. As head of the family, Herminio is trying his best to give his family a comfortable living.

He wanted to create a more productive farming business. Thus, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy a sufficient supply of seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his farm to ensure a better yield. Herminio grows rice and has been doing this for 30 years now.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino, tiene la edad 42 de  años, está casado y vive con esposa e hijo. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con un lote sembrado de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un cafetal que genere una gran producción para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar  ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus familia y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 42, is married living with his wife and son.  He intends to use the loan for coffee crop maintenance.  He has a lot planted with coffee and he intends to invest in supplies like manure and fungicide to obtain a better harvest.  He wants to install a coffee plantation that produces a large harvest to sell quality coffee.  He wants to generate profits for his and his family’s wellbeing and to grow with his coffee project.

This is his first Fudecosur loan. He’s had no previous loans from state banks.  Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en:
Rossana is 37 years old, married and a mother of seven. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where growing and selling corn is her main source of income. She has been tilling the land for 18 years with her husband, earning approximately PHP 9,000 a month, which helps to meet the family's needs.

In 2008, Rossana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her previous loan repaid, she is now requesting her second one for PHP 5,000 to pay for land preparation costs to start the next cycle of production. Future revenue will be invested in land expansion and planting productive root crops, legumes, shrubs, etc.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation costs.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem is 39 years old and earns $1 a day as a farmer. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 a day. They have two children, both of whom are in school. The family's monthly expenses include $30 for food, $3 for electricity, $8 for school fees, $10 on transportation and $13 on other items. Kem is applying for a loan for $500 to buy a motorbike which her husband can use to travel to and from work, and a cow if possible. In the future, she would like to open a grocery store in her home.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use for commuting.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Challabamba y tiene 46 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo.  

Actualmente, Claudio vive en la  ciudad de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, .él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y también trabaja en la municipalidad de Huancarani en el área de Obras. Claudio requiere el micro crédito para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Claudio was born in the province of Paucartambo, in the city of Challabamba.  He is 46 years old and married, and has a son from this relationship.

Currently Claudio lives in the city of Huancarani, which is where he works.  He works in agriculture and livestock, and also works for the municipality of Huancarani in the Works department.

Claudio is requesting the micro-loan to buy small animals such as guinea-pigs and hens.

The "Once de Mayo - Huancarani" Communal Bank meets monthly in the district of Huancarani, which is in Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco (in Peru).  Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea-pigs and hens.

loans.name: Ahadi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira, leader du groupe d’affaire «Ahadi», est  entrepreneur, âgée de 43  ans, mariée, mère de plusieurs  enfants et petits fils et filles. Son mari est un mécanicien. Elle est  vendeuse de bananes (plantains). Elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre depuis sa jeunesse. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 9 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  15 régimes de bananes et réaliser d’autres micros projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et scolariser ses enfants.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: Kavira is the leader of the "Ahadi" business group. She is a 43-year-old entrepreneur and the mother and grandmother of several boys and girls. Her husband is a mechanic and she has been in sales since she was a young girl. She currently sells bananas (plantains). She got her initial capital from her husband and has already completed 9 loan cycles with Hekima. She will use this new loan to buy 15 bunches of plantains and realize some small family projects. Kavira also hopes to be able to cover her children´s educational expenses and watch them grow up comfortably. She would like to thank Hekima for helping disadvantaged women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 15 bunches of plantains for resale and realize some small family projects.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun is a resident of Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province, where people depend on agribusiness for most of their incomes. Mrs. Bun and her husband have been engaged in agriculture for years. Together they are able to earn approximately $5USD per day through farming. Now they are blessed with two children, both of whom are young and live under her care.

Mrs. Bun is looking for a loan from HKL, one of Kiva’s partners, to purchase a motorcycle for use by the family without hiring any motorcycle services. This loan will make her family's life more comfortable.

In the future Mrs. Bun wishes to have a plowing machine for growing her rice crops and to send her children to study in a local school. She would like to say thanks to all lenders that always kindly help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for using in the family.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is 36 years old and married with two children between 16 to 18 years old. She lives in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. She owns a bar and has been in this business for three years, having started with meager capital. Since then, she has seen her capital grow to her great joy and hopes that it will continue to grow. Robinah wants to have a beer depot in the future and she is requesting a loan to buy a fridge for cooling her drinks at the pub.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for cooling her drinks at the pub.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 33 years old. She is married to Daniel and together they have three children aged nine, seven and four years old. She operates a green grocer and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of KES 6,560 from the business.

This is her first loan term in KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to buy tomatoes, potatoes ,vegetables and fruits for resale. She will pay school fees for her children from the anticipated profits. Her dream is to build a home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Lumicho B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Lumicho B Group in Western Kenya! This  group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Chrispinus is the facilitator of the Lumicho B Group. He takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Chrispinus had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Chrispinus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Chrispinus will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Lumicho B Group will each plant  between half and 1 acre of maize.
Chrispinus is pictured with his group members in the photograph, with their Field Officer on the far left.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Lamrana. She is widow with two children ages 12 and 14 who both attend school. Lamrana also supports her two nieces who live with her since she is in the city, where there are better schools. In 2000, Lamrana established a business selling cereals and groundnuts. She began her business because her late father believed that girls were not meant for school, so she was not able to attend school. Since her mother was a businesswoman, Lamrana decided to join her, and she has had her business since she was a teenager. She works 10-hour days, seven days a week, and earns about 2,866,000 SLL each month. She has an outdoor stall and the rainy season is her major challenge as she has enough goods to meet her customer’s needs. Lamrana serves housewives and people around the city center, serving over 10 people each day with good prices. She employs a cousin to help her and she gets her supplies wholesale from neighboring villages. 

Lamrana is requesting a 4,500,000 SLL loan to purchase groundnuts, benni seeds, and soya beans. She has repaid two previous loans. She feels that her loans are a great help because she cannot do business without money. Lamrana is excited about the status of her business and hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 430,000 SLL.  In the future, she plans to build a house.  If Lamrana is given chance to access more loans, she wants expand to a much better business location.  Lamrana is hardworking and honest and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of groundnuts, two bags of benni seeds, and two-and-a-half bags of soya beans

loans.name: Marakaru B Group

texts.en:
Jackline takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 2 ½ bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. With income from maize sales, she will build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

Jackline is the facilitator of the Marakaru B Group. Jackline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Marakaru B Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jackoine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marco Angel

texts.es:
Marco Angel pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepcion De Pilcopata” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pilcopata de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. 

Marco Angel tiene 53 años de edad y tiene seis hijos, él nació en la ciudad Pilcolpata y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Marco Angel desde hace 27 años que se dedica a la brindar servicio de lavado de carros y mantenimiento de carros. 

En esta oportunidad Marco Angel  requiere el préstamo para comprar herramientas como por ejemplo taladros, esmeriles, llaves y compresoras. Marco Angel se encuentra agradecido  a la Asociación Arariwa por que fue  la primera entidad financiera que le préstamo capital para el taller mecánico. 

Marco Angel agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Marco Ángel belongs to the “Inmaculada Concepción De Pilcopata” communal bank and the bank’s meetings take place monthly in the city of Pilcopata in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department.

Marco Ángel is 53 years old and has six children.  He was born in the city of Pilcopata and this is where he carries out his economic activities.  For the last 27 years Marco Ángel has been providing car repair and car washing services.

On this occasion, Marco Ángel needs the loan to buy tools like drills, polishers, wrenches and compressors.  Marco Ángel is grateful to Asociación Arariwa because it was the first financial entity that lent him capital for his machine shop.  He values and appreciates the loan and commits to make his monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Saiyora

texts.ru: Сайёра замужем и в воспитании имеет двух несовершеннолетних детей. Она целеустремленная и добрая женщина. Сайёра более 15 лет занимается торговлей. Её торговая точка находится  на центральном рынке города. Она продает канцелярские товары и промтовары. Сайёра работает усердно, чтобы стать успешным предпринимателем. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки новых товаров с целью пополнения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Saiyora is married and is raising two minor children. She is a purposeful and good woman. Saiyora has worked in retail for more than 15 years. Her outlet is located in the central market in town. She sells office supplies and manufactured goods. 

Saiyora works diligently to become a successful entrepreneur. She would like to receive a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni for the purchase of merchandise to re-stock.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and gas to make tortillas.

loans.name: Darwin Stalin

texts.es:
Darwin Stalin tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los papás en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Darwin se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz además trabaja desojado maíz de otrs personas. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para arrendar terrenos, comprar abonos, líquido para maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los líquidos para las plagas.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas como la alangosta y el cogollera. El sueñlo es poder comprar terrenos y seguir trabajando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Darwin Stalin, 24, is single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.
 
Darwin is a member of the LA UNION community bank in the rural Ventanas town of Aguas Frias. The members of the community bank operate farming businesses. They grow maize, rice, beans, etc. 

Darwin grows maize for a living. He also works as a laborer for other farmers. He buys what he needs in Ventanas and sells whatever he has to sell there, too. 

Darwin is applying for a loan to rent fields and buy supplies--seeds, fertilizers, weed-killer, etc..--that he needs for the business. 

Darwin particularly wants to buy supplies for killing the insects--alangosta and cogollera--that destroy his maize crop.  Your help will allow him to buy the supplies he needs.  His hope for the future is to buy his own land. 

In his spare time, he enjoys walks.

loans.use: to rent farmland and buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita offers charcoal and a variety of vegetables within her local community. She is 46 years of age, married, and blessed with five children. Four of her children are still attending school, while the other one left is her helper in running their farming business.

Lucita would like to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal and a variety of vegetables to sell, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She hopes to obtain her requested loan amount so that she can meet all of her family's basic needs and educate her four children.

loans.use: to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Raimati's Group

texts.en:
Raimati,standing to the left hand side in the photograph hails from a small village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband who is a farmer engaged in paddy and maize cultivation and her two daughters. Raimati has undergone very tough times due to her prevailing financial crisis, but somehow she was able to overcome those tough days due to her strong will power and determination.

Raimati along with her group member has requested for a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. Raimati will use her portion of the loan amount in order to purchase a new automated sewing machine in order to reduce manual work and increase her work efficiency so as to gain higher number of orders and increase her income and become financially self sufficient.

She aspires to expand her business and start making soft toys and increase her market outreach in the near future. She is eagerly awaiting for your kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a new automated sewing machine in order to reduce manual work and increase her work efficiency

loans.name: Zara

texts.en:
This loan will be administered with the help of Peace Corps volunteers in Sliven, Bulgaria

Zara I. works in Sliven, Bulgaria. She has run her own tailoring shop in the center of the town for the past three years, and lives in a small village on the outskirts of town with her husband and two small children. She mends and makes simple clothes for people in the neighborhood. However, her primary sewing machine has become unreliable and she does not have the financial ability to purchase a new one.

With this loan, she plans to do two things. First, she will purchase a new sewing machine. Secondly, she will fix up the back of her store where people will be able to try on the clothes she alters or makes for them. The flexibility of the Kiva loan has special significance for Zara, given her familyâ€™s situation. Her husband, who has been unable to find outside employment, tends to the familyâ€™s garden, the produce of which will be sold in the summer of 2006. With a portion of the proceeds from the harvest, she plans to repay the majority of the loan principal, the remainder of which will be repaid in the early fall of 2006 out of the cash flow of her business.

loans.use: Capital expense (new sewing machine and renovations)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rhoda would like to buy 3 young steers.

loans.name: Saina

texts.en: Saina is the proprietor of one of the busiest stores in her village.  Her store is open from 6.00a – 10.00p seven days a week.  Saiana’s hard work and strong performance history has made it possible for her to be eligible for her fifth SPBD loan.  She is one of the longest-running SPBD members in her region, and her success has been a strong example for other women entrepreneurs in the region.  She has used the previous four SPBD loans to start up and finance the growth of her shop, and she is seeking a fifth loan to improve the reliability of her supply and further expand the products available to the local villagers.

loans.use: :  Enhance, stock and expand her village store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tomato and onion business

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano and his family are small dairy and subsistence farmers. On weekends, he travels to La Paz to work as a stevedore in the local markets, supplementing his income so that he'll be able to support his wife and eight children. They live in the village of Tahari - Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase an additional dairy cow to increase milk production and, as a result, increase his family's income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Feliciano y su familia, son productores de leche y se dedican a la agricultura solo para su alimentación; los fines de semana el va para la ciudad de La Paz a trabajar de cargador (esta profesion de cargador es similar a la de los estibadores en los puertos, donde cargan mercaderias para los clientes que compran productos) en la ferias populares. Asi puede tener un poco mas de ingresos con los que mantiene a la familia (8 hijos y esposa). Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito requiere para comprar una vaca lechera y de esa forma incrementar la producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos para su familia. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ni Made Rani

texts.id:
Besides being a tenant farmer Made Rani also owns a side business that is profitable by raising pigs. With a capital of Rp1,700,000 (about US$200), and a simple stall behind her home, made from batako and seng roof, Made Rani raised 1 mother pig and 4 fattening piglets. This stall is used to help husband Wayan Suartika to fullfil household needs. The pigs were bought from a friend who has raised pigs since a long time. With 2 children to raise, and a simple home made from batako, and while the woven bamboo kitchen was worn out, did not made Made Rani gave up on her work. That even made Rani more serious in her business. In 8 months Made Rani could profit Rp1,500,000 (about $170) from sales of piglets and 4 pig feedstock. This profit was used to re-make the kitchen and build parts of the house, so that if there were not enough pig feed, Made Rani find traditional food of: banana tree trunk and kangkoon. Made Rani is very patient in raising her pigs. Profits made will very much help family's future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Selain sebagai petani Made Rani juga memiliki usaha sampingan yang sangat menguntungkan yaitu memelihara babi. Dengan modal Rp.1.700.000,- dan kandang yang sederhana dibelakang rumahnya,yang terbuat dari batako dan atap seng,Made Rani memelihara 1 induk babi dan 4 bibit penggemukan. Kandang ini dimanfaat untuk usaha membantu suami Wayan Suartika dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Babi ini dibeli dari sahabatnya yang sudah memelihara babi sejak lama. Denagan menanggung 2 orang anak,dan tinggal dirumah yang sederhana,terbuat dari batako,sedangkan dapur masih kumuh yang hanya terbuat dari gedeg,tidak membuat Made Rani putus asa dalam berusaha.Bahkan Rani sangat serius menjalani usaha ini.Keuntungan yang didapat sangat membantu untuk keperluan keluarga. Dalam 8 bulan Made Rani meraup keuntungan Rp.1.500.000,- yaitu keuntungan anak babi dan penjualan 4 bibit babinya. Keuntungan ini digunakan sebagian untuk membuat dapur dan membuat rumah yang masih harus dibangun sebagian.sehingga,bila pakan babi kurang Made Rani mencari pakan Tradisional berupa : batang pisang dan Kangkung.Made rani sangat telaten dalam mengurus babinya.Karena Keuntungan yang didapat sangat membantu masa depan keluarganya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feed & feedstock

Membeli pakan dan bibit babi

loans.name: Siti Mujiani

texts.id:
Every day from 5:00 AM to 12:00 PM, Siti Mujiani is selling vegatables in Kepaon market. Distance from her home to the market is 15 minutes by motor cycle. Since she is selling vegetables, she has to prepare it fresh. In the evening, she prepared the vegetables for next day's sale. She bought it from a wholesaler in Badung market by the kilograms. Profit from this business is about Rp80,000 (about US$8.40)/day. This income very much help her husband who works as a taxi driver, with no fix income. Siti has 4 children with daily expenses of Rp40,000 (about US$4.20)/day, and education expense of Rp300,000 (about US$32)/month.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap hari dari pukul 05.00 pagi sampai dengan 12.00 siang Siti Mujiani berjualan sayuran di Pasar Kepaon. Jarak yang dia harus tempuh menuju pasar dari kediamannya adalah 15 menit dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. Karena yang dia jual adalah sayur, maka dia harus menyediakannya dalam keadaan segar. Sore hari sebelumnya ia menyediakan sayuran yang akan dijual keesokan harinya. Ia membelinya di pengepul di Pasar Badung dengan harga kiloan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari usaha ini sebesar Rp 80.000,00/hari. Hal ini sangat membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai sopir taksi dengan penghasilan yang tidak tetap. Siti memiliki 4 orang anak dengan biaya hidup perhari Rp 40.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak sebesar Rp 300.000,00 per bulan.

loans.use:
To pay shop rent in market

Bayar sewa toko di pasar

loans.name: Esperanza Gloria

texts.es:
Esperanza lives in the spa town of Las Delicias, in the Trujillo province. She is 38 years old and finished secondary school. She has four children who depend on her. She has a business in the market of Las Delicias selling vegetables, grocery items, ground peppers and condiments. She used to dedicate herself to taking care of her home, but 9 years ago she had the idea to start a business in the market, and since then she has not stopped working.

Esperanze is a member of the group called Mientras Tanto, Siempre Unidas (always united). She received her first loan through this group which she used to buy the blender she needed to grind the peppers. The one she had was in very bad condition. With this loan, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy rice, potatoes, canned goods, onions and condiments. Her dream is to have her own shop one day, as she currently has to rent the space she has.

La señora Esperanza vive en el balneario Las Delicias del Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo, Departamento de La Libertad, tiene 38 años de edad; estudió secundaria completa. Tiene 4 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Actualmente tiene su negocio en el mercado de Las Delicias, vende verduras, abarrotes, ajíes molidos y condimentos, anteriormente se dedicaba a su hogar, hace 9 años tuvo la idea de emprender este negocio en el mercado, desde entonces no ha dejado de trabajar. La señora Esperanza es una de las socias fundadoras del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Unidas” en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró una licuadora que necesitaba para moler los ajíes ya que la que tenía estaba en muy mal estado. Con este préstamo de S/.1,000 que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará conservas, arroz, papa, cebolla y condimentos. El sueño de la señora Esperanza es tener un puesto propio porque el que tiene es alquilado.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE RICE, CANNED GOODS, ETC TO BETTER STOCK HER SMALL BUSINESS, GROWING HER BUSINESS AND SAVING ENOUGH TO ONE DAY HAVE HER OWN SHOP.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a member of the communal bank "The Jasmines," located in Moyabamba, San Martín, Perú. After her experience working at a commercial outlet she decided to start her own business, selling clothes house-to-house, and then eventually opened her own grocery store so as to watch over her youngest children while working. She sells dried goods, bread, vegetables, soft drinks, meat and more.

Esther is 28 years old and since a young age has stood out as a strong-willed woman, hard-working, responsible and persevering. She dreams of opening a restaurant since she she likes to cook and is skilled in the kitchen.

With her six month US $850 loan she plans to stock up on products such as soap, 50 kg sacks of rice, sugar, vegetables, vegetable oil, boxed milk, toilet paper, preserved fish and fruit, snacks, kitchenware, and even clothes for adults and children.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther es socia del banco comunal “Los Jazmines”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Dado la experiencia que tenía en la compra y venta de mercadería como empleada de una tienda comercial decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa que los ofrecía casa por casa, luego para poder atender mejor a sus menores hijos instaló en su propia casa del Jr. Oscar Benavides Nº 100 una bodega en la que diariamente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, panes, verduras, bebidas gaseosas, carnes y otros. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón de diferentes marcas, sacos de 50 kilogramos de arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades, botellas de aceite en litros, lecha en cajas, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, diversas golosinas, además de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y artículos para cocina y de esa manera poder satisfacer el pedido de su basta clientela. Tiene 28 años y desde muy joven se ha destacado por ser una mujer luchadora, muy trabajadora responsable y perseverante. Sueña con tener un restaurante porque también le gusta cocinar y tiene buena sazón. y sobre todo estar en contacto con las demás personas.

loans.use: Stock up on products for her grocery store

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old he is married and has two daughters, one of them studying in primary school. He is living in a rented house and his old father lives with him. He has an old taxi and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new engine and new tires, and to paint and renovate the taxi. He wants to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new engine and new tires

loans.name: Tobadina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Tobadina M.. She is married, and has four children with ages from 11 to 17. In 1998, Tobadina established her clothing and grains business. Tobadina has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock of clothing, rice, maize and beans. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothing, rice, beans and maize.

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is 24 years old and is married with one child. Tumaini began selling clothes in 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Tumaini now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To increase clothing inventory.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Kodjo A. was born in 1978 in Amégnran (Vo prefecture), where he still lives and works selling lubricants, namely motor oil. He is married and has one child. Thanks to his business, he is able to meet his needs and those of his family. However, recently he has noticed a large increase in the number of customers and in the demand for lubricants, due to the great increase in the number of “Zémidjans,” or motorcycle taxis. To satisfy his customers and make his business profitable, he is requesting a loan in order to find a solution to his troubles. He is confident that this project will be very profitable and will help solve his problems.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1978 à Amégnran (préfecture de Vo), monsieur Kodjo A. vit dans le même village et exerce son commerce de vente de lubrifiant notamment les huiles à moteur. Marié, il est père d’un enfant. C’est grâce à ce commerce qu’il arrive à prendre en charge ses besoins et ceux de sa famille. Mais depuis il a constaté une forte augmentation de sa clientèle et de la demande en lubrifiant à cause de la prolifération des Zémidjan ou taxi moto. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle et rentabiliser son commerce, il sollicite un apport financier pour pouvoir trouver une solution à ses difficultés. Il est très confiant que ce projet lui sera très rentable dans la mesure où il résoudra ses problèmes.

loans.use: Purchase lubricants

loans.name: Gerardo Armengol

texts.es:
Gerardo C. is 24 years old and works as a Managua city bus driver. He is married and has a 2-year-old daughter. His wife is a homemaker.

Five years ago Gerardo started working in his father’s business as a bus driver’s assistant. Because of his demonstrated responsibility on the job, he now drives that bus.

Gerardo’s dream is to finish building his house. He is requesting a loan to build a bedroom, which will make his family more comfortable. He hopes to provide a more decent home for his daughter and future children.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Gerardo C. es un joven de 24 años de edad, que se dedica a conducir un bus de transporte colectivo en la ciudad de Managua. Es casado y tiene una niña de 2 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Hace 5 años Gerardo empezó a laborar en el negocio de su padre como ayudante en un bus, pero gracias a la responsabilidad que ha demostrado en sus labores hoy en día es conductor de dicho bus. El sueño de Gerardo es poder terminar de construir su casa de habitación, por lo que solicita el préstamo para construir un cuarto de habitación para poder darle un poco mas de comodidad a su pequeña familia, espera poder darle a su hija una vivienda más digna y a los hijos que más adelante seguramente van a tener.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom in his house

loans.name: Cotilda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Cotilda M.. She is married and has three children with ages between 3 and 9.

In 2007, Cotilda established her cake business. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about US $370 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Cotilda requires a loan in order to purchase wheat flour and other raw materials for preparation of cake. In the future, Cotilda plans to to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour.

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Norma Vivas sells pastries and sodas in her own stand in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua. She has two school-aged children, and that is why she works very hard in order to cover all their needs. She has come to Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan that will allow her to buy pastries and sodas so that she can later on sell them and keep on supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

En le mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Norma Vivas se dedica a la venta de reposterias y refrescos los cuales los oferta a sus clientes en su propio tramo en el mercado. Es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar y por este motivo se esfuerza mayormente para suplir sus necesidades.

Hoy en dia ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el proposito de obtener un credito que le permita la compra de las reposterias y las gaseosas para su respectiva comercializacion y asi salir adelante en el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (pastries and sodas) for her business.

loans.name: Violeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Violeth M.. She is a married woman with two children, ages two and three. She owns a business selling traditional African cloth, which she has been running since 2005. Local Tanzanian women buy her cloth and use it to tailor fashionable outfits. She currently earns about 250 USD in monthly profit from this business and now is requesting a loan to purchase additional stock of cloth. Violeth is assisted by one employee in running her cloth stall and plans to increase the quantity and range of stock she sells in the future.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase traditional African cloth in bulk

loans.name: Kosar Irshad Masih's Group

texts.en:
Kosar baji is the wife of I. M. and lives in a small area named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 25 years. She is the mother of three sons. None of her sons got an education. They all are working in a factory. Kosar baji's husband is a blacksmith and makes different things, such as iron boxes and door locks. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Kosar baji is a sweeper in a local school in her community. She has been working in this school for the last two years. She successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy iron to expand her husband's business.

Kosar baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Shaila baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Sofia baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Mafia baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron to expand her husband's blacksmith business

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio tiene 20 años, es soltera y vive en una casa alquilada con su madre. Al ver Rocío que su madre siempre ha trabajado por su bienestar, optó por ayudarla y dedicarse a la venta de ajos, desde 5 años atrás, decidiéndose por este rubro, ya que ella trae gran cantidad de ajos al por mayor y los vende por bolsitas, lo cual hace que la venta sea satisfactoria. No se le hace complicado realizar su trabajo, ya que es una chica joven con muchas ansias de superación. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de ajos para continuar vendiéndolos y sacar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rocio is 20 years old, single, and lives with her mother in a rented home. Seeing that her mother had always worked for her well-being, Rocio decided to help her out and began selling garlic five years ago. She gets large quantities of garlic wholesale and sells them in small bags so her sales will be satisfactory. It has not been difficult for her to do this work as she is a young girl who is eager to improve herself. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she has requested, she will buy more garlic in order to continue selling and make higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of garlic for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth E. is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and drinks in her shop. She hopes to increase her stock so she can make more profit to support her family. She is requesting this loan to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Sindulfo

texts.es:
El señor Sindulfo S. tiene 44 años, es soltero, vive en pareja con quien tiene 2 hijos y posee casa propia, se inició en su actividad desde muy joven a partir de los 15 años, que es la compra-venta de lubricantes y aceites para todo tipo de automóviles, su capital incial fue de Gs. 100.000.- que fue ampliando con el correr de los años y fue progresando gracias a la buena administración en sus negocios, ahora posee buen capital de giro y sigue creciendo gracias a la gran demanda de sus clientes de varios años, desea invertir siempre para la compra de más insumos como lubricantes y aceites, además de más accesorios para automóviles y motos.
El señor Sindulfo S. desea para más adelante construir otra fosa que le servirá para el mantenimiento de los automóviles.
texts.en:
Mr. Sindulfo S. is 44 years old, single, and lives with his partner with whom he has two children and owns his own home. He started his business at the young age of 15, buying and selling lubricants and oils for all types of cars. His initial capital was 100,000 guaranís, and grew over the years and progressed thanks to his adept business administration. Now he has a good cash flow and continues to grow thanks to the demand of his clients over the years. He plans to invest in the purchase of products such as lubricants and oils as well as spare parts for cars and motorcycles. Mr. S. hopes in the future to build a second shop from which to provide car maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy car lubricants, oils and spare parts

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
K. was born in 1981 in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She currently wholesales different kinds of vegetables like morning glories, cabbages, etc, and started the business more than eight years. She normally collects vegetables from farmers and transport them by taxi to sell at the Poypet Market. For another income, she also is a local rice farmer.

She is married to Veun Vong, aged 30, who is a motorbike taxi driver. The couple has no children. K.'s investment is going well and it is a profitable investment, which motivates her to continue working. In order to make the investment more successful, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy more vegetables for sale and to do rice farming.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale and to do rice farming

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: ISAIAS ES SOLTERO Y VIVE CON SU MADRE Y HERMANA MAYOR. ISAIAS SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE PAPA POR CARGAS, TRAE DESDE CHAPACIRCA Y LA COMERCIALIZA EN LA CIUDAD, POR OTRA PARTE INGRESO A TRABAJAR EN UNA INDUSTRIA DE CERVEZA DE DONDE RECIBE UN SALARIO MENSUAL. TIENE COMPETENCIA EN SU RUBRO PERO POR LA ZONA DONDE VIVE TIENE BUENOS PROVEEDORES Y REALIZA CON BASTANTE ÉXITO LA COMERCIALIZACION DE PAPA, TRAE ESPECIALMENTE LOS FINES DE SEMANA. COMPRARA UN TOTAL DE 30 CARGAS DE PAPA DE LA ZONA DE CHAPACIRCA, Y LO COMERCIALIZARA EN EL MERCADO. ES LA TERCERA VEZ QUE ISAIAS SACA CREDITO DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION Y EN SUS ANTERIORES CREDITOS TUVO EN BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO EN SUS CREDITOS.
texts.en:
Isaias is single and lives with his mother and older sister. Isaias dedicates himself to the purchase and sale of potatoes that he brings from Chapacirca and markets in the city. For additional income, he also works at a beer manufacturer where he earns a monthly salary. He is competent at his chosen trade, but in the zone where he lives there are good providers and he realizes his sales with great success. He brings them especially on weekends. He will buy a total of 30 loads of potatoes from the Chapacirca zone, that he will sell in the market. This is the third time that Isaias takes out credit from our institution and, in his previous loans, he had a good repayment record.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Elita

texts.es:
ELITA G. P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Ruperto Pérez N° 375 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 45 años, 03 hijos, y su cónyuge labora como secretario en una institución de la zona.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compró una máquina de coser y se puso a reparar ropa de sus vecinos y amigos, también confecciona ropa a pedido del cliente.

Ella encontró en la costura un buen ingreso, sin descuidar su casa.  Con este crédito de S/. 1,200. Nuevos Soles, comprará telas al por mayor, hilos, botones, cierres y otros para esta campaña escolar. Además por su carácter emprendedor también está invirtiendo en crianza de pollos.
Comenta: “Manuela Ramos nos da una linda ayuda, no necesitamos garantía material, solo necesitamos ser puntuales en los pagos y el crédito sale rápido. Los créditos me ayudan bastante para incrementar mi capital”.
texts.en:
Elita G. P. belongs to the Nuevo Eden community bank. She is 45 years old and has 3 children. Her partner works as a secretary at a local institute. With her first loan of S/.300 new soles, she bought a sewing maching and set to work mending clothes for her neighbors and friends. She also makes clothes to order. She found that the business provides her with a good income and still allows her time to care for her family. With this S/.1,200 new-soles loan, she will buy wholesale stocks of cloth, threads, buttons, zippers and other supplies for the school year. She's also investing in a poultry business, yet more evidence of her entrepeneurial character. She says: "Manuela Ramos helps us enormously. We don't need solid collateral, we just have to be punctual about repaying and the loans flow quickly. The loans help me to increase my capital."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for sewing business.

loans.name: Gunduz

texts.en:
Gunduz B. is 39 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as: cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many others in his grocery store which he built 3 years ago. Currently Gunduz has about 1200 USD in inventory. His monthly net profit is about US 200.

Today Gunduz is requesting a loan of 1225 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children might progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his very best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: diversify number of food products

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: La señora Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Libertad”, vive en el Jr. Bolognesi cdra. 05, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella. Dada su ganas de progresar y de sacar a su familia adelante, con su  primer crédito de S/. 300.00 iniciò su  propio negocio de venta de bebidas gasificadas,  para lo cual compró a plazos una congeladora para mantener heladas sus productos muy solicitados por el intenso calor reinante en la zona. Este negocio le permite tener ganancias por lo que continùa con su actividad, teniendo siempre como meta vender estos mismos productos pero al por mayor. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 que cancelará a un  plazo de 06 meses, lo invertirá comprando más productos como gaseosas en paquetes de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños, agua mineral con gas y sin gas también en diferentes marcas y tamaños  y así satisfacer el exigente gusto de su clientela. Pilar, manifiesta un agradecimiento enorme a Manuela Ramos por permitirle salir adelante con lo que ella se propone y seguir creciendo como empresaria y mujer.
texts.en:
Pilar belongs to the "La Libertad" communal bank. She lives in the Bellavista District of San Martin Department. She has a life partner, is 29 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are still dependent on her. Given her desire to progress and bring her family forward, she used her initial 300 sol loan to start a business selling soft drinks for which she bought, on installments, a cooler to keep her drinks cold something very necessary given the hot weather that is usual in her area. This business produces profits that allow her to continue her activity her goal being always to continue selling these products but now at wholesale. With this 1500 sol loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of more product such as soft drinks of various brands, flavors and sizes as well as sparkling and still mineral water of various brands and sizes thereby satisfying her customers's demanding tastes. Pilar expresses her enormous gratitude towards Manuela Ramos for allowing her to go forward with what she proposes and to continue to grow as a woman and and entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks in a variety of flavors and sizes.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng S. K., 39, pictured here with her husband, sells vegetables in the local market of the Kampong Cham province, typically making US$6 each day. She is married and has three children living at home to support. Her husband, Khat Mab, makes approximately US$7 every day working as a taxi driver. Cheng S. K. would like a loan of US$1200 to purchase spare parts and repair her husband's taxi.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and repair taxi.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa T. is a married mother of seven children; two are currently in school. She is a 46-year-old trader. She trades in handkerchiefs and scarfs. Handkerchiefs and scarfs are very useful for wiping sweat and are a head-covering for many Christians.  For lack of adequate working capital, Yaa buys a small stock of handkerchiefs and scarfs and sells them through hawking. She believes this loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk quantity of the scarfs. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Prosperity’.

loans.use: To purchase handkerchiefs and scarfs in bulk

loans.name: Seyni

texts.fr: Seyni N. est un couturier de profession, il exerce ce métier depuis plusieurs années dans le village de Sandiara situé à 80 km de Dakar capitale du Sénégal. Mais comme tous les villageois il  fait de l’embouche bovine en période hivernale, c’est ainsi qu’il sollicite un prêt  pour faire de l’embouche. Les revenus tirés de cette activé lui permettent de faire des investissements dans sa maison  construire une chambre ou acheter un lit.
texts.en:
Seyni N. is a tailor by profession. He has been working at this trade for several years in the village Sandiara, located 80 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. But like all villagers, he fattens cattle during the off-season. Thus, he’s requesting a loan for fattening livestock. The revenues derived from his business enable him to make investments in his house, to build a room or to buy a bed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is a 43-year-old farmer from Libertad, Agusan del Sur. She is tilling a one-hectare farm that is her only source of livelihood to help her meet the needs of her family.

Currently, she is busy preparing her land; however, she needs additional capital to pay for the necessary expenses on her farm. She would like to ask for a loan worth Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to purchase insecticide, herbicide and fertilizer. The loan will help her improve her harvest and income for her family.

She chose CEVI for its wide range of services. At CEVI, it's not only about loans, but also business training, biblical reflections and insurance coverage given to all members.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide, herbicides and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora María Guadalupe Sánchez le está haciendo falta un nuevo piso ya que el que tiene está en muy malas condiciones. 
Pero por el momento no cuanta con el dinero para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora, es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para que su vivienda esté en mejores condiciones, ya que tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su mama que es una persona mayor de edad y necesita varios cuidados. 
La señora María  trabaja en una fábrica en el aria de producción este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia, y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe Sánchez’s house needs a new floor because the one that is there is in very bad condition. Right now, she does not have the money to be able to buy the material and pay someone to make the improvement. That is why she is asking for a loan to get her house into better condition. She is taking care of her elderly mother, and she needs various accommodations. María works in the area of production in a factory. This is the income that the family has. Part of it will be used to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the floor in her house

loans.name: Mrs. Leang Pork Village Bank Group

texts.en:
19 people living in Tuol Kdei village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purposes.  Mrs. Leang P. is a 43-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows vegetables.  Her husband, Mr. Chea Yun, is a fisherman. He wants to expand his fishing business by purchasing a boat.  Thus, Mrs. Leang P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory.  Three others are fishermen, and the last attends the local school.   

Four members of this group loan have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans.

loans.use: Various purposes, including purchasing a fishing boat

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: sokhna N. est un parent beneficiaire evoluant dans la vente de produits cosmetiques et d'autres effets de beaute pour femmes.elle capitalise une experience de cinq ans dans cet activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour augmenter son fond de roulement.l'augmentation de ses benefice lui permettra de renforcer l'assistance de son mari dans les charges familliales.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Ahmad Qayes Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Qayes is the group leader of Ahmad Qayes group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business. Their requested a group loan of 60000 Afghani.  
Ahamad Qayes and M. Aedres want to take a loan for their business of cooking in restaurant. There want to buy new desk and chair for the restaurant. S. jan wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. And Amena also want to take a loan for her business of bakery. She wants to buy wood for her business. Safya want to take a loan for her  husband’s business of making bicycle. Their want to improve and develop for their business.

loans.use: their make larger their business

loans.name: Coral

texts.es:
Coral tiene 34 años, vive en la casa de su madre con sus hijos. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la siembra de papa y maíz, así como también a la crianza de ganado vacuno, los cuales vende cada 3 meses en la feria ganadera de su zona. La venta de sus animales le proporciona el sustento mientras espera la época de cosecha. Adicionalmente,  trabaja como vendedora en una tienda de su localidad. Su deseo a futuro es intensificar la venta de animales y sembrar más extensiones de terrenos. 
Esta es la cuarta  vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP y se compromete nuevamente a ser puntual en sus pagos como lo hizo en oportunidades anteriores. El dinero requerido será invertido en la compra de abono y medicinas para sus  ovejas.
texts.en:
Coral is 34 years old. She and her children live at her mother’s house. For the past 10 years, she has been devoted to growing potatoes and corn, as well as raising cattle. She sells her cattle every 3 months at the local livestock fair. The sale of her animals provides an income while she is waiting for the harvest season. In addition, she works as a saleswoman at a store in her area. She hopes to increase her sale of animals in the future and plant more crops.

This is Coral’s fourth loan with MFP. She renews her commitment to make her payments on time like she did before. The money she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and medicine for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertlizers

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
La señora EUFEMIA S. A. , tiene 26 años, vive en el distrito de SALPO , provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3ero de secundaria.
EUFEMIA es casada  y tiene 2  hijos menores de edad que dependen económicamente de ella.
EUFEMIA se dedica a la compra y venta de Guachos (lotería).
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de guachos que los lleva a vender a pueblos vecinos.
Este crédito de 600 nuevos soles lo invirtirá en la compra de guachos (lotería).
EUFEMIA cuenta con algunos animalitos que cria para luego venderlos, ella sueña con empezar a comprar y vender reces para poder aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: lo invirtirá en la compra de guachos (lotería).

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Doña Justima vive en la zona D. Kamirpata, aproximadamente a 10 Km. del centro D. ciudad, en domicilio propio tiene 64 años D. edad, es viuda, vive actualemte con una D. sus hijas, su actividad principal es la venta D. pescado , el mismo que lo realiza en su puesto ubicado en la parada del micro 155, en el barrio D. Achachicala, todos los dias D. la semana excepto los viernes y sabado que viaja a Taypiplaya, al norte del departamento D. La Paz, en nor yungas, a vender pescado con cerca D. un capital D. $us 400.-.El crédito solicitado está dirigido a la compra D. un refrigerador para la tienda D. Taypiplaya y mercaderia para surtir la tienda."
texts.en:
Doña Justina is 64 years old, widowed, and currently lives with one of her daughters. She sells fish locally every day of the week except Fridays and Saturdays, when she travels to sell at another location. When she travels, she takes inventory with her valued around $400 USD. She is requesting a loan to purchase a refrigerator to keep at her main location for storing fish for when she travels.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator for storing fish

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Raquel M. de 28 años de edad, vive en Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua,  se caso joven tiene dos hijos de 8 y 11 años de edad, los cuales estudian su primaria, su esposo la apoyado para que ella logre sus propios ingreso, el trabaja como conductor, la joven desde hace dos años logro poner una librería en su casa donde vende diversos productos de gusto al cliente y accesible de comprar. La solicitud del préstamo lo quiere para construir un muro en la parte de atrás de la casa el cual comprara los materiales de construcción como piedra, arena, cemento, hiero y otros para comenzar a construir y evitar que los ladrones del barrio puedan acceder a su vivienda ya que día a día hacen robos en diferentes hogares por ser las casas inseguras es por eso ve de gran necesidad de hacer el muro. Agrádese a Afodenic por la oportunidad del financiamiento el cual resguardará la seguridad de su familia, como las mejora de su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Raquel M. is 28 years old and lives in Memorial Sandino in the capital city of Managua. She is married and has two children, ages 11 and 8, who are elementary school students. Her husband supports the family with his income as a driver. For the past two years, Raquel has been managing a bookstore out of her home where she sells a variety of affordable products that her customers enjoy.

She is requesting a loan because she wants to build a security wall behind her house. With the proceeds, she will buy building materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, and other items so that she can begin construction and prevent neighborhood thieves from accessing her house. There have been daily reports from different places of residential thefts. Due to the increased insecurity, Raquel’s family needs to have this wall built. She thanks AFODENIC for this loan, which will provide a safe environment for her family and improve her property.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for a security wall

loans.name: La Hermandad Group

texts.es:
L. señora Hilaria D. L. C.  trabajo desD. muy niña , sabia que era L. única forma D. progresar y salir adelante. en su Huancayo querido donD. L.  gente se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y elL. lo demuestra por que  a lo largo D. su vida ha hecho D.  todo. vendió quesos, miel, papas. etc. También trabajo en  una fabrica D. caramelos, una heladería y una piñateria en realidad ha hecho D. todo un poco.
Hilaria  se caso  cuando solo tenía 15 años y nunca paro D. trabajar  cuando estaba laborando como empleada del hogar su sobrina le comento sobre EDAPROSPO es así que nuevamente se anima a trabajar por su cuenta con su primer préstamo compra ropa para llevar a vender a Huancayo y como le fue bien sus viajes aumentaron ahora su nuera le ayuda a vender lo que lleva D. lima peluches y ropa ,por otro lado también ayuda a su hermano que tiene una fabrica D. chompas, con sus ingresos y ganancias elL. pueD. cubrir su sustento y el D. su familia sobretodo D. sus 6 nietos a quienes ayuda.
 Su mayor anhelo es comprarse un terreno en lima y poner su propia tienda donD. pueda vender D. todo, eso seria algo seguro por que muchas veces el negocio baja y no tiene ventas, con su reciente préstamo comprara ropa y otros articulos para llevar a Huancayo a vender ya que por fiestas naviD.ñas habrá M. venta y esta segura que le ira muy bien.

*L. señora Hilaria aparece en medio D. su grupo muy sonriente.
texts.en:
Hilaria D. L. C. has worked since she was a little girl. She knew that was the only way to progress and get ahead. She worked in her beloved Huancayo, where the people are characterized as being very hard-working. She has demonstrated this for her entire life, and she has done everything. She sold cheese, honey, and potatoes, etc. She also worked in a candy factory, and ice cream parlor, and a piñata shop. In reality, she has done a little of everything. Hilaria got married when she was only 15, and she never stopped worked. When she was working as a household employee, her niece told her about Edaprospo. That is why she is once again motivated to work to support herself. With her first loan she bought clothes to take to sell in Huancayo. As this went well , her trips increased. Now her daughter-in-law helps her sell the stuffed animals and clothes she brings from Lima, . She also helps her brother, who has a sweater factory. With her income and earnings she is able to cover the cost of supporting her family and, above all, the six grandchildren that she helps. Her biggest desire is to buy a piece of land in Lima and place her own store there where she could sell everything. This would be something secure because many times her business is down and she does not have sales. With her recent loan she will buy clothes and other items to take to Huancayo to sell. With the Christmas festivities there will be a lot of sales, and she is sure that it will go very well. *Hilaria appears smiling in the middle of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn F. is from the village of Purok 8, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Jovelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a waste management service in which she hauls away junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jovelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. This will be Jovelyn's 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional waste & junk material to sell

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
"I am very thankful to Kiva lenders for their help in improving my business."

Amir D. is applying to Kiva for his second loan. As you know from his first loan, he runs a taxi business and this has not changed. However, he changed his car and now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the spare parts for this car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.en:
Marcia is the coordinator of her group Nuevo Renacer (New Rebirth), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the north of Santo Domingo, an economically depressed urban slum, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and child.

Marcia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing blouses and women's pants in the main market in Santo Domingo and then reselling them at a profit in her neighborhood. She will use the profits to continue to try to meet the daily needs of her small family as well as to improve on her house. She has the long term dream of owning her own home and having a fixed location for her currently ambulatory business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Pants and blouses to sell

loans.name: Family Circle Group

texts.en: Musu J. is the leader of group of five borrowers called Family Circle. She is married with four children, two girls and two boys. Her oldest child is 20 and in the 10th grade, and her youngest is 10 years old and in the fifth grade. Musu herself was only able to complete school through the 9th grade because Liberia's civil war interrupted her schooling in 1990, when she and her family fled from the capital, Monrovia, to Buchanan, a city southeast along the coast. Musu cooks and sells food from a table at the Red Light Market. Red Light is Liberia's largest market and is situated on the outskirts of Monrovia. Musu serves dishes such as fufu (cassava porridge) and soup, fish, beef, rice and greens. Before she started making and selling food, Musu sold raw foodstuffs such as rice, beans and cooking oil, but she decided to start selling cooked food to improve her profits. Musu plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 29,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more ingredients with which to cook. "I cook nice food," she says. She hopes that one day she will be so successful that she's able to open up a big restaurant in its own building, one that has air conditioning and a TV. She also wants to see her children get a good education and hopes that some of them will be able to go to university some day. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Musu is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy ingredients used in cooking, such as rice, cassava flour, fish, and beef

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret J. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of onions to sell. Forty years old and married to a retired soldier, Margrethe has seven children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and open a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of onions to sell.

loans.name: Merelini

texts.en:
Merelini P. is 45 and married with 6 children (ages 5 - 15).  She owns a business venture, selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Merelini has 3 years of experience in this business.  Merelini needs a loan of WST $1700 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Merelini joined SPBD.This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Merelini's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Merelini P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags
