loans.name: Gladis Esperanza

texts.es: Gladis Esperanza V. D. Q. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas, las cuales se dedican a estudiar y junto a su padre. Gladis posee una tienda D. alquiler D. sillas y mesas, las cuales son rentadas para elaboración D. eventos especiales. DesD. hace 4 años que ella posee este negocio, a través del cual ha logrado obtener muy buenas ganancias lo cual beneficia en gran manera la estabilidad económica D. su familia, principal razón por la que Gladis decidió iniciar su negocio. Ella solicita un préstamo a integran con el deseo D. poder comprar mayor cantidad D. sillas y mesas, D. manera que puedan atender a más clientes, sobre todo en los fines D. semana en donD. su demanda se ve incrementada en gran manera. El deseo D. Gladis es salir adelante y poder crecer en su negocio para poder brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis Esperanza V. D. Q. is 42 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, located in the department of Usulután. She lives with her husband and two daughters, who are in school and with their father. Gladis has a table and chair rental store, they are rented for special events preparation. She has had this business for four years, from which she has been able to obtain very good profits that greatly benefit the economic stability of her family, the main reason that Gladis decided to start her business. She is asking for a loan from Integral, hoping to purchase more chairs and tables so they can attend to more clients, especially on weekends when she sees demand increasing greatly. Gladis wishes to come out ahead and to be able to grow her business in order to offer a better life to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tables and chairs for rental store.

loans.name: Perise

texts.en:
Perise M. is 36 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Perise has 1 year of experience in this business.  Perise needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Perise joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Perise's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira is a wife of S. A. and they both live in a mid-size city named Riwind, in Pakistan. Riwind city is famous for its dairy business. 
She is a 49-year old woman. She owns a two room brick house, which she made three years ago with the earnings of her husband and from her embroidered clothes business. This was their big achievement and they feel proud of themselves. 
They have six children: three sons and three daughters. Their elder daughter is married and the next two help Nasira in her embroidery business. Their sons help their father in his loading business. Currently, they have a donkey cart which they used to load items, such as cements and bricks, and then deliver it to the required place. 

Nasira has successfully repaid her three loans to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to purchase another donkey cart for her elder son so he also becomes helpful and meet the financial expenses.

loans.use: To purchase another donkey cart for loading.

loans.name: C5256 Good Line Group

texts.en:
Wilson is 26 years old and is married with three children. He is the president of a group called “Good Line” and this group is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of goods such as clothes, foodstuffs, gasoline, etc. They have been in this business for about three years.

Wilson and his team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to satisfy the demand of their customers which keeps increasing beyond their financial capacity. With the use of this loan, Wilson and his team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will be used for more reinvestment in their business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as clothes, foodstuffs, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Ibrohimjon

texts.en:
I. Ibrohimjon is 22 years old. He lacked the ability to pay university fees, so Ibrohimjon was only able to finish school. After finishing school, he learned various skills, including car repair. Initially, he worked as an assistant and in time he became experienced at repairing cars. Thanks to his abilities, he was able to build his own workshop near his house where he provides his services. Now he is feeling the effects of a lack of tools and spare parts for car repair, and for that reason he is requesting a loan of $1,500 USD. Ibrohimjon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase tools and spare parts for car repair

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Gudelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva vida.
Gudelia es casada, tiene 63 años y 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno esta con ella y esta estudiando en la universidad. Gudelia tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, especerías que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los dias desde temprano hasta la noche.
Gudelia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, verduras.
Gudelia sueña con que todos sus hijos tengan una casa y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gudelia belongs to the Nueva Vida Communal Bank. Gudelia is 63, married, and has four children. Only one of them lives with her, and he is studying in the university. Gudelia has a grocery store in her house. She sells general groceries, vegetables, fruit, and spices that she prepares. She does this everyday from early until nighttime. Gudelia needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy rice, oil, and vegetables. Gudelia dreams that all of her children have a house and that her son finishes his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Marlon Emiliano

texts.es:
El joven Marlon Emiliano Es casado y con una niña de 2 años de edad, su esposa es Ingeniera Civil y trabaja para la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace dos años desempeñándose en el cargo de encuestadora catastral.
De igual forma Marlon también es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chichigalpa desde hace 7 años, desempeñándose en el cargo de responsable de adquisiciones.
Marlon Emiliano culmino su último año de la carrera de Contador Público en la Universidad de Occidente ( UDO León), por tal razón hizo la solicitud de crédito, ya que con dicho crédito cancelará sus módulos para obtener su titulo de Contador Público.
texts.en:
The young Marlon Emiliano is married and has a 2 year-old child. His wife is a civil engineer and has worked for the municipality of Chichigalpa for 2 years, performing the job of Cadastral surveyor (surveys used to document the boundaries of land ownership.) Marlon has also worked for the municipality of Chichigalpa for 7 years; he is responsible for procurement. Marlon Emiliano finished his last year in the public accounting track of the University of the West (UDO León). For this reason he is requesting a loan, since with this loan he will pay for expenses related to the registration of his professional degree so that he can obtain the title of Public Accountant.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for expenses related to the registration of his professional degree

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng L. currently weaves rattan baskets and wooden beds for sale. She sells her finished products to middlemen who come directly to her house. She makes many sets of baskets before selling out. Eng L. has a partner in her husband, who helps her in running the whole business. The couple have four teenage children; all of whom go to school or work as temporary laborers. Eng L. has been very busy with her business as she has many clients, and recently she has gotten a lot of orders from her customers. Because she lacks capital, Eng L. is looking for a loan to purchase raw materials to make enough products to fulfill her customers' needs. She proposes to use any remaining cash from the loan to mend her exiting house that needs repairs.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make enough products to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.name: Analou

texts.en:
Analou P. is from the village of Bago, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Analou raises hogs.  She has been in business for three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Analou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Analou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,700 PHP from PMPC to purchase feed for her pigs.  Analou is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.  This loan will be her fourth from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

---------------------------
About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To buy feeds for consumption of pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora de 42 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Domingo Tablada con quien tiene una niña de 2 añitos llamada Noa Massiel.  Nora es docente de profesion, pero actualmente esta trabajando como administradora del cafetin de la Escuela Leopoldina Castrillo desde hace 3 años, ademas se dedica a comercializar cosmeticos y tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion. 

Esta solicitando  su 11vo credito con el objetivo de reparar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y con las lluvias se moja parte de su casa ademas ponerle la ceramica a la sala y al cuarto.  

En el credito anterior fue benefiado con el fondo kiva, logrando satisfactoriamente terminar la construccion del cuarto.  Expresa que se siente muy agradecida con AFODENIC, pues es gracias a los creditos que le han financiado que ahora tiene su casita bonita y con algunas condiciones para su hijita.
texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and married to Mr. Domingo Tablada. They have a 2 year old daughter named Noa Massiel. Nora is a teacher by profession, but has been working as the administrator of the school cafeteria at the Leopoldina Castrillo School for 3 years. In addition, she sells cosmetics and has a small grocery store in her house. She is asking for her 11th loan to repair the roof of her house, which leaks water into the house when it rains, and also to install ceramic floor tile in her living room and bedroom. Nora received a previous loan from Kiva which allowed her to finish building her bedroom. She is grateful to AFODENIC, and thanks to the loans that they have financed, she now has a beautiful upgraded house for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof and tile the floor

loans.name: Dámaso Nelvin

texts.es:
El señor Dámaso Nelvin, tiene la edad de 41 años vive con su familia en lo Laureles Sur un barrio de la Capital, muy conocido por la inseguridad social que sus habitantes conviven día a día, ellos tienen 3 hijos pequeños que estudian la escuela primaria, el señor labora como albañil y su esposa se dedica a la venta de carnes, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar.

Ellos son de Nueva Guinea un pueblo en el interior del país pero se vinieron a la capital en busca de mejores condiciones y oportunidades de trabajo, ellos habitan en una humilde casa que no canta con las comodidades dignas de habitad y es la razón por la cual solicita una préstamo para la división de los cuartos de los niños y la pareja, esto les brindara una mayor privacidad, mejores condiciones, y comodidades para todos, con el crédito se comprara los materiales de construcción como primera etapa de las remodelaciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
Damaso Nelvin is 41 years old and he lives with his family in the district of Laureles Sur in the capital city. The region is well known for its social instability. They have 3 children and they are all attending primary school. He is a construction worker and his wife sells meats. The both contribute to the family's finances. They are originally from Nueva Guinea, a village located in the interior of the country but they moved to the capital city in search for better living conditions and for work opportunities. They live in a humble house that does not provide the common dignities of life and for this reason he is requesting a loan, to install a wall separating the children's room from the parents' room. This separation will provide them with greater privacy, better living conditions, and a greater comfort for all. This loan will allow them to purchase all the materials needed to complete the renovations to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate their home.

loans.name: Matare Progressive Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
In the Kanungu trading centre of Kihihi, a hard-working and determined B. William has been running a business where he has sold food products for over a year. He belongs to the Matare Progressive Group, Kihihi. His hard work and friendly character have brought him this far alongside his other business of carpentry. Together, he earns 400,000 Ugandan shillings monthly from his businesses. 

This loan will help William to do research and purchase better quality products for selling such as rice, beans and coffee and to further restock his business in order to match the customers' demand. With an improved business, he will be able to earn more revenue and to support his family as he struggles to educate his nine children to create a better future for them.

loans.use: To buy more stock e.g. rice, beans and coffee

loans.name: Yadira Agustina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente dedicada  en gran parte a la agricultura y cría de  animales, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora Yadira tiene 32 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 11 años de la cual procreo dos hijos de 11 años y otro hermoso pequeñito de dos años el que requiere de muchos cuidados, su marido cultiva el campo, viven en una casa que le dio su papá para que vivan.

Para ayudar a su marido en los gastos del hogar inicio un negocio de venta de ropa por catalogo,  su sistema de ventas es puerta a puerta, ya lleva tres años con esto y le ha ido bien a pesar de la crisis económica que también afecta nuestro país  comenta. Trabaja todos los días unas tres a cuatro horas por día, deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana, los pedidos los realiza cada fin de  mes.

En los actuales momentos tiene varios pedidos, es así como va a utilizar este crédito para comprar más de sus mercaderías y quedar bien con sus clientes. Está en el Banco Comunal hace cuatro ciclos con este, está muy contenta ya que estos créditos le han ayudado a crecer en su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y  darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the Quiroga parish of the city of Calceta, a region where the people for the most part work in agriculture and raise animals,the community bank Quiroga meets every fifteen days.

Señora Yadira is 32 years old and has lived in a common-law marriage for 11 years. From this relationship she has two children who are 11 and another beautiful little son who is 2 and requires much care. Her husband raises crops. They live in a house that her father gave them to live in.

To help her husband with the household expenses, Yadira began a business of selling clothing by catalog. Her sales method is door to door. She has been doing this for three years, and it has gone well for her, in spite of the economic crisis that has also affected our country, she comments. She works every day for three or four hours. She leaves things on credit and collects on the weekends. She fills her orders at the end of every month.

Right now she has various orders. That is how she is going to use this loan -- to buy more of her merchandise and keep her customers happy. She has been in the community bank for four cycles with this business. She is very happy since these loans have helped her to expand her business.

Her dreams are to have her own house and give her children a better future.

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, pajamas, dresses, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen L., 38, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Macario L., a vendor, and is the mother of four children, two of whom are already working, while the others are still in school. By the grace of God, Helen has managed to support her older child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send the rest of her children all the way through college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Helen, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Helen operates a fish stall. Fish is bought fresh from nearby ports and piers, packed in ice and then brought to the local markets. Helen and her husband clean, gut and chop fish as per customer orders. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fish for their everyday inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Helen dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes that her family can migrate and work in other countries in the near future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy fish for their everyday inventory.

loans.name: Ryan Jay

texts.en:
Ryan Jay D. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old. Ryan Jay is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Ryan Jay operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fish caught in the ocean within the local community. Ryan Jay has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ryan Jay joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryan Jay is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ryan Jay from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Merta Jati Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu S. is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  Ni Putu S. is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Merta Jati (PK-10357).


Ni Putu S. is married and has 2 children.  To make a living, Ni Putu S. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Putu S. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 750,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, Ni Putu S. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Putu S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,300,000 IDR from MUK.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 1,300,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  This will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  Ni Putu S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

Explanations for the photo;
Ni Luh A. W. and Ni Kadek B. could not attend the meeting due to attending the temple so they are represented by their husbands.

Ni Wayan S. not attend because she was looking after her brother who was ill in Denpasar with her husband. Her loan is accounted for by the leader of the group.

Ni Luh K. not attend the meeting because she was sick.



About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





Ni Putu S. 0 (0) merupakan 45 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  Ni Putu S. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 15 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Merta Jati (PK-10357).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu S. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu S. menghasilkan sekitar 750,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, Ni Putu S. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu S. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,300,000 IDR dari MUK.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,300,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 65 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children. Adriana owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Adriana wants to extend help to her children even if they already have their own families. She also wants to help send her grandchildren to school.

Adriana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adriana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 28-year-old married man with a child living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His aspiration is to secure enough funds to set up a business for his wife and child. He is into the transport sector and has been in the business for two years now. John’s ambition is to buy a motorcycle so that he can stop remitting part of his daily income to his boss. John needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 50 years old.  She is a widow and has eleven children between eighteen and thirty years old. Two of her children attend school, while the others have their own homes. Riziki sells various items such as rice, potatoes, cassava flour, and wheat flour.  She has been doing this for 15 years. 

Riziki will use the loan to purchase more items for sale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Riziki plans to pay school fees for her children.  She has a dream of owning a big shop to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos D. 24 y 28. 
Tres veces a L. semana Esther viaja hasta tres horas en autobús a las comunidades rurales en L. región D. Ayacucho para comprar el queso y los cereales. ElL. dice que el negocio va bien ahora. Esther es socia D. FINCA Perú desD. hace 2 años y dice que elL. ha aprendido a ahorrar dinero. 
Esther quiere continuar con FINCA Perú y usar su próximo préstamo para comprar más queso y granos. Su sueño ahora es construir una casa para su familia y ver a su hijo menor terminar su licenciatura en ingeniería agrícoL..
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Llapanchik community bank.  She is a single mother and has two children aged 24 and 28.  Three times a week Esther travels up to three hours by bus to the rural communities of Ayacucho region to buy cheese and cereals.  She says that her business is doing well.

Esther has been a member of FINCA Perú for 2 years and she says that she has learned how to save money.  Esther would like to continue working with FINCA Perú and she will use her next loan to buy more cheese and grains.  Her dream is to build a house for her family and to see her youngest son finish his degree in agricultural engineering.

loans.use: To buy more cheese and grains

loans.name: Miriams Ildilcia

texts.es:
Miriams Ildilicia C. Ochoa se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulpería en su casa de habitacioon. Miriams atiende a sus clientes y administra muy bien su negocio, el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos y le a permitido salir adelante supliendo los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi tener mejores ganancias.
Han mejorado notablemente las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia, hizo unas remodelaciones en su casa de habitacion con las ganancias obtenidas anteriormente.
texts.en:
Miriams Ildilicia C. Ochoa is a merchant, she has a grocery store in her home. Miriams servers her customers and administers her business well. Her business is her main source of income and it has allowed her to be successful in supplying for the household expenses. 

She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business so that she can obtain more profits. 

Her and her family's living conditions have notably improved. She remodeled her home with profits she had previously made.

loans.use: Purchase lard, oil, margarine, soaps, toilet paper and sanitary napkins.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides Y. is from the town of Tagbilaran. She is 44 years old. Leonides is married and has 3 children aged 19, 15 and 8. To make a living, Leonides owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Leonides has been engaged in her business for over 7 years.

Leonides joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonides has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Leonides is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring supplies such as needles and thread

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a pig fattening business. She lives in Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.  

Soledad is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can purchase more pig stocks and feeds.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Soledad aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feeds

loans.name: Jesus Alipio

texts.es:
Jesús, tiene 23 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la Capital Arqueológica de América,  Cusco – Perú.  Jesús es hombre que busca aprovecha las oportunidades que se le presenta en la vida, él trabaja brindando servicio de transporte en la ciudad del Cusco y trabaja de día o de noche. Jesús también tiene un pequeño negocio de familiar de crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas.  Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Jesús en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas. 

Jesús pertenece al banco comunal “Allin Muju” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jesús is 23 years old.  He has one child and lives in the archaeological capital of America (Cusco, Peru).  Jesús is a man who seeks to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves in life.  He provides a transport service in the city of Cusco and works days or nights.  Jesús also owns a small family business raising animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  He has been in this business for one year and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, he requires a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens.

Jesús is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Allin Muju" community bank.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is being given with this loan and he pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens

loans.name: Agnes Mutete

texts.en:
Agnes K., aged 33 years, is married to Daniel K. and together they have two children – Benson (aged 15 years, in form three) and Cecilia Wanjiku (aged 13 years, in form one). The family lives in Uhuru Estate.
Agnes' primary business is selling second-hand women's clothes in Nairobi town center. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by KADET staff. Agnes has been operating her business for four years and generates a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. This loan of 40,000 KES is her first loan from KADET and she plans to use it to add new stock of blouses and skirts. If the loan boosts her business she hopes to open another business. She dreams of having many shops in the future. Agnes describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to add new stock of blouses and skirts

loans.name: Malaluna

texts.en:
Malaluna is 46 years old and married with three children.

Malaluna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food stall in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her food stall.

Malaluna has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the food stall business for 15 years.

Malaluna aspires to repair her house and to improve her food stall business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Raul Eduardo

texts.es: Raúl Eduardo T. tiene 25 años y es propietario de un negocio ubicado en el popular sector de la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, comunidad ubicada al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se combinan las actividades productivas formales e informales, los escenarios deportivos y los espacios residenciales,  entre conjuntos de viviendas y apartamentos, que hacen de este sector uno  de los de más movilización en la ciudad. Raúl en su negocio vende calzado, sandalias, zapatos, chancletas y mercancías económicas, que gusta a toda su clientela y que impactan la vista de quienes aún no le han comprado. El inició su negocio con peatones del sector, recomendados, amigos y a ello ha ido agregando proveedores que le suministran los productos que Raúl vende en su punto de ventas,  desde la 9:00 am hasta la 9:00 pm de Lunes a Domingos; el negocio de Raúl  presentan  una gran competencia, que aunque es amigable, solo la puede disminuir los buenos precios que ofrece Raúl a sus clientes, acompañado de su buen trato; esta es la razón por la cual se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a solicitar su credikiva, pues invertirá de contado y en mayor cantidad en calzado entre sandalias y chancletas en las líneas  femeninas y masculinas y con ello podrá seguir ofreciendo mejores precios, porque gana descuentos  al hacer sus compras por volumen y en efectivo.
texts.en:
Raúl Eduardo T. is 25 years old and is the owner of a business located in a popular sector of Ciudadela 20 de Julio, a community located to the south of the city of Barranquilla, where one can find both formal and informal productive activities, sporting settings, and residential areas, including groups of houses and apartments, which make this sector one of those with the greatest activity in the city. 

In his business, Raúl sells footwear --  sandals, shoes, slippers, and inexpensive merchandise, which please all his customers and catch the eye even of those who have not bought them. He began his business with the pedestrians of the sector, friends, and people recommended to him, and to that he has continued to add suppliers who can furnish him with the products that he sells at his sales point, where he works from 9 am until 9 pm from Monday to Sunday. 

Raúl's business has a lot of competition, even though it is friendly. Only competition can lower the good prices that Raúl offers to his customers, accompanied by his good service. This is the reason why he has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a Kiva loan, since he will invest immediately in a larger quantity of footwear, including sandals and slippers for men and women, and with it he will be able to continue offering better prices, because he can get discounts by making his purchases in volume and paying cash.

loans.use: to invest immediately in a lbigger quantity of footwear, including sandals and slipper, in both women's and men's styles

loans.name: Jhony Gilmer

texts.es:
Jhony tiene 34 años de edad, es padre de familia de dos niños los cuales tiene a su cargo y vive en el distrito de Olmos (en el departamento de Lambayeque), una comunidad rural.

Jhony tiene muy buenas referencias personales por ser un hombre trabajador y amable. Desde hace 10 años  trabaja dando servicio de transporte público, debido a que conoce muy bien la zona, cubriendo una ruta de Olmos al caserío Querpon y viceversa (ruta de aproximadamente 15 minutos).

Jhony solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de  llantas nuevas para su carro, esto le ayudará a mejorar su trabajo y obtener mejores ganancias.

Anteriormente Jhony cumplió de manera puntual sus créditos.
texts.en:
Jhony is 34 years old. He is the father of a family of two children, both of whom are in his care. He lives in the district of Olmos (in the department of Lambayeque) in a rural community. 

Jhony has good personal references because he is a hardworking and kind man. He has been working in public transportation for the past 10 years. He knows the region very well and he covers a route from Olmos to the community of Querpon and vice versa (the route is approximately 15 minutes in length). 

Jhony requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of new tires for his car. This will help him improve his work and to obtain better earnings. 

Jhony has previously completed his loan payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: This Kiva client trades in men’s clothing from a rented booth at the city market. To continue running the business, she needs to purchase new clothing inventory. This is the client’s second loan from Kiva, and, like her first one, it will allow her to continue running her business successfully, increase her work capital, and ensure profit stability.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing inventory

loans.name: Karin Soledad

texts.es:
Karin de 32 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas en su casa propia  que cuenta con agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Guadalupe,  a unos 30 minutos de la provincia de Pacasmayo y a unahora del departamento de la Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica ha la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Karin desde hace  unos 3 años a colocado en su domicilio una tienda con productos de primera necesidad (aceite,leche, arroz, azúcar, etc.) y gaseosas, la cual cuenta en su zona con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá sacar adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Por eso a pedido un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más productos para su tienda y poderla implementar, con la finalidad que sus clientes encuentren lo necesario para su consumo.  Permitiéndole a Karin pueda pagar su crédito, solventar sus gastos diarios y en un futuro cercano poder tener una tienda más grande y con todo tipo de productos.
texts.en:
Karin, 32, is married living with her husband and two daughters in her own house that has water and electricity, located in Guadalupe District about 30 minutes from Pacasmayo Province and an hour from La Libertad Department.  This is farming, livestock raising and tourism area.

About three years ago Karin set up a grocery store in her house stocked with basic need items (oil, milk, rice, sugar, etc.) and soft drinks.  It has an established customer base in the area and income she earns makes it possible for her to support the family and improve its quality of life.

Because of that she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new sol loan to buy more products for the store to stock it with the aim in mind of her customers being able to find what they need to consume allowing Karin to repay the loan, meet her daily expenses and, in the near future, be able to have a larger store stocked with all sorts of products.

loans.use: to buy more stock items for her store.

loans.name: Weltare Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Weltaré a été créé en Mai 2010 lors l’inauguration de leur  banc villageois. Il compte 25 femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité. Elles  ont comme activité principale  le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou (assise en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 03enfants. Elle prend aussi en charge ses 04 neveux.

Elle est vendeuse de bouillie dans son quartier depuis plus de 10 ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 03 sacs de mil et 01 sac de sucre.

Une partie des bénéfices sera épargnée et l’autre pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants à l’école et dans la maison.
texts.en:
The Weltaré group was created in May 2010 upon the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of 25 women who all live in the same area. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs. Fatou (sitting, third from the left) is the group leader. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She also looks after her four nephews.

She has been selling porridge in her neighborhood for over 10 years. With this new loan, she plans to purchase three sacks of millet and one bag of sugar.

Part of the profits will go towards her savings, and the remainder will be used to provide for her children at home and at school.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of millet and one bag of sugar

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 40 years-old .  She is married and has 2 children, aged 19 and 15.  In 2001, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to increase the inventory of the store. 

In the future, Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. María Del Carmen, de 21 años de edad es comerciante, vendedora de cosméticos. Comenzó trabajando  hace más de 2 años, y que con ello pudo salir adelante con toda su familia, y lo más importante para ella, es poder seguir sus estudios universitarios. 
Ella se considera una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, gracias al tiempo que lleva vendiendo los cosméticos ha podido formarse una clientela bien definida. Le gustaría algún día poder abrir una mercería donde poder ofrecer todos sus productos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas cosméticos, con lo cual podrá abastecer su stock de mercaderías.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen, 21, works in retail selling cosmetics.  She started her business more than 2 years ago, and with it she has been able to get ahead with her family and, what is most important to her, continue with her university education.

Maria considers herself to be a very responsible and hardworking woman.  Over the time that she has been selling cosmetics, she has been able to generate a well-established clientele.  She would like one day to open a store where she could offer all of her products for sale.

Maria requests a loan to buy more cosmetics, so that she will be able to stock up her business with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to later sell

loans.name: Santa Nicolasa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne cada quince días  en La parroquia La Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro. Y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

La señora Santa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque todas sus compañeras son muy responsables y cumplidas. Tiene 62 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. El esposo es sastre pero casi no trabaja ya que quedo discapacitado.
 
Nuestra amiga para ganarse el sustento diario de ella y su esposo se  dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, ella compra estos animalitos cuando aun están pequeños, luego los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado para después venderlos a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, los mismos que los trasladan hasta los centros de faenamiento o a los distintos mercados de la ciudad y comercializar la carne en estos lugares. Su esposo le ayuda cuando puede en la alimentación y cuidado de los animales.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos y medicinas para pollos y chanchos.
 
Sus sueños son tener salud ella y su familia para continuar adelante.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets every fifteen days in the parish of La Sequita de Montecristi. The canton where it is located is known as the birthplace of the historic fighter Eloy Alfaro. It is also known for the famous hats woven from paja toquilla fibers ["Panama" hats], which are prized inside and outside the country.

Santa is a founding member of her communal bank, and she likes it because all of her fellow members are very responsible and dependable. She is 62 years old and has a common-law husband, with whom she has five children, all grown and independent. Her husband is a tailor, but he is hardly working anymore because he became disabled. 

To earn her daily sustenance and that of her husband, this friendly woman works raising pigs and chickens. She buys the animals when they are very small, and she keeps them for a period of three to four months until they reach an appropriate weight to be sold to commercial dealers who come to her home. The dealers take them to slaughterhouses or to the various markets of the city and sell the meat in those places. Her husband helps her when he can with the feeding and care of the animals. 

She will use this loan to buy feed and medicines for chickens and pigs. 
 
Her dreams are that she and her family will maintain good health so they can keep making progress.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Agua De Peumo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Agua de Peumo” está conformado por 17 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros principalmente repostería, preparación y venta de ensaladas, venta de ropa para niño y dama. Todo ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
María integrante del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra al fondo del grupo, vistiendo una chaqueta color negro y una bufanda color verde, además su cabello lo tiene amarrado. Ella recién comenzó a incursionar en el rubro del comercio y se dedicará a vender juguetes, aprovechará la temporada del día del niño y navidad. Antes se dedicaba a trabajar como temporera en el campo. María tiene buenas expectativas en cuanto a su negocio como desafío. 
Con el crédito comprará juguetes para su negocio, ya realizó un listado con los juguetes de moda. 
Sus metas en su negocio son prosperar y establecerse con un local en una feria libre. 
María vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos. Todos ellos están estudiando en diferentes niveles. Sus sueños son brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ella quiere acceder a su casa propia, para esto postulará al subsidio habitacional.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir y generar mayores ganancias para concretar sus proyectos. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del banco comunal, ya que ha aprendido de experiencias de los demás socios y ha sentido el compromiso de ellos.  
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Agua de Peumo.” It is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, chiefly making desserts; preparing and selling salads; and selling women's and children's clothing. All of them are residents of the city of Chillán.

María is a member of the communal bank; in the photo, she is in the back of the group, wearing a black jacket and a green scarf and with her hair tied back. She recently entered the field of commerce, and she is going to sell toys, taking advantage of the Children's Day and Christmas seasons. She previously worked as a temporary farm laborer. María has high hopes for meeting the challenge of her business. 

With the loan, she will buy toys for her business. She has already prepared a list of popular toys. 

Her goals for her business are to prosper and to establish herself with a stand in an open-air market. 

María lives with her husband and her three children. All of the children are studying at various levels. Her dreams are to provide a better quality of life for her family. She wants to obtain her own house, and for this purpose she is going to apply for a housing subsidy. 

She is very happy and grateful about the loan obtained from the Fondo Esperanza ["Hope Fund"], since it will allow her to invest and generate better earnings to achieve her goals. Additionally, she feels very comfortable with the group in her communal bank, since she has learned from the experiences of the other members and has felt how committed they are.

Chillán is a township in the central-southern zone of Chile. Its name means "seat of the sun" in Mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuche people. Chillán is known as the "Cradle of the Country" or the "Land of Artists," since distinguished personalities in Chile's history have been born there, such as the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy toys to sell.

loans.name: Almakan's Group

texts.en:
Almakan is the leader of this group. She is 63 years old and is unfortunately a widow. She has raised five children, all of whom are married and live separately from their mom. 

In order to earn money to meet her daily needs, Almakan breeds livestock. She started this activity fifteen years ago with an initial investment of 8000 soms. Reselling livestock after fattening them, she earns 2500 soms per month.  With the money received from this loan, Almakan wants to purchase more livestock animals for breeding. In the future, she dreams of building a big house for her children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is 37 years old.  She is married to a farmer with whom she brings up three daughters and three sons. The youngest son is a newborn baby and all the other children are at school. Nazira owns a grocery store, where she sells foodstuffs. Fifteen years ago her husband got ten farm animals as an inheritance from his parents. Since that moment the husband has been breeding cattle in order to earn additional funds to cover daily expenses.  Nazira sells milk (about 20 liters a day).  

Nazira applied for the loan because she needs funds to purchase two bull-calves for breeding, fattening and further selling.  In the future, with the profits gained from selling cattle, she wants to finish house construction of a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase bull-calves for breeding, fattening and selling

loans.name: Tadea

texts.es:
Tadea nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Huancarani y tiene 48 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene seis hijos. 

Actualmente, Tadea vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de sopas, comidas y caldos de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Huancarani. En esta oportunidad Tadea requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como carne, verduras, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Tadea was born in Paucartambo Province in the city of Huancarani.  She’s 48 years old, a widow and has six children.  

Currently, Tadea lives in the city of her birth where she carries out her economic activities.  She sells soup, meals and broth throughout the city of Huancarani.  On this occasion, Tadea needs the loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, oil and other things.

The “Once de Mayo-Huancarani” (May 11-Huancarani) communal bank meets monthly in Huancarani District of Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial zone as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, rice, oil and other things.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a married woman with two school going children. Her husband is a fisherman and contributes financially to provide for the family's basic needs. Risper has a house with neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees her children. 

Risper has operated a cafe for the past two years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, where demand is low during the dry season because of lack of food. She dreams of establishing another café in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She would also like to expand the café structure. She decided to join Yehu because of its favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil and also to expand the café structure.

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in Dornod, a province of Mongolia. They live in her father’s house. Dornod borders the Russian boundary, and Batchimeg makes sales of livestock meat between Russians and Mongolian customers. She and her husband drive around and buy meat from suppliers in the countryside for lower prices. She has been running this business for many years and they have a lot of loyal customers, which make the business mutually efficient. 

A month ago she decided to start a new direction of her sales, selling things such as handmade leather shoes. She has made an order of Mongolian handmade leather shoes from suppliers in UlaanB., the capital city of Mongolia. She is going to sell them to Russian customers at a reasonable price. Since the winter is coming this kind of trading is gainful. She is requesting a loan to cover the fee of her order in advance. It is very important to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to cover the fee of her order of handmade leather shoes.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman wants a loan to buy maize produce for selling.  Aged-42-years, Roman hails from the Kyenjojo District in Uganda and is a father of four children whom he lives with together with their mother in a semi permanent house. 

Having started by farming, Roman saved money to start up his business which has grown over 5 years. His dream is to educate his children and he wishes to acquire a motorcycle in the near future for easier transportation while doing his business activities.

loans.use: to buy maize produce for selling.

loans.name: Wa'el

texts.en: Wa'el is a 47-year-old man; he is married with no children yet. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Wa'el wants to make repairs to his house such as changing tiles, changing windows and doors, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Wa'el gets the loan, he will be able to repair his house and offer his family better living conditions. Wa'el is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to make repairs to his house and improve it to live in conditions

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 39-year-old married man from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. He is the father of six children.
Wael is a blacksmith. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to purchase a new machine.
Wael's aspiration is to improve his family's living conditions through increasing his income.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for his work.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mohamed. He is engaged to a business woman and has 1 child, age 10 years. 

In 1994, Mohamed established his hair dressing salon, hair products and attachments business. He began his business because he did not go to school. Since his elder brother owns a beauty salon, that's where Mohamed joined. He was trained into the business. He makes good profit out of it and it is what he knows best. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,084,000 SLL every month from this business. He serves ladies and women of the city centre and neighboring villages. Mohamed is good at his business. He designs the latest hair styles, attachments and other products to fit their earnings. He has two suppliers located in Freetown. He normally buys his hair products and attachments three times per month using public transportation.  

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase attachments – Hair Weavon - 5 dozen @ 360,000 SLL and Expression Hair - 1 dozen @ 1,200,000 SLL. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 163,000 SLL. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to build a house with a shop. By taking this loan, it will help him increase his capital and get more profits. He is so excited with his type business as a male. He wants to educate his son so he becomes a good citizen in the future. The rainy season is his challenge as his business usually slows down. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase attachments – Hair Weavon - 5 dozen @ 360,000 SLL and Expression Hair - 1 dozen @ 1,200,000 SLL

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Amarjargal is 36 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She started her traditional boot making business in 2009. Her husband helps with her business. Amarjargal learned boot making from her father. Her boots are stylish and well-made so the demand is increasing. 

Amarjargal is requesting a loan for 600,000 MNT, which she will use to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Francisca;  La socia tiene 53 años de edad, La socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 19, 22 años de edad; la socia se dedica al comercio minorista a la compra productos de abarrotes y verduras, los cuales los distribuye a los diferentes clientes en sus tiendas La socia es como una distribuidora de productos al por menor, la socia es independiente y desearía crecer más su negocio y sus ingresos, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora, siempre está haciendo algo y obteniendo ganancias para sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyarlos en sus estudios. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, harinas, leches, fideos entre otros productos, también comprara verduras como hortalizas zanahorias, lechugas, repollo, cebollas, zanahorias.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the "Señor del Calvario", communal bank, located in the district of Calca, which is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department. She is 53, lives with her partner, and has two children, ages 19, and 22. 

The borrower serves the retail trade, buying grocery products and vegetables, which she distributes to her various clients in their shops. She works as a distributor of retail products.

She is independent, and would like to see her business and income grow. She is a very hard-working woman; always doing something, and earning money to raise her children, and support them in their schooling.

She is applying for a loan to buy grocery products such as rice, sugar, flours, milks, noodles and other things. She will also buy vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, cabbage, and onions.  She is thankful for the loan, and promises to make her payments in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: To buy groceries, such as rice,sugar, flours, milks, noodles, and other products, as well as vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, cabbage, and onions.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a single man. He describes himself as an ambitious man. He has been selling home products for the last eight years. Previously, he was involved in a farming business. His business challenge is the high cost of goods sold when buying. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more home products. Roberts hopes in the next five years, he will have expanded his business.

loans.use: To buy more home products to sell

loans.name: Venicia Dionisia

texts.es:
Venicia sigue laborando como conserje y sigue con su pequeño negocio de alquiler de cuarto. solo ha terminado de apoyar  a sus hijos, hoy en dia separada de su esposo, atraves de sus ahorros logro hacer los cuartos que hoy en dia, son parte de sus ingresos.
Hara mantenimiento en su techo, al cambiar laminas de zinc y compra de perlines, para mejorar su condicion, ya que esta con muchos ollos el zinc, por falta de mantenimiento, ya que sus prestamo lo ha invertido en dar mejoras a los cuartos de alquiler. Pero hoy es necesario, ya que no quiere pasar otro invierno en las misma condiciones
texts.en:
Venicia is still working as a caretaker and still has her business renting out rooms.  She’s done supporting her children and she’s separated from her husband.  With her savings she managed to build the rooms she has now which are part of her income.

She will be doing some roof maintenance replacing the metal sheets and she’ll buy purlines to improve its condition since the metal has many holes in it due to lack of maintenance since she’s used her loans to invest in improvements for her rental rooms.  But, now it’s necessary because she does not want to spend another winter under the same conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to repair the roof.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  DEMBAGNOUMA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier BABEMBA un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur premier prêt  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
FATOUMATA  fait le commerce de savon  dans ce groupe et elle est en deuxième position à partir de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  10 cartons de savon  et revend en détail  sur place  et au marché à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.

loans.use: Pour acheter du savon

loans.name: Saroen's Group

texts.en:
Saroen lives in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is 34 years old and married with four children. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer for more than ten years while her husband is a fisherman. The current business earns her about 24,000KHR per day to make a living and afford to save 4,000KHR each day after expenses.
Saroen is just with VisionFund for this cycle and now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Kenblest Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Joel. He is fifty seven years old, married and a father of six children. He is a member of Kenblest Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
He does maize, beans and potatoes farming and also sells second hands clothes. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more stock of cloth so as to meet his customers’ demand thus increase his income. This will enable him cater for the family needs such as food, medicine and in paying school fees for his children. 
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cloth and meet customers' demand thus more income to cater for family needs such as food, medicine and paying school fees for his children

loans.name: Nely

texts.en: After three years in business, I have good customers.  They know I will find them the kind of cloths they like at the right price, so they return to my shop.  The better my inventory, the more I sell.

loans.use: Purchase of Clothes for resale

loans.name: Alma Mireya

texts.en:
Alma began her business selling shoes through a catalog about two years ago because she needed to help support her family. Her husband is a day laborer and doesn't earn enough to cover the household expenses. Alma is working very hard to improve the standard of living for her family and to support her husband through this time of financial difficulty. She knows that with effort and strength she can overcome adversity which she has demonstrated through the success of her project.

Now Alma needs a loan for $USD1,200 to purchase additional merchandise and to fulfill orders from her customers. Alma needs you and hopes to receive this loan. You can make it happen with your support. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Alma inició su negocio de venta de zapatos por catálogo desde hace casi dos años, debido a la gran necesidad de sostener a su familia, pues su esposo, quien es obrero, no gana lo suficiente para solventar los gastos presentes. Es por esta situación que Alma trabaja muy duro para poder sacra adelante a su familia y apoyar a su esposo en estos momento de crisis económica por la que atraviesan actualmente. Ella sabe que con esfuerzo y fortaleza las adversidades pueden superarse y lo ha demostrado son el éxito se su proyecto.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 1200 DLLS para poder comprar más mercancía y hacer frente a os pedidos de sus clientes. Alma te necesita y tiene la esperanza de poder recibir dicho crédito, tu puedes hacerlo posible con tu colaboración, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina tiene 36 años, esta casada y tiene tres hijos, de 14, 9 y 6 años. En el año 2000, la familia pasó por momentos difíciles por que los gastos se incrementaban por el nacimiento de su último hijo, Cristy inició con la venta de cosméticos, con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo con los compromisos del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, el gusto por la ventas la ha llevado a vender varios productos, a ganar más clientes y aumentar sus pedidos.

En estos momentos Cristy necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y poder brindarles un buen servicio, ella ofrece retornar el crédito en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Conviértete en parte importante de sus logros, tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

Translated to English by Nuria Ruiz

Cristina is married and she has three kids 14, 9 and 6 years old. The family went through some hard times when their third child was born, the family expenses started were too high for the family income. In order to help her husband provide for the family Cristy started selling cosmetics. She turned out to be a great saleswoman and she was able to grew her clientele and volume quite fast.

At this time Cristy is asking for a loan of $750. She will use the loan to advanced purchases of inventory so she can better serve her clients. She will repay the loan in a 6 to 12 month interval. This family would greatly appreciate your help.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Yokub

texts.ru:
Yakub M. has been in business for 12 years and for 6 of these he has been a client of MicroInvest. He started his business by selling several kinds of perfume in a small stall. At the moment his assets are worth $1100. His product selection has doubled. Yakub M. is married with 2 children. He is asking for $1200 to further expand his product selection and to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Мавлонов Якуб в бизнесе 12 лет, из них 6 лет является клиентом Микроинвест. Начинал свой бизнес с продажей нескольких видов парфюмерий в маленьком прилавке. На данный момент его активы составляют 1100$. Его ассортимент товаров увеличился в двое. Мавлонов Якуб женат, имеет 2-х детей. Он просит 1200$ для увеличения ассортимента товара и расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Expand his business and product selection

loans.name: Alhaji Muhamed

texts.en: Alhaji Muhamed J. is thirty-three years old and is married with four children.  He runs a business of selling secondhand clothes while his wife sells palm oil.  Muhamed started his business when he was 15 years old but his business was destroyed by the rebels during the civil war in Sierra Leone.  After the war, he started all over again with a small amount of capital from family members.  With his previous loan form SMT he was able to expand and diversify his business.  He is requesting more loan funds to increase his stock of clothing and involve his wife in running the business.  Mohamed’s hope is to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to expand his used clothing business

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
F. Rafael was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Agdam region, situated in the western part of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. He is 45 years old and the father of three children. He settled with his family in Sumgait city in 1993.

Right now, he lives with his family in Sumgayit city, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 1996. He began his business with $200.

He started selling a small variety of shoes. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet his family's food and important consumption needs.

Having borrowed the loan amount of $500 from Normicro, he rented a shop. The loans were paid back in a timely manner.

Rafael wants expand his business and to begin selling a different variety of clothes. He wants a $900 loan. He hopes to eventually expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To expand his business and to begin selling a different variety of clothes

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar is an experienced business woman, as she has been in business for 15 years. She was compelled to earn money for family needs because her husband met with an accident and became an invalid. These hard life conditions have made her a strong and tolerant person.

Muyassar has three children and due her business earnings she has been able to bring them up appropriately and help them to find good jobs for their future life. Today she earns money for herself and for her husband.

Her business is located in Istaravshan's wholesale market. She sells galoshes and traditional shoes which always are in good demand among the local population, as Tadjikistan is montainous country and they are suited to the environment. She currently has good turnover of her goods. For the coming winter season, Muyassar wants to buy the next batch of warm galoshes, "massi" (traditional-style boots) and slippers for indoor wear.

loans.use: Purchase of warm types of galoshes and slippers for indoor wear

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es:
Maria Regina is a partner of the La Amistad Communal Bank and lives in the district and province of Moyobamba in San Martin. She has a stand in the city’s central market where she sells provisions. She decided to start this business because she needed to generate her own income to maintain her children, and knowing her sales abilities in other types of business, she saw that this activity was more profitable and less tiring than the previous ones.

The loan of S/. 1,100.00, which she will repay in 6 months, will buy her different products like bananas in bunches, cassavas, oranges and lemons in sacks, fruits, vegetables and bottled honey, and with that she will have her stand well-stocked and will satisfy her clients’ needs.

Maria Regina is 55 years old and is separated from her husband. She has four children, two of them still very young. She is an optimistic, responsible and entrepreneurial woman, and she wishes to have another stand in that market for the sale of prepared food.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.
