La señora Maria Regina es socia del banco comunal La Amistad, vive en del distrito y provincia de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín. Ella tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad donde vende productos de pan llevar o de primera necesidad. Decidió iniciar este negocio porque tenía la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos para poder mantener a sus hijos y conocedora de sus habilidades como comerciante en otros tipos de negocio vio que esta actividad era más rentable y descansado que los anteriores.

El préstamo de S/. 1,100.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diferentes productos como plátanos en racimos, yucas, naranjas y limones en sacos, frutas , verduras y miel de abeja en botellas y con ello tener bien surtido su puesto de venta y de esa manera poder satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes.

Tiene 55 años, separada de su esposo, tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos aún pequeños. Es una mujer optimista, responsable y emprendedora, la cual anhela tener otro puesto en el mercado para la venta de comida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (bananas, cassavas, oranges, lemons, fruits, vegetables, honey, etc)

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina belongs to the communal bank Señor de los Milagros de Chavin. She sells food (breakfast and lunch), an activity she started at 15 years of age when selling corn, eggs, and potato soup. Her business is located in the Chavin de Huantar district in the Ancash department.

With the loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $350USD), to be repaid in 6 monthly installments, she will buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes and vegetables (such as beans, lentils and split peas).

Bernardina is 70 years old, a widow, and has 5 grown children who support their own homes. She, through her business, supports herself.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bernardina pertenece al banco comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chavin. Se dedica a la venta de alimentos (desayuno y almuerzo). Esta actividad la inició a los 15 años de edad vendiendo choclo, huevo, papa sancochada y sopa de papa. Posteriormente amplió el negocio con la venta de desayuno (caldo de cabeza, caldo de gallina, etc.) y almuerzos (menú). El negocio está ubicado en el distrito de Chavin de Huantar, provincia de Huari, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 cuotas, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 2 baldes de aceite, 5 paquetes de fideos surtido, 1 saco de papa, 20 kilos de menestras (frijoles, lentejas y arvejas partidas). Bernardina tiene 70 años, es viuda, tiene 5 hijos que son independientes y que se dedican a solventar sus hogares y ella con ayuda del negocio se mantiene sola.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for cooking (sugar, oil, noodles, etc.)

loans.name: Ho Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hồ Thị Bình, 47 years old, lives with her husband and 6 children in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. She is a third year member of the TYM Fund. Two of her 6 children are still in school. Monthly expenses for their education are 30 to 40USD. To provide education for those two and household expenses Mrs. Bình and her husband run a small animal husbandry business. They buy calves, feed them for few months the resell for profit. The current income of 200USD a month is barely sufficient. She is applying for a loan of 450USD to buy more calves and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Hồ Thị Bình, 47 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 6 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị Bình là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ Tình thương. Trong số 6 người con của chị có 2 người còn đang đi học. Chi phí cho việc học hành của 2 cháu hàng tháng khoảng 30-40USD. Để có tiền cho con ăn học và nuôi sống gia đình, chị Bình cùng chồng mua lợn, bò về nuôi và bán lại khi được giá. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình chỉ đủ cho những khoản chi phí hàng ngày và trả tiền tuần. Với mong muốn tăng thêm thu nhập, vòng vốn này chị Bình xin vay 450USD để tiếp tục đầu tư cho công việc chăn nuôi của mình. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 200USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy piglets and calves

loans.name: Dorisi

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Dorisi N.. She is married, and has three children, ages 1 month, 3 and 5. In 2005, Dorisi established her liquor store and cereals business. Dorisi has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock of beer and soft drinks in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Midjratodo Agadon Group

texts.fr:
Midjratodo Agadon is a group of ten women who live in Agadon. This group was created in 1984 and processes palm nuts and cassava. The group has been having trouble financing its business for quite some time due to the inexistence of a microfinance institution that can assist it in finding funds. This loan will give the group the financial resources it needs to increase production and improve the members’ standards of living.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

MIDJRATODO AGADON est un groupement composé de 10 femmes qui se trouve à AGADON. Ce groupement qui existe depuis 1984 fait la transformation de noix de palme et également la transformation de manioc. Ce groupement connaît des problèmes de financement de ses activités depuis fort longtemps à cause de l’inexistence d’une IMF pouvant les accompagner. Le présent financement leur permettra de disposer de ressources financières pour l’augmentation de la production et l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: Purchase of 12 tons of palm nuts

loans.name: Hounzouhoin

texts.fr:
Mme. Hounzouhoin D. is 70 years old, married and the mother of one child. Despite her ripe old age, her energy shines in her activities. She sells second-hand clothes from market to market. The income she derives allows her to provide for her personal needs as well as those of the family, her husband being so old. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 70 ans, madame Hounzouhoin D. est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Malgré son âge avancé, elle montre un dynamisme à travers ses activités. Elle vend des friperies de marché en marché et le revenu qu’elle tire lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et à ceux de la famille, tant son mari est vieux. Afin d’accroître son revenu et redynamiser son commerce elle sollicite un crédit, qui lui permettra de subvenir plus à ses besoins.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Chiv

texts.en: Chiv N., 29, is a professional tailor, making US$3 each day in the Kampong Cham province. She is married and has one child living at home. Her husband, Yem Yea, makes approximately US$2.50 every day, making incense. Chiv N. would like a loan of US$500 to purchase three more sewing machines for her business. She will be able to increase her profits byhiring employees to run these machines.

loans.use: Purchase three sewing machines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a large quantity of materials and products for a small beauty salon.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin Z. is 43 years old and the father of three children.  He and his wife are raising them with love and trying to ensure they have everything that teenagers may need. Working hard to attain a better lifestyle and rise out of poverty, Amin operates a workshop where he repairs electronic equipment such as televisions, tape recorders, and radios. He has been involved in this field for over 13 years and has gained a vast amount of experience. His shop is located near a very busy market, which has allowed him to establish a stable volume of clients. 

Amin is now requesting a loan of $1000 in order to purchase the spare parts necessary for his business. He hopes to thereby increase his income and be able to send his sons to the university. Amin promises to repay the loan within nine months, and your support will really help him. Let us make it possible for this noble father to earn, through his work as a radio technician, enough to provide for the wellbeing of his beloved family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for development of the business.

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima A. is 45 years old and married with five children between the ages of 8 and 16. She sells small fish and spices. Naima works at her business every day and earns a monthly profit of about $25.

Naima has successfully used a previous loan, also from BRAC Tanzania, to expand her business. She is now requesting a second loan to buy more fish and spices for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and spices inventory for her business.

loans.name: Hera Ganga

texts.en:
Hera Ganga K. is a resident of Balku, kathmandu. She lives with her father-in-law, mother-in-law and husband. Her husband, Mr. Bikash K., works in his own meat shop.
Mrs. K. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Khokhana. She opened her grocery store two years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her store. Her father-in-law and mother-in-law help her in her work.
Now, Mrs. K. is asking for a loan to invest in her shop to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.use: To invest in her shop

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohamad lives in Keb Elias in the Bekaa valley. A young man of 29 years, Mohammad takes care of a small butchery in his home town. Working since he was 18 years-old, this young man helps his dad take care of his sisters and mother.

In 2006, Mohammad decided to go out on his own and opened his own butchery to provide meat and poultry to the whole neighborhood.

Mohammad requests a loan of $800 to stock up with basic necessities for his butchery.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for his butchery.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 48 años, está divorciada y vive sola en un cuarto que alquila. Es una mujer independiente que a pesar de todos los problemas, ha sabido salir adelante, trabaja en la venta de cosméticos durante 10 años, y le ha sido favorable, ya que le ha brindado las posibilidades de vivir cómodamente. A Bertha le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite convencer a las personas de adquirir sus productos y así ha ganado muchas amigas, las cuales ahora solo le compran a ella. Lo más difícil es el cansancio que se siente al caminar a las casas de las clientas para entregar los productos, pero ella es muy empeñosa y piensa seguir trabajando en busca de un mejor porvenir. Bertha se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con este dinero solicitara más productos de belleza para vender en esta época de Navidad.
texts.en:
Bertha is 48, is divorced and lives alone in a room that she rents. She is an independent woman who despite all of her problems, has learned to move forward. She has worked in cosmetic sales for 10 years and this has been favorable for her, now that she has realized the possibility of living comfortably. Bertha likes her job a lot, because it allows her to convince people to acquire her products, and like this she has gained a lot of friends, who now only buy from her. The hardest part is the exhaustion she feels walking to the houses of her clients to show the products but she is very determined and she thinks of continuing to work in search of a better living. Bertha finds herself in her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With this money she will get more beauty products to sell this Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her products to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Kalanzi B- Eva Group

texts.en:
Eva A., 35, is a single mother of three and a hairdresser by profession. After attaining a certificate in hairdressing eight years back, she raised some capital and opened up Eva’s Beauty Salon in Kibuli. She is a specialist in plaiting, weaving, treatment, retouching and curling kit. On her price list, plaiting and weaving rank highest at 15,000 Ugandan shillings (about $USD7.50) per head. In the good seasons, like the months of November, December, January, May and August, she makes an average of 200,000 Ugandan shillings per day - a little over $USD100; in lean seasons, she makes UGX20,000.

Eva will use this loan to replenish her stock of cosmetics - hair relaxers, hair treatment, deodorants, perfumes, foundation powders and nail varnishes - and hair additions - afro kinky, hi yaki, babe cut, Abuja braids, pony braids and human hair. Eva wins over her customers by ensuring good services. She works hard to ensure she provides for her family. Her dream is expanding her salon into a modern fully equipped one, hoping that it will yield more income to enable her family to live a good life.

Eva will share this loan with the four other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics and hair additions for her salon.

loans.name: Mrs. Sun Sae Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank group consisting of 22 members is located in Trakuon village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  Mrs. Sun S. was selected by the group members to be the village bank president. She is a housewife who wants to start a new business; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy bananas to resell in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Un Navy, is a musician who is hired by the villagers for wedding ceremonies, parties and S. on. Mrs. Sun S. is 63 years old and the mother of six children; two of them are employed in a garment factoR., two are security workers, and two are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables.  The remaining members of the group will use their portions of the loan for their own purposes.

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale.

loans.name: Lide Del Carmen

texts.es: La sra Lide tiene 46 años de edad, reside en el barrio Francisco Salazar en la ciudad de Managua, con cinco hijos mayores de edad, trabajan y me ayudan,   su esposo se desempeña en carpintería, el negocio de la doña Lide es la venta de cosmético, ropa y zapatos, desde hace siete años comenzó con ayudad de su esposo, sus planes es poder tener una tienda donde pueda ofertar sus productos variados, con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar productos de la Avon , ropa de niño y adultos, unos son encargos que entrega al crédito  para la quincena, y otros para su inventario, espera obtener mejores ingresos y seguir creciendo en las ventas.
texts.en:
Lide is 46 years old and lives in the Francisco Salazar neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has five grown children who work and help her out. Her husband is a carpenter. Lide’s business is the sale of cosmetics, clothes and shoes. She started seven years ago with her husband’s help. Her plan is to be able to have a store where she could offer her varied products. The request of this loan is to buy Avon products, children and adult clothing, for some orders that she gives on credit, and for her inventory. She hopes to generate better income and continue growing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and Avon products.

loans.name: Jose Baciliso

texts.es: Don Jose es soltero, de 42 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos menores (2 varones y 2 mujeres), todos estudiando, esta solicitando su 2do credito para utilizarlo en la division de la casa para 2 cuartos y las puertas, tambien hará ampliacion para una cocina, ya que la que usa es de pedazos de tabla y zinc, su casa es de un proyecto de la Alcaldia donde con el credito anterior reunio los $.300.00 dólares que debia pagar mas el trabajo que el realizo, la casa es de 6 vrs cuadradas.  Trabaja como guarda de seguridad en la Alcaldia Municipal, no tiene ningun dia libre, solamente las horas libres despues de sus 8 hrs de turno, su compañera no trabaja en estos momentos, debido a que ella hacia pan, pero el horno se le destruyó, si el credito ajusta se construira éste porque es una forma de ayudarse en los gastos de alimentacion.
texts.en:
Jose is single, 42 years old, and has four small children (two boys and two girls), all of whom study. He is soliciting his second loan to be used for two rooms and doors in his house. He will also make an extension for a kitchen, as their current one is made of board pieces. His house is a municipal project, where he combined previous credit with $300, which he had to pay on top of the work he performed. He works as a security guard at Municipal Hall. He doesn't have any days off, only the hours after his eight-hour shift. His girlfriend does not currently work, since the oven she used to make bread was destroyed. If his credit line is increased, he will fix this as it helps them pay for food.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room division and doors

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys O. is a fishmonger and sells her goods at the fish port in Elmina; she has been in business since 2003.  Gladys is married with 3 children and her husband is employed as a driver. Gladys uses her income to assist her husband in paying for the family’s bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to further her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Edith Karina

texts.es:
Edith es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy.
Edith es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 1 hija, Edith junto a su esposo tienen un bar llamado Palizada, en donde vende bebidas variadas y los días sábados y domingos vende comida típica. Además en los últimos meses aperturó una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de su mama.
Edith necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Edith son que su hija que esta delicada de salud mejore, y su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy.

Edith lives with her husband. She is 22 years old and has one daughter. Edith and her husband have a bar called Palizada where they sell various beverages and on Saturdays and Sundays sell local food. In addition, in recent months she opened a grocery store in her mother's house.

Edith needs a loan of $325 (1000 PEN) which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Edith's dreams are that the delicate health of her daughter improves and her business continues to grow.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Mosili

texts.en: Mosili D. A. is 60 years old and married with 2 children. She has a shop where she sells bags of onions. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more bags of onions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua O. started her fish sales a year ago in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Akosua prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them. She has a large customer base which travels from other parts of the community to buy her fish. She has also added the sale of cooking spices to her inventory to attract more customers.

She is now 48 years old, married, and the mother of two children. All her children have completed senior high school. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of assorted fishes and make increased sales. She will use the additional income to support her children's education and her business' growth. She belongs to the village bank called Promise.

loans.use: For fish to cook and sell

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: Roberta tiene 60 años es viuda, vive con sus 2 hijas mayores en su casa propia. DesD. hace más D. 10 años se dedica a la venta D. productos alimenticios D. su zona (truchas, papa, quesos, etc.), cada 15 días viaja a otras ciudades para comercializarlos en los mercados o ferias locales y también dejar los pedidos D. sus clientes regulares. Con el tiempo y la experiencia Roberta ha sabido superar los riesgos D. su trabajo, tales como la descomposición D. alguno D. sus productos en el camino cuando la carretera está bloqueada debido a las fuertes lluvias, pese a estas circunstancias, su esfuerzo ha sido compensado con las ganancias que recibe. Para el futuro, Roberta desea seguir dedicándose a esta actividad hasta donD. den sus fuerzas. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy entusiasmada por la oportunidad que tiene D. formar parte D. un banco comunal, donD. se compromete a ser  muy responsable. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. los productos que venD..
texts.en:
Roberta, 60, is a widow. She lives with her 2 grown daughters in the house she owns. For more than 10 years, she's maD. a living selling local food products (trout, potatoes, cheese, etc.). Every 15 days, she travels to other cities in order to sell her products at local markets or fairs and to drop off orders for her regular customers. With time and experience, Roberta has learned how to mitigate the risks of her business, risks such as losing part of her stock to decomposition when the roads are blocked because of torrential rains. Even so, her efforts have paid off with the earnings that she's maD.. For the future, Roberta wants to continue working at the business that she's put so much effort to build. This is her first MFP loan and she's excited by the opportunity to be a part of a community bank and committed to being responsible to it. The money that she's requesting will be invested in the purchase of larger quantities of the products that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet C. is a rice grower. She is 41 this year and tills a one-hectare farm with her husband, Emelio C.. Her harvest pays for her family's basic needs. It also helps to pay for her children's books, tuition and other school fees.

Juliet became interested in the services offered by Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She was able to meet other small entrepreneurs and discuss their businesses. She is now applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy two sacks of fertilizer, herbicide and other farm supplies. As well as credit, CEVI also offers insurance cover to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of fertilizer, herbicide and other farm supplies

loans.name: Hoàng Thị

texts.en:
L. Hoàng Thị (1435050977) is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương.  She is married and has two infant children.  To make a living, L. owns & operates a specialized retail store.  While not the onL. means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primariL. from selling metal & metal-related products in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximateL. 6000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfulL. repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Баракабоев Рустам !968 года рожд. Проживает  в Джаборрасуловком  районе. Население района в основном  держат скот и Рустам также занимается откормом мелкого скота. Вместе со своей семьёй они держат стадо овец и пасут на пастбище каждый день. Рустам откармливает стадо 5-6 мес-в и продает их на базаре. «Самое прибыльное время для продажи овец – это  осень и зима» считает  Рустам и готовит своих овец к продаже.На наш кредит он намерен закупить ещё одну партию  овец и   оставить их на зиму.Он очень рад что сотрудничает с нами и может положится на нас в любое время.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Rustam B. was born in 1968. He lives in the Jabbor-rasulov region. Most of the population of the region keep cattle and Rustam also feeds small cattle. Together with his family they keep a herd of sheep and shepherd them on the pasture every day. Rustam feeds the herd for five to six months and sells it on the market. Autumn and winter are the most profitable time to sell sheep, thinks Rustam and prepares his sheep for sale. He wants to use our loan to buy another stock of sheep and keep them for the winter. He is very happy to be working with us and can rely on us in any time.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres Progresistas, un bankito muy sólido, solidario y unido. Llevan muchos años realizando prestamos y son las personas más agradecidas porque gracias a estos préstamos han logrado superarse y sacar  a sus familias adelante, brindándoles una vida digna y se encuentran muy orgullosas de sus logros, como grupo son muy alegres y extrovertidas se llevan muy bien entre todas, aquí el testimonio de una socia. 

María vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 57 años de edad;  es viuda hace cuatro años y medio, tiene 6 hijos de 27, 24, 22, 20, 17, 14 años de edad, todos sus hijos son solteros trabajan y estudian excepto sus dos últimos hijos que solo estudian y le ayudan en  casa, su hija mayor se encuentra en Chile realizando una maestría en hidrosanitarios y avalúos;  no poseen casa propia.

María trabaja como empleada privada en la unidad educativa El Americano y lo bueno de trabajar en la institución es que obtiene un ingreso fijo, también tiene una tiendita en su casa  trabajando en ella unos 6 años y los beneficios que ha obtenido en la tienda es que se ayuda para los buses, la comida y otros gastos extras que nunca faltan, en su tienda le ayudan su hijos menores, siendo un gran apoyo en su vida.

María trabaja aproximadamente 10 años con la fundación y se siente satisfecha por la confianza que le han brindado, la comprensión y el apoyo recibido, el préstamo que realiza es para la inversión en su tienda para surtirle mucho más, mejorar el servicio, mantener y obtener una nueva clientela.

Su meta es mejorar su negocio, incrementarlo poco a poco y, mantener un stock adecuado de productos para sus clientes   para llegar a  independizarse y enseñarles a sus hijos a trabajar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a member of Progressive Women’s Community Bank, a small, solid, and united bank. They have fulfilled loans for many years. They are the most grateful individuals since they have been able to improve their standard of living for themselves and their families. This is apparent since they can offer them a suitable life and are very proud of their accomplishments. The group as a whole is cheerful and extroverted. They get along well among themselves. Here is a testimony from one of their members. Maria lives in the center of the city, Cuenca, is 57 years old, and is a widow now four years and a half. She has 6 children ranging from ages 27, 24, 22, 20, 17, and 14. They are all single. They work and study except for the two youngest who only study and help around the house. Her eldest daughter is in Chile earning a master’s degree in hydro-sanitary and appraisal. They do not own a home of their own. Maria works as a private employee in the Educational Unit, The American, and the best thing about working in this institution is that she has a fixed income. She has also worked six years in a small shop she has in her home so she can afford bus fees, food and other expenses which are always coming up. Her youngest children help her run the store and greatly support her in life. Maria has worked approximately 10 years with the foundation and is satisfied with the trust, understanding, and support she has received. The loan will be invested in her store and will provide a wider assortment of goods, improve service, and attract new customers. Her goals are to improve her business, build it little by little, maintain an abundant stock of products for her customers, to become independent and teach her children how to work hard.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her business with more merchandise and improve service

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en: Bummi is 40 years old and married with two children. To make a living, she sells palm oil both wholesale and retail. Bummi has been in this business since 2002. She hopes for a loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian Naira (NGN) to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha Elizabeth V. A. posee un taller de costura, que inicio hace mas de trece años, después de concluir su curso de corte y confección.  Martha nos dice que cuando comenzó solo tenia una maquina que le facilito su esposo. Elaboraba ropa por encargo, Luego conforme al tiempo, aprendió a hacer Güipiles Típicos (Trajes para bailes típicos nicaragüenses).

Actualmente y con la ayuda de los créditos de ADIM, adquiero una maquina de pedal más y una industrial de puntada. Con la ayuda de su esposo y su nuera cubren la demanda de trajes típicos que tiene y trabaja en la elaboración de ropa por encargo.

Agradece los créditos que ADIM le han proporcionado y anhela tener un taller mas grande y acrecentar su ingresos. Alega  que a pesar de todos lo problemas económicos que ha tenido ha podido salir adelante, “Con la gracia de Dios uno no deja de trabajar” nos dice Martha

loans.use: Materia Prima

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him C., age 37, lives in her own small house with other family members from Kampong Chhnang Province. To earn a living, she sells in retail cooking supply that she buys it in bulk from the market at reasonable price. Some of her clients are her nearby neighbors who also buy her produce on credit for a few days on produce’s cost. To help be responsible for family, her husband works in construction for a profit. This couple has given birth to two school-aged kids. Recently, a part of her item has been sold out from her stock. Him C. wants to acquire another inventory and is requesting a loan from HKL to purchase more her grocery items to continue selling.

loans.use: To purchase more her grocery items to continue selling

loans.name: No One Knows Tomorrow Group

texts.en:
Fatmata F., Isatu C., Zainab K. and Fatmata K. call their group No One Knows Tomorrow. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to help them develop their businesses. With the aid of this loan, their businesses will increase both in size and quality, attracting more customers so that sales. profits, and their standard of living will improve.

Fatmata F., a 40-year-old divorced mother of six, is the leader of this group. Four of Fatmata’s children are attending secondary schools, while two are not yet of school-going age. In business for more than ten years now, Fatmata sells flour, sugar, rice, cakes, bread and cigarettes.

loans.use: Invest in their  businesses

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es:
Perla del Carmen R., Dalila Mercedes G. H. y  Esthela del Socorro R. integran al grupo Nueva  Generación que como su nombre lo indican  desean prosperar y reproducir sus negocios. 

G. H. se dedica al destace de cerdo a la venta de carne y de productos como moronga hechos con la sangre de cerdo, las tripas,  arroz y especies,  nacatamales hechos de masa, carne de cerdo, arroz, tomate, papa, chile, cebolla y chiltoma, frito, chicharrón, el chancho con yuca y cerdo asado o adobado.

Perla R.  vende verduras en su casa de habitación y ambulante esto es posible gracias a que  sus hijos  le ayudan a ver el negocio cuando sale a vender   y Esthela R.  vende cosméticos de la línea Avon, Zermat y productos comerciales.
texts.en:
Perla del Carmen R., Dalila Mercedes G. H., and Esthela del Socorro R. make up the Nueva Generación (New Generation) group. Like the name indicates, they want to prosper and keep their businesses going. G. H. butchers and sells pork. She also sells pork products like “moronga” (a traditional Nicaraguan dish) made from pork blood, intestines, rice, and spices. She also makes tamales made from dough, pork, rice, tomato, potato, chili, onion, and bell pepper; fried food; fried pork rinds; pork with yucca; and roasted or pickled pork. Perla R. sells vegetables in her house and as a street vendor. This is possible thanks to her children who watch her business when she leaves to sell. Esthela R. sells Avon and Zermat cosmetics and commercial products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork

loans.name: Iram

texts.es:
Iram es un joven soltero de 25 años, vive en la casa de su madre.
En vista de que tiene numerosos hermanos y sus padres no se abastecen con todos, él tuvo la iniciativa de sembrar sus propios cultivos de café, las cuales cosecharía en mayo de este año, pero no fue así, pues por falta de abono se atrasó la maduración. Por ello, Iram se siente muy inquieto, viendo la forma de cómo revertir esta situación, pues pese a que trabaja como jornalero en otras chacras, su sueldo de 15 soles diarios, no abastece para comprar sus ansiados fertilizantes.

Por tal motivo, recurre a este crédito para comprar los nitratos necesarios que puedan reanimar sus plantas y así logre cosechar este año.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que ratifica su compromiso de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, pues desea seguir contando con posteriores préstamos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Iram is a single young man, 25 years old, and lives in his mother's house. In view of the fact that he has many brothers and sisters, and his parents are never free of caring for them all, he took it upon himself to plant his own coffee crop, which he will harvest in May of this year. But it didn't turn out that way, due to a lack of fertilizer the crop was late in maturing. For that reason, Iram feels very unsettled, seeing the situation and wanting to turn it around, and even though he is employed as day labourer at other small farms, his salary of 15 soles daily, it's not enough to buy his desired fertilizers. For this reason, he requests this loan to buy nitrates necessary to envigorate his plants and thereby harvest (coffee) this year. This is his third loan with MFP, and he has paid back each loan fully and on time. He wants to continue counting on the past loans for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
From the striking and rich province of Rizal, Marieta C., one of the members of field partner ASHI-KIVA, has been engaged in buying and selling “ULING” (charcoal used for cooking instead of using gas stoves) for almost one year which gives her a reasonable income. For her fourth loan, she is seeking Php 15,000 specifically for the purchase of charcoal amounting to Php 7,000. Marieta will also get involved in buying and selling silver with loan funds of Php 6,000 and Vital C (vitamins) worth Php 2,000 because of her plan for a broader business so she can now step-by-step pursue her family's dreams.

She is married to her loving husband, Eugcuio C. aged 43, who is a soldier. They are happily living in the village of Kaytome Gulod on the island of Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines. She is blessed with three children; Marcel and Jenry are both soldiers and Donna Mae is still studying at college. The couple are so happy to see that their children also value good manners and correct conduct in the community.

She has always dreamt that her older children will be safe because of their work. Also she hopes that her youngest will finish her college degree and earn a good living in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal, silver and Vital C (vitamins) for sale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L., age 46, manages and tills a small rice farm in Santa Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She started by transplanting rice seedlings. She hopes that, with her effort, she will have an abundant harvest so that she will be able to buy her family food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to improve her rice crop.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Gedeon

texts.es:
El señor Gedeon A. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El señor Gedeon trabaja como empleado en un punto Internet de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito solicitado es para el anticipo parta la compra de un terreno cercano a su vivienda y así poder tener su vivienda propia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Gedeon A. lives in his parents’ house in the area of Llojeta on the western slope of the city of La Paz. He works in an Internet cafe in the city, and he lives off the income he receives there. The loan he is asking will be used as the down payment on a plot of land near their home so that one day he can build his own house there. This is the first time that Gedeon has requested a loan. The Bank’s socioeconomic analysis shows that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy land to build his own home on

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia, de 42 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y luchadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su carretilla de golosinas se encuentra ubicada en unos de los parques más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que ella siempre los atiende con mucha amabilidad y una sonrisa en los labios. Su carretilla tiene una gran variedad de productos, lo que ha hecho que su negocio le sea muy rentable.

A su vez, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el clima, ya que a veces hace mucho calor o a veces mucho frío.  Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda vender sus golosinas con más tranquilidad.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Aurelia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su carretilla.
texts.en:
Aurelia, 42 years old, is a woman who is very unassuming and a fighter. She lives in her own house and wants more than anything to improve her quality of life. Aurelia has a candy cart that is located in one of the most important parks in the city of Juliaca. Her cart is very popular with her customers, since she always attends to her customers with much kindness and a smile on her face. Her cart has a wide variety of products, which has made her business very profitable. In turn, what Aurelia likes most about her work is conversing with her customers. She has made a living in this business for 10 years, and says that the most difficult part of her job is enduring extreme temperatures, since it is sometimes very hot and sometimes very cold. Eventually she hopes to have a grocery store where she can sell her candies more comfortably. This is Aurelia’s third loan from Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that she has to make her payments on time and is determined to do so. She always keeps up to date with the agreements made in her group. Aurelia is asking for 1000 soles and will use the money to purchase more candies so that she can improve her cart’s setup.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean, 42, a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requested a loan of 12,000 PHP as additional capital for her business of corn farming. She tills a one-hectare corn field in Surallah, South Cotabato. She maintains the farm very well in order to have a plentiful harvest. 

She started corn farming in 1968. She now has two children, and her eldest is fifteen years old. With corn farming, she was able to provide the basic needs of her family. This loan will help a lot to purchase farm supplies.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 20 años de edad, convive con su esposa y no tiene hijos. Vive en el caserío El Romero del distrito de Mórrope, una zona rural cuya principal actividad es la agricultura y que queda ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de carbón y a la venta de animales, compra carbon a los productores de la zona y los comercializa con los negociantes que visitan el lugar regularmente, además cría sus aves en su domicilio para comercializarlas. Estas actividades le proveen los recursos necesarios para mantener a su joven familia. 

La temporada de lluvias que se ha presentado en la zona ha hecho que la producción de carbón disminuya, Elmer desea abastecerse de este producto para luego venderlo a un mejor precio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permita comprar más carbón para lograr su objetivo.

El es un joven bastante responsable y entregado a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es seguir saliendo adelante y bridarle a su esposa y a los hijos que vengan en el futuro una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer is 20 years old and lives with his wife. They don’t have any children and live in the El Romero neighborhood in the Mórrope district, a rural zone whose principal activity is agriculture, and is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He sells charcoal and animals. He buys charcoal from the local producers and sells it to the businessmen who regularly visit his place. He also raises birds in his home. These activities provide the resources needed to maintain his young family. The rainy season has slowed charcoal production and Elmer would like to stock up so that he can later resell it at a better price. He has seen fit to request his first loan of 1,000 PEN ($350) through Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy more charcoal and help him reach his objective. He is a very responsible young man bound to his work. His greatest desire is to continue to get ahead and give his wife and future children a good future and a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchse charcoal for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys, a 45-year-old married lady with four children, has been a tailor for the past 15 years.  As a member of Faulu Kenya, she received two previous loans which she used to increase her stock and purchase a sewing machine.  In order to achieve greater output, Gladys is  requesting a loan of Kes.30,000 to purchase an embroidery machine and add to her stock of cloth materials.  She hopes to increase her number of clients in the future.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and add stock of cloth material

loans.name: Penelope

texts.en:
Penelope S. is 48 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Penelope has many years of experience in this business.  Penelope needs a loan of WST $2100 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Penelope joined SPBD.This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Penelope's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Faiz Mai's Group

texts.en:
Faiz mai, age 47, lives in the city of Multan, a city famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. She has given birth to five children: four sons and a daughter. Faiz mai's husband, M. R., is a tailor and can stitch both gentlemen's and ladies' clothes. All their children are very talented. They are getting an education but are also learning tailoring skills from their father. 
 
The entire family operates a clothes sewing business. This is the major source of their income. They have been involved in this profession for the last 10 years.

Faiz mai has successfully repaid her two loans to Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying again for a loan to buy another sewing machine in order to expand her clothes sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine for the family tailoring business

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo S. is 45 years old and lives in Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. He has three children, the eldest of whom is 20. Nilo is a farmer whose main crop is rice. He owns the land he farms, and grows and sells rice to be able to provide whatever his family needs. He wants to be the best possible father to all his children and he hopes that they will be able to finish their studies.

Nilo would like to increase his harvest. He is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from KIVA partner, Community Econonomic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm Supplies

loans.name: Maria Alfonza

texts.es:
La Sra. María Alfonza es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es madre de hijos en edad escolar.

Ella es vendedora de ropas, colchas, hamacas y otros artículos de diferentes estilos, su venta lo realiza en forma ambulante en la ciudad de Itá con clientelas formadas.

Gracias a esta actividad tiene un ingreso considerado que le ayuda a contribuir en los gastos de la casa.  

Debido a la demanda que tiene necesita de capital para poder satisfacerlas por ello se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar el préstamo para la compra de remeras mangas largas, pantalones, camisas, zapatos.
texts.en:
Sra. María Alfonza is from the city of Carapeguá. She is the mother of school age children.

María Alfonza sells clothing, blankets, hammocks, and other items of different styles. She generates sales as a traveling vendor in the city of Itá, where she has established customers. Thanks to her business, she is able to earn a considerable income that goes toward her household expenses.

Due to demand, she is in need of capital so that she can satisfy her customers. She approached Fundación Paraguaya in order to request a loan to buy long-sleeved shirts, trousers, dress shirts, and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an assortment of clothing & shoes

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Janet M. le esta haciendo falta un cuarto, pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que le realizara la construcción. Ya que será la recamara de sus dos pequeños hijas, para que tengan su espacio en la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe como guardia de seguridad de un centro comercial.
texts.en:
Janet M.’s house needs a room, but she does not have the necessary money. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy the material and pay for the labor for the construction. It will be a bedroom for her two small daughters. Then they will have their space in the house. She plans on repaying the loan with the salary she gets as a security guard in a commercial center.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand the lower floor

loans.name: Bunnak

texts.en:
Mr. Bunnak N. (pictured here), age 32 and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Morn, age 28, have been married only since 2009 and have no children yet. The couple lives in a village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. 

Bunnak has been driving a motor remorque taxi for five years. He drives goods and people from his village to Chbar Ampov market, located in Phnom Penh and back. (A remorque is a motorbike connected to a trailer.) Mrs. Sophoin Morn has been a garment factory worker for eight years. 

Bunnak is asking for his first loan in the amount of US$ 500 to renovate the house where he lives.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en: The five people of this group loan live I. Chrey Tnoat village I. Takeo province. Mrs. Horn T. is a 54-year-old widow and the leader of this group loan having beE. selected by its members. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different businesses. The leader Mrs. Horn T. is a rice farmer who works very hard to support her two childrE. who are students I. the local school. She is also tailor, which helps earns a small profit to increase her income. She requests a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia F. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 41 years old and is married with four school-aged children.

Lucia's main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport services or habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). Lucia has been engaged in her business for over seven years.

Lucia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be her first from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save for an additional motorcycle.


About CEVI: 
Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.

CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle to provide better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, cinnamon, flour, cooking oil, firewood.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Kahovka. Ludmila sells women’s clothing in one of the local markets. Her business is the only source of income for her family. Ludmila has been in this trade for 18 years. Currently, she has 30,000 grivnyas (UAH) in working capital and her net profit amounts to 8,000 UAH.

Ludmila is very focused and balanced. Her hard work in combination with financial support has promoted the stable growth of her trade. Ludmila is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH to diversify her merchandise. A wide assortment of inventory and reasonable prices will attract many potential customers to her kiosk which will help her business to grow and expand in the future.

loans.use: To diversify assorted merchandise for resale

loans.name: Shamshibek

texts.en:
Shamshibek T. is a 60-year-old pensioner, who supports his family by means of cattle breeding. He worked as an engineer at an agro-technical company for 40 years and was known as a very steady and responsible person. Unfortunately, pensions in rural areas are low and people need to find an additional means of subsistence to live on. For this reason, Shamshibek’s family decided to engage in cattle breeding. 

As Shamshibek was born into a farmer’s family and had wide experience in animal breeding, he started this activity with great enthusiasm. He used his initial capital of only 5,000 soms (KGS) to buy cattle and managed to increase the number. Also, Shamshibek began to cultivate sunflowers and perennial herbs which serve as concentration of forage for his cattle. With the revenue, Shamshibek gave a good education to his children which allowed them to successfully manage their lives. 

Now Shamshibek plans to use this loan of 80,000 KGS to buy more cattle for fattening and reselling. He wants to use the revenue from this loan to help his son buy his own house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Mrs. Sam T. is married to Mr. Ben Sor (in the photo with Sam), and they live in Si Sla village in Takeo province. Sam is the mother of six children; four are attending school, one is a driver, and the other is helping with their parents’ businesses. Sam is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land upon which she cultivates rice to sell to support her family, while her husband is a fisherman and farm laborer.

Sam has a problem in that it is time to work her rice field, but she does not have enough money to do so. Sam is thus requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides, and hire farm laborers. With the remainder of the loan she wants to buy a bicycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer and pesticides, and hire farm laborers

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean N. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs and tea in a restaurant, and is requesting a loan to stock more food stuffs in the restaurant.  Jean is 28 years old and is married to a businessman. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more food stuffs in the restaurant.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza D. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Lorenza is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lorenza owns & operates a general retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Lorenza is just starting this business.

In 2008, Lorenza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorenza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lorenza is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lorenza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chu's Group

texts.en:
H. Chu Thị, age 50, is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đức Lân nhóm (Nhóm 04).

H. lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She and her husband have three grown children. She raises chickens for a living. H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2016.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase chicks to raise and sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND, which will be used to purchase chicken feed and other supplies. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.
  
About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
  
1.  Trần Thị B., age 35, is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, making and selling food.
 
2.  Đặng Thị D., age 44, is requesting a 2.016.000 VND loan to support her tailoring business.

3.  Tô Thị T., age 46, is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.
 
About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

----
  
H. Chu Thị (20213050025) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đức Lân nhóm  (Nhóm 04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2,016 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị B. (0) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  Đặng Thị D. (0) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


3.  Tô Thị T. (0) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed and other supplies

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna G. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 27 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Donna wants to improve her business and earn a better income for her family.

Donna joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) that will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Alexis Ivan

texts.es:
Alexis es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en la localidad de Pacanguilla, una zona ubicada en el distrito de Pacanga, provincia de Chepén, región La Libertad. Una zona agrícola situada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace más de dos años a la crianza y venta de animales menores. El cría sus animales en diversos ambientes situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona con frecuencia y al público en general. La actividad es la más importante fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta por lo que trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

Alexis desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para poder satisfacer la demanda que se suele incrementar por temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Alexis is 34 years old and head of household; he lives with his family in the town of Pacanguilla which is an area located in the district of Pacanga, a province of Chepén, and a region in La Libertad.  He has been raising and selling small animals for more than 2 years.  He raises his animals in diverse environments in the back of his residence and when the animals have reached a good level of development he sells them to merchants who frequent the area and to the general public.  This activity is the most important source of income that he counts on, which is why he tries to maintain it as best as possible.  Alexis wishes to purchase more animals and balanced feed to be able to meet the demand that tends to increase during Christmas time.  This is why he has deemed it convenient to solicit Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 2000 ($725 USD) nuevos soles.

loans.use: Purchase animals and balanced feed to expand his business of raising and selling livestock.

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en: Ndunge is a 37-year-old lady who sells clothes.  She started this business seventeen years ago.  She is blessed with four children who are in school.  Therefore, she works hard in her business so she can provide for her family.  Ndunge hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business in the future.  With the loan of 50,000 Kes, she will buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: El Valle Renace Group

texts.es:
Mercedes Lisethe,  tiene 30 años D. edad, tiene dos pequeños hijos. Ella es integrante del grupo “El Valle Renace”, formado por 11 personas, entusiasta y trabajadoras redientes del distrito D. Carabayllo.

Mercedes se dedica a la venta D. diversos productos, ya sean comestibles como quesos, trucha y otros, como también a la venta D. prendas D. vestir y accesorios a pedido. Inició con la venta D. productos golosinarios D. forma ambulatoria, poco a poco fue invirtiendo y tratando D. ofrecer y contar con los productos que le solicitaban.
Una D. sus metas y motivo por el cual se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo es poder cubrir los gastos D. estudios D. sus hijos para ofrecerles la oportunidad D. tener una profesión.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en compra D. mercadería y cubrir pedido D. quesos.
texts.en:
Mercedes Liseth, age 30, has two small children.  She is a member of the “El Valle Renace” (The Valley Is Reborn) Communal Bank.  It is comprised of 11 people who are enthusiastic and hard-working residents of the Carabayllo district.

Mercedes sells diverse products.  She sells food like cheese and trout.  She also sells clothing and accessories by order.  She started by selling sweets in an itinerant manner.  Little by little she was investing and trying to have and sell the products that were requested. 

One of her goals and the motivation for her hard work is to be able to cover her children’s educational expenses.  She wants to give them the opportunity to have a profession.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise and to cover cheese orders.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare special food for the end of the year festivities

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y un hijo de 18 años de edad, residen en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, es empleado desde hace 18 años como motorista del ministerio de Trabajo.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para los gastos educativos de su hijo que actualmente estudia educación media, ya que el salario no cubre todas las necesidades, pues solamente él trabaja para mantener los gastos de la casa.
Su proyección es continuar trabajando, cancelar puntualmente el préstamo y ayudar a su hijo hasta que este finalice una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is 42 years old and lives in San Miguel with his wife and 18 year old son.  For the past 18 years, he's been working as a driver with the Work Ministry.  He is asking for a loan so that he can pay his son's tuition.  At the moment he is only a part time student because his salary does not cover all the needs.  He only works to maintain the household.

He expects to continue working, repay the loan on time, and help his son until he finalizes his professional career.

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Dorjgotov

texts.en: Dorjgotov, 41, is married and lives with his wife and seven children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own on the outskirts of the city. Five of his children attend a local school and his wife helps him with his business. In 2005 he began making traditional Mongolian boots at home which he supplies to a local monastery. The cost to make a pair of boots is 47,150 MNT and he sells them for 75,000 MNT to the monastery. He makes seven boots every ten days and his monthly profit is between 300,000-400,000 MNT. He is a very hardworking and intelligent man who takes care of his large family. Dorjgotov says, "My wish is to raise my seven children as well-educated people with the hope that they will make a positive contribution to our country's prosperity in the future". He is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase the necessary materials for his boot manufacturing business since he has been receiving a large amount of orders.

loans.use: To purchase boot manufacturing materials

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de capitalizar su actividad y emprender actividades productivas, les resultó muy fructífero e interesante el programa por los beneficios brindados.
El comité lleva por nombre Tajy Poty, actualmente se encuentra en el quinto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 19 emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarles lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
La sra. Elva V. por ejemplo, es una vendedora de frutas y verduras, y ahora, como se inicia la temporada de otoño en nuestro país, necesita de mayores frutas cítricas para vender, por ello solicita el préstamo para poder abastecer su pequeño puesto de venta, y obtener más ganancias que favorezcan el ingreso económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Some women get together in the city of Paraguarí in order to capitalize their business activities.  Others do so in order to undertake productive activities.  From there they coordinate the meeting in order to familiarize themselves with the program.  This has turned out to be very fruitful and interesting because of the benefits that are offered by the program.

The Communal Bank is called Tajy Poty.  They are currently in their fifth cycle with an excellent rating.  The members are 19 enterprising women.  They give the best of themselves in order to increase their incomes.  They do this so that they can offer their respective families the best.  All of the members are tenacious, and they have invested their loans in their respective business activities.

Elva, for example, sells fruits and vegetables.  Now that the fall season is starting in our country, she needs more citrus fruits.  That is why she requests the loan in order to be able to stock her small sales stand.  She will get more earnings that will help her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits like citrus fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria 29 años y es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que busca el bienestar de su familia, ella trabaja en la chacra y haciendo las actividades del hogar, ella vive en la Comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco – Perú. En la comunidad de Chicon los pobladores se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura. Maria se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros pequeños animales que sirven para el consumo de la familia. Maria requiere el microcrédito para comprar animales y para comprar alimento para cuyes como pasto. 

Maria pertenece al banco comunal “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María, 29, is an enterprising, hard working woman seeking her family’s wellbeing. She works her fields and does her household chores.  She lives in the community of San Isidro de Chicón located 15 minutes from the city of Urubamba, Cusco, Perú.  Chicón’s residents are mostly farmers and raise livestock.  She raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and other small animals that are used for her family’s consumption.  María needs the microloan to buy animals and to buy feed, like grass, for the guinea pigs.

María is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicón” (San Isidro de Chicón’s Dynamic Ones) communal bank and she is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means; she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy animals and to buy guinea pig feed.

location.town: San Isidro de Chicon- Urubamba - Cusco

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes currently is in business selling in a retail shop. She is 40 years old and married to a businessman. They have seven children, only two of whom go to school. Agnes is requesting a loan to stock more retail goods to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more retail goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a  new sewing machine

loans.name: Yonis

texts.es:
Yonis, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, siembra maíz y frijol, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 4 años, él tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta labor, aprendió de sus padres y lo realiza todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, dependiendo de la temporada.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para el suelo, con esto espera realizar una buena siembra de maíz y frijol, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para cubrir el gasto y preparase para la temporada.
Su objetivo es trabajar por mucho tiempo, ya que de su trabajo depende su familia, por lo que su aspiración es el desarrollo económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Yonis lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel.  He is a farmer who cultivates corn and beans.  He lives with his wife and his 4 year-old son.  He has been doing this work for 8 years.  He learned how to farm from his parents, and he works every day from 6 am until 3pm, depending on the season.

He is requesting a loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and treatments for his soil; with these supplies he hopes to have a good harvest of corn and beans.  This loan will be a great help to him, allowing him to cover his expenses and prepare for the upcoming season.

His goal is to work for a long time, since his family depends on his work.  His goal is to create economic progress for his family.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, and other soil treatments

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: El Trebol Magico Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "EL TREBOL MAGICO", porque las integrantes dicen que el trébol es una hierba de pequeño tamaño que según las creencias trae buena suerte, que proporciona al que lo posee un poder especial: suerte en el comercio, en el amor y en la riqueza. ¡Suerte ilimitada!. El grupo esta ubicado en el Estado de Hidalgo, la señora Ana Paula O. tiene 26 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pollos desde hace 1 año y medio sus clientes comentan que la señora es muy amable y su pollo siempre esta fresco por esa razón la prefieren, tiene 1 hijo varón. El prestamo lo solicita para la compra de pollos y venderlos para el consumo de la gente y así crear un patrimonio para su hijo, ofrecerle una carrera profesional y una mejor calidad de vida, también desea apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares y ahorrar para su futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called "EL TREBOL MAGICO" (The Magic Clover) because its members say that the clover is a small plant that brings good luck and has a special power.  It brings luck in business, love, and wealth.  Unlimited luck!  The group is located in the State of Hidalgo.

Ana Paula O. is 26 years old and has been selling chickens for one year.  Her customers tell her that they prefer buying from her because she’s very friendly and her chicken is always fresh.  She has one son.

She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens to sell and in this way create a means for her son to establish a professional career and a better quality of life.  She also wants to help her husband with the family expenses and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy chickens for resale

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.en: Suhrobjon is married with three children. He sells food items. His grocery store is located in a very busy place, which is why there are always many customers who come to buy groceries from Suhrobjon. He is a hard worker and works long days to make sure his family has everything they need. Suhrobjon has been running this business for 15 years. Lending services from IMON International have promoted the expansion of his small venture. Suhrobjon’s business is the only source of income for his family. He realizes this responsibility and is doing his best to meet the needs of his family. Today he is requesting a loan of 12,000 Somoni to purchase a new refrigerator to keep the product he sells in his grocery store fresh. Suhrobjon is hoping that from the profit of his business, he can expand his grocery store. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule.
