It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator to keep the product he sells in his grocery store fresh.

loans.name: Aracely Guadalupe

texts.es:
Aracely, se dedica al destazo D. cerdos y venta D. queso, vive con su esposo y tienen dos hijos uno D. 15 años y el otro D. 18 años D. edad, el negocio D. ella lo aprendió a través D. su madre desD. hace 12 años, lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal y lo atienD. con un horario D. 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo porque necesita comprar cerdos y también queso para comercializar, con esta inversión Aracely contara con cerdos para continuar el destazo y con el queso igualmente, servirá mejor a los clientes.
Su objetivo es tener capacidad para atender a bastantes clientes, con suficiente productos   D. queso y carne D. cerdo, para abastecer la demanda.
texts.en:
Aracely lives with her husband and two children, ages 15 and 18.  She sells pork and cheese and has been learning her traD. from her mother for 12 years.  She has a stand in the muncipal market where she works from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and cheese.  With this investment, Aracely will have enough pigs to keep selling pork and enough cheese to keep serving her customers as best she can.

Her goal is to be able to sell to a considerable amount of customers, and having enough cheese and pork to supply the demand.

loans.use: To buy pigs and cheese.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago tiene  52 años, vive en su casa de habitación con su esposa.  Tiene 4 hijos y solamente 2 están bajo su cargo. Su actividad económica es la elaboración de pasteles y repostería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio esta actividad cuando no pudo seguir trabajando porque lo corrieron entonces decide iniciar esta actividad con su esposa. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para azúcar, harina, huevo, aceite, leña.
texts.en:
Santiago is 52 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. They have four children, but only two are still under their care. Santiago has a business making pastries and desserts. He has been in operation for more than 10 years. When he was not able to continue working, Santiago decided to start this business with his wife. He approached Fundación León 2000 so that he could make friends through the organization who could provide him the necessary support.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital for buying sugar, flour, eggs, oil, and firewood.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, eggs, oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married. She is now 31 years old and blessed with only one child. She is managing a small general store where she sells different grocery items like junk foods, soft drinks, candies, frozen foods and other daily used products. Rosemarie had this business for almost 3 years. 

Rosemarie is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to be used in purchasing additional items to sell like soft drinks, junk foods, candies and frozen foods. She usually earns about PHP 8,000 each month in this business.

In the future, Rosemarie hopes to strengthen her small business in order to supplement the income of her husband in financing the education of their daughter and to save funds for their future. She hopes that she can able to improve her small store through the continuous support and assistance of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soft drinks, junk food, candies, and frozen foods.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van, 54, is divorced and lives with her son in Ho Chi Minh City. She has raised her son with the income she has earned making and selling noodles. Van would like a loan to enable her to replace her old furniture with new furniture to attract more customers to her noodle stall. She also would like to use part of her loan to purchase better ingredients to enable her to produce better food for her customers. Van hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate more profit to support her son and save additional money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Stela

texts.en: Stela is 42 years old and lives in Ozamis City. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Stela has a business selling meals through her restaurant. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. Stela has requested a loan of PHP 25000 to purchase more ingredients for meals from her resaturant. Stela has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for meals from her restaurant.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es:
El señor Jose Andres es casado, tiene 27 años de edad, curso los tres años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos no estudian aun, se dedica a la artesanía, al tejidos de cortes típicos, inició este negocio gracias al apoyo de su familia y lleva hasta el momento 15 años de experiencia ya que inició desde muy joven, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica la realización de los oficios del hogar.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo, para la compra de hilo y poder así producir mas, espera que su negocio se exitoso y alcanza su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Andres, 27, studied only three years in elementary school.  He is married and has two young children who are not in school yet.  He is a craftsman and makes typical woven fabric.  He began his business thanks to support from his family and he now has 15 years of experience since he started very young.  His wife, who is a homemaker, helps him in the business.

He is requesting a loan to increase his working capital to buy thread so he can increase production.  He hopes the business will be successful so he can improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a natural medicines business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase medicines, powdered milk, etc. to sell. 

Roselyn has been in this business for four years. Roselyn earns additional income from fish vending and hog raising. 

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase medicines, powdered milk etc. to sell

loans.name: Gnek

texts.en:
Gnek, a 32-year-old father of three children, two of whom attend school, is married to a farmer who earns $3 per day. Gnek earns about $5 per day selling  souvenirs. Every month, he has to spend $66 on food, and $10 on other expenses. 

Now requesting a loan of $300 to buy more souvenirs to sell, Gnek hopes to increase his income and eventually buy a store to retail his goods.

loans.use: to buy more souvenirs to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Aida has a shop that buys and sells coconuts for copra.  She has had this business for 6 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts to sell.  Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Futuro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO FUTURO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Silvia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de dulces, comercio, servicios y producción.

La señora Silvia,  indica que este es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por recomendación de sus familiares. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces que viene trabajando desde hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de dulces) que comprara de la Ceja y lo venderá en su local de ventas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud y el crédito.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Edith, ya que se encontraba en el consultorio de salud
texts.en:
The A.C. “NUEVO FUTURO” will begin its first cycle as part of the Centro Focal Santiago II. It consists of 8 members and is lead by a board headed by Señora Silvia. The businesses the members of the communal bank are involved in are various among which are: candy sales, services and production.

Señora Silvia says that it is the first time that she works with Pro Mujer, having joined on the recommendation of relatives. She currently has a business selling candy which she has run for years. 

The loan she will now receive is to increase her capital to buy candy which she will purchase in La Ceja and sell in her shop. This kind of work allows her to generate income with which to support her family in any way possible, as she is married and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says that she likes the health benefits and the loans.

In the photo Señora Edith is not present as she was at the health clinic

loans.use: to buy candy.

loans.name: Floramil

texts.en:
Floramil is 37 years old and widowed with three children. With two of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Floramil runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Floramil would like to save enough for her to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and is married with eight children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, snack foods, etc. to sell in her store.

Arlene has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from e-loading (sending mobile phone credits).

Arlene aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, snack foods, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 30 years-old and married to Tom.  The are blessed with two children.  She operates a butcher shop in the area of Tala. She has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of KES.12,000 per month.

Serah is applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from Kiva partner KADET LTD. With the loan, she plans to purchase more meat to sell and make soup.  She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children.

Serah hopes to have a self driven business. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell and make soup.

loans.name: Cat

texts.en:
Cat is a 56-year-old man who is married and has one daughter. His wife helps to support the family by selling bread every day in the local community. Cat and his family live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Cat runs a store in front of his door. He sells coffee, beverages and a variety of fruit juices. Cat would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to stock his store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income to help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks to stock his store.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac has operated his timber sales business in Olkalau town for the last three years. He is 39 years old, married to Esther, and they have three school going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy old trees and cut them into timber for sale and also for labor purposes.

In the future, Isaac hopes to acquire a lorry and offer transportation services and make more income, thereby improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy old trees and cut them into timber for sale and also for labor purposes.

loans.name: Su

texts.en: Su is 54 years old and has three married children. She grows rice and has been raising chickens for three years, earning a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. Su has participated in SEDA since 2008 and is a member of the An Tap cluster. For her last loan, Su borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for the chickens she raises.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Lee Ray

texts.en:
Lee Ray started his landscaping company in 1993, growing through local and state contracts. His services include lawn maintenance and snow removal. Lee Ray and his five employees serve the people around his neighborhood, mostly consisting of senior citizens. To him, these are the most important clients because he enjoys serving them. One of the biggest challenges for the business has been keeping up with payroll during this tough economic time when people are pulling back on spending. One day, Lee Ray wants to be a distributor and expand into selling lawn equipment, salt, etc, out of his own storefront.

This loan from Accion USA will help Lee Ray purchase a special type of snow plow and eco-friendly salt product for the upcoming winter season. Winter is Lee Ray’s busiest time of year because snow removal services are so demanding.


This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps and ACCION USA. Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit.

loans.use: To purchase a snow plow and eco-friendly salt.

loans.name: Armindo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta Escola. Fez o nivel primario e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.

É comerciante e dono do seu negocio ha mais de 5 anos, vende produtos de 1ª necessidade onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 30.000.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimo no TCHUMA uma cooperativa de microcreditos e pagou sem dificuldades, mais tarde conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, tomate, arroz, massas, farinha, sardinhas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial e concluir a sua casa, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Armindo was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has three children; one of the children goes to school. Armindo finished elementary school and did not continue because his parents could not afford it. He lives in his own house with his family and supports two relatives [nieces or nephews] who live with him.

He has had his own business for more than five years. Armindo sells staple goods and earns about 30,000 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

He had a loan before at Tchuma, a microcredit cooperative, and paid it back without any trouble. Later he learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Armindo's third Hluvuku loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais so he can buy products (fish, tomatoes, rice, pasta, flour, sardines and other items) to increase his inventory. The previous loans were for 10,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais; both were for the same purpose.

He promises to make his payments on time. Armindo wants to expand his business and finish building his house one day. To do these things, he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (fish, tomatoes, rice, pasta, flour, sardines, etc.).

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, necesita seguir mejorando en su negocio  y solicita otro préstamo con la intención de incrementar en variedad y comprar productos de la canasta básica como: aceite, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, embutidos y huevos,  para mejorar  su inventario y ventas.
Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque logro vender productos nuevos y mejoro mucho la atención de los clientes y las condiciones de vida de su familia mejoraron.
texts.en: María needs to continue improving her business and is asking for another loan to increase variety and buy staple items like: oil, sugar, rice, beans, cured meats and eggs to improve her inventory and sales.  Her previous loans helped her because she managed to sell new products and improve customer service very much; her family’s living conditions improved too.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Saidamir

texts.en:
Saidamir is married and has 3 children to whom he has always wanted to provide a good quality of life. It’s for this reason that 1 years ago he began his own driving business. Some years ago he went to Russia and worked there. He returned to his native town and bought a car of mark BMW for his business. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving, and now his children are able to get good meals. 

Saidamir is asking for a loan of 2000 USD to buy a car for developing his business. He is going to rent out his new car. In this way, his business will have the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income, which will allow him to offer his children and wife a better quality of life and better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Willington

texts.en: Willington is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children, two and four years old. He describes himself as experienced and determined. He operates a retail store where he sells household goods. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an environment that is conducive for his business. He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add to his stock of household goods. This is his second loan from SMEP DTM. His previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to add to his stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a hardworking woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Justine has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a cow for milk production and meat, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and provide basic needs. Justine hopes that in the future, she will be able to return to school and become a doctor. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production and meat.

loans.name: Fernan

texts.en: Fernan, who is 33 years old, is a single entrepreneur from Palayan,Aloran ,Misamis Occidental. He makes a living by operating a transportation business, which he started 5 years ago. He now earns an income of 7,000 PHP a month to sustained their life sytle and to support his parents daily needs. To improve his business, Fernan is borrowing 25,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy motor parts for maintenance of their motor and to pay for the permit for running the business. He joined GDMPC in 2013, and Fernan hopes to expand his business and  to save money for his future.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for maintenance of my motor

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
I sell prepared food in the San Juan market. In the San Juan market, fruits and vegetables are in abundance watermelons and canteloupes are available as well as pineapple, strawberries, blackberries, and papaya. I sell prepared food which includes meat and many of these fruits and vegetables

My work plan is to start offering a greater variety of dishes to my customers. They have been asking me to expand my menu. I will use the loan to purchase in larger quantities many new ingredients.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Noe Arturo

texts.en:
My name is Noe M. and I sell daily consumer products. I have had my business for 4 years and I have a good clientel because I sell high quality goods at low prices. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to expand my inventory in order to have higher sales. With the additional earnings I will be able to remodel my business(doubles as home) and to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Noe M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que ofrezco buena calidad en mis productos y un muy buen precio, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con la ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa de habitacion) y mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase churros, drinks, white and sweet bread, soups, powdered drinks, salsas, mustard, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, toothpaste, batteries, cookies, condiments, sweets, milk, eggs, oil, butter, corn, flour, sugar, salt, sausages, juices,cheese, beans, tortillas, pastes, bottled water.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura is a mother of 3 children. She is new in business and has only 1 year of experience. Previously, she was a housewife and was at home with the children. Now her children are old enough to go to school, and the youngest is in kindergarten.  Her husband is very supportive; he is the one who gave her the initial capital to start her business.  For now, the goods that she sells are brought by wholesalers. In the future, when the turnover of her business is large enough, she will be traveling to wholesale markets to purchase goods herself. She will use the loan for goods for the coming season.

loans.use: New season goods

loans.name: Djavid

texts.en:
Djavid  was born in 1980 in Salyan region, Gardili village. He is single. He has been in this business for 3 years. He wants to improve his cattle breeding and get good income from it.  At the beginning of his business he bought 2 calves to raise for slaughter. Then he decided to raise cows as well.
Now he is applying for a loan of $950 to buy a pregnant cow to increase the number of his cows.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en: Jariatu J. is thirty-one years old.  She is married with three children.  Jariatu runs a small store selling food items and is assisted by her children.  Her husband is unemployed and cannot take care of the family's expenses.  The income generated from Jariatu’s business is therefore crucial.  With a larger second loan, she will be able to expand her business and save for the children’s future. Jariatu demonstrates a high sense of responsibility.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for her grocery store

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Đinh Thị Tuyết is 41 years old. She runs a restaurant near the University (pedagogy). Most of her clientele are university students. Everyday her restaurant serves about 400 customers. With such a high volume of sales, her husband and their 2 children help running the place. She also hires 3 employees. Despite the hard work, the profit is pretty good. Every month, Ms Tuyết brings home 400 USD after expenses. Not only this business helps securing her family financial, it also provides stable work for her family members and others as well. Recently, she had expanded her business into room renting for students. She has 20 rooms for rent to satisfy the needs of the university students. She is requesting a loan of 575 USD to stock up her food stand and invest more in her room renting business

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Đinh Thị Tuyết, 41 tuổi, bán hàng ăn được gần 10 năm. Ở gần trường Đại học sư phạm 2, khách hàng của chị phần lớn là sinh viên. Mỗi ngày cửa hàng đón tiếp khoảng 400 khách. Với một lượng khách đông đảo như vậy, ngoài sự phụ giúp của chồng và hai con, chị Tuyết còn thuê thêm 3 nhân công bên ngoài. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng hiệu quả kinh tế mang lại rất cao. Trừ chi phí cho thực phẩm và công lao động, hàng tháng chị Tuyết thu về khoảng 400 USD. Việc bán hàng ăn không những giúp gia đình có thu nhập cao mà còn tạo việc làm cho mọi người trong gia đình. Gần đây chị mới xây 20 phòng trọ cho những sinh viên có nhu cầu đến thuê. Chị đang làm đơn xin vay 575 USD để mua thực phẩm làm thức ăn, bổ sung cho số vốn kinh doanh vừa dùng đầu tư cho việc xây phòng trọ.

loans.use: buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery is 48 years old, married, with 3 children. He is the owner of a mechanic shop and in addition he buys and sells cars. He has been doing this for over 10 years and states that this is an industry with quite a bit of movement, for on the vehicles that he buys he makes small repairs and then resells them for a good profit.

He is asking for a loan to purchase car parts and accessories. For the next year he hopes to incorporate motorbikes in his sales, as this year the production and sales of motorbikes has increased substantially.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Nery tiene 48 años está casado y tiene 3 hijos, el es propietario de un taller mecánico y además como actividad adicional tiene la de comprar y vender automóviles. Se dedica a ésta actividad hace más de 10 años y afirma que es un rubro que tiene bastante movimiento, ya que los vehículos que compra él les realiza pequeños arreglos y posteriormente los vuelve obteniendo un buen margen de ganancias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos y accesorios para vehículos. Para el año que viene desea incorporar a sus ventas, las motocicletas, ya que este año ha crecido bastante la producción y ventas de las mismas.

loans.use: Purchase car parts and accessories

loans.name: Elizabeth De

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a married 50-year old woman; she has two grown children who support themselves. Elizabeth's business involves the sale of orange juice, carrot juice, pastries, sandwiches, etc. All of these products are found at her own stand located near the university Mayor de San Simon. She also has a kiosk in front of the Viedma hospital. Her experience spans 128 months at this location, which is very popular by all of the students that attend both places. Although the competition is quite high, her experience and her attention to quality and hygiene are key factors. With the money from this current loan, she would buy carrots for Bs. 70 per bag, bananas for Bs. 50, as well as other fruit like strawberries, papaya, and other bottled soda. Elizabeth has a prior loan with us with very good history.

Translated from Spanish by Mindy Burns, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth es un señora casada de 50 años de edad, tiene dos hijos que son mayores de edad y los mismos se solventan solos. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de jugos de naranja, zumos de zanahoria, empanadas, sandwichs, etc. Todos estos productos en su puesto propio que se encuentra ubicado cerca de la Universidad Mayor de San Simón, también cuenta con un kiosko frente al Hospital Viedma. Cuenta con una experiencia de 128 meses en este rubro por lo que es bastante conocida por todos los estudiantes que asisten en ambos lugares. Si bien la competencia es bastante elevada su antiguedad y su calidad de atención e higiene son factores clave. Con el dinero de la presente solicitud comprará zanahoria por un valor de Bs. 70.- el saquillo, platano por un valor de Bs. 50.-, también otras frutas como fresas papayas y así también otros refrescos en botella. Elizabeth tiene un crédito anterior con nosotros con un muy buen comportamiento.

loans.use: Additional kiosk/ fruit stand use

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. R. has a business selling jewelry, watches, and lingerie in the neighborhood of Juanjuicillio outside the jungle city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She started the business one year ago so she could help take charge of her life and gain some independence from her family. She sells her products door to door which can be difficult but she enjoys the challenge. Mary is charismatic, ambitious, and always treats her clients with the best service. She gets her goods directly from Lima so she can offer a cheaper price and has a weekly credit payment option for her clients.

Mary is twenty five years old, single, and doesn’t have any children.  Mary lives with her mother and works, saves, and dreams of a better life.  She is currently building her business and saving money so she can return to school to study Environmental Policy in Lima.  She is much happier because she has more friends and a voice in the community.

A member of the community bank Maria Magdelena, Mary is requesting a loan of $250 to repay over the next four months.  With the loan she would like to buy lingerie of different sizes and colors.

loans.use: To buy lingerie of different sizes and colors

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Mrs. L. Hou and her husband have been married since 1972. They have ten children, six sons and four daughters. Four of their children are full time workers, and the other six study in a local school. Hou has been in the business of weaving silk and fishing since 1970. Meanwhile, for over twenty years, her husband has worked as a fisherman and wooden-house repairer. Hou and her family live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Both husband and wife hope that their business will be able to support the family and will enable their children afford to study in as high a school level as possible.      
Hou is requesting a loan in the amount of $1100 from MAXIMA to repair her house. This will be her fifth loan.

loans.use: For House Repair

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 21-year-old Eva C.. She is married, and has one child, age 2. In 2007, Eva established her fabric business. Eva requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of fabric in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Saudina

texts.en:
Saudina was born in 1976 and she is married. Her husband is a seasonal construction worker and his monthly salary is 600.00KM. In the period when her husband is not employed, Saudina works as a cleaning woman. They get additional income from grandmother and from the bureau. The K. family has two children, ages 10 and 6.

Saudina wants to use this loan in the amount of 1200.00KM for buying cattle, in order to expand the cattle herd and increase her business.

loans.use: For buying cattle.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Señora Juana lives in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department, and belongs to the Damas del Oriente Comunal Bank. She is 58 years old and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a merchant, and when Juana received her first loan of 300 Soles from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in a clothing business. Now she sells a variety of products. She gets up every morning at 7am to make breakfast for her husband and children, and then works delivering and collecting payment for her products until 6pm. With a loan of 1,000 Soles Juana will buy: skirts, blouses, undergarments, pants, shirts, etc. She’ll pay back the loan in 4 months. Juana would like to get ahead and to see her business succeed so that she can support her family. Juana is happy to consider herself an independent woman as a result of her successful business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Damas del Oriente, ubicado en el Mercado No 2 sección ropas del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, es así que Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de ropas. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de mercadería, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a la entrega y cobranza de su mercadería a sus clientes hasta las 6 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: faldas, blusas, prendas interiores, pantalones, camisas, etc. Juana posee muchas ganas de salir adelante y de seguir surgiendo en la vida para poder apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar pues esta contenta por que se siente una mujer independiente en cuanto a su negocio se refiere.

loans.use: Juana will use the loan to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Mr. Muth C. is a villager in Roka Tong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He has a rice plantation. Mr. Muth C.’s rice field is now infertile, so Mr. Muth C. is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizers to support his field. His wife, Mrs. Sophe Pach, is also a farmer. Mr. Muth C. is 46 and the father of four children, two of whom are subsistence farmers while one other is attending school. The remaining one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to support his field.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru:
Muhiddin B. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 48 years old, married and has two children. He is retired and practices animal husbandry. He owns a few sheep and goats. Currently, Muhiddin is planning to purchase a bull to raise and subsequently sell. He wants to obtain the loan for this purchase. He would like to then use the profit from selling the bull to buy a cow and grow his business. Muhiddin will be able to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобоев Мухиддин житель города Турсун-заде. Возраст 48 лет. Женат ,имеет двоих детей. Пенсионер . Занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где имеет несколько овец и коз. В данный момент планирует купить бычка для откормки и последующей перепродажи. Для этого он хочет получить кредит . Купив , молодого бычка и откормив его он сможет выгодно продать его и купить корову. Таким образом его дело будет развиваться . Погасить кредит он сможет в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina is 45 years old. She is divorced with one child who is 30 years old. She has been a bread seller since 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $30 from her sales.

Zaina now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her bread-selling business

loans.name: Oimhol

texts.ru: Солихова Оимхол жительница города Нурек.Возраст 36 лет, разведенна, имеет 2 детей. Клиентка торгует на центральном рынке города Нурек.Она имеет небольшую торговуюТоргует в основном детской одеждой.Привозит товар с города Душанбе.Оимхол одна растит своих детей. Бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. В данный моменнт клиентка хочет закупить сезонную одежду.Поэтому решила взять кредит свроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Oimhol S. resides in the town of Nurek. 36-years-old, she is divorced and has two children. She has a small stall at the Nurek central town market where she deals primarily in children’s clothing, which she brings from the city of Dushanbe. Oimhol is raising her children alone, and the business is the sole source of income for her family. At present, Oimhol would like to purchase seasonal clothing, so she has decided to take out a 10-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly S., 38, is married and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a motor-taxi driver and makes US$10 each day, while his wife has a business selling rice, typically making US$5 per day to support their family. This couple has two young children. Ly S. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase rice stock. (His wife is pictured.)

loans.use: Ly would like to purchase rice stock.

loans.name: Danaya (La Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Constituée exclusivement de femmes mariées, les membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 20 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles nucléaires dans la sous- préfecture de Fana (deuxième région administrative de Mali). Danaya fait des activités diverses et variées qui va de la fabrication de boissons non alcoolisées à partir de jus en poudre et des plantes locales, à l’achat et la vente de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique), de tapis etc.
Pour préparer le jus de zinzimbre, elles écrasent le zinzimbre pour la rendre pâteux.  Pour 2 (deux) kilogramme de pâte de zinzimbre on ajoute 10 (dix) litres d’eau, 5 kilos de sucre et des aromes pour bien les malaxer. Après on filtre le mélange à l’aide d’un tamis filtre pour le mettre dans des sachets qui seront mis au frais dans un réfrigérateur avant la vente proprement dite.
Dans le souci d’agrandir la taille de leurs activités, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire).  Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce présent prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 tapis de quatre (4) mettre carré et 50 pièces de pagnes wax,  200 kg de sucre, 50kg de dah, 50kg de zinzimbre, des colorants et des sachets plastiques. 
Les membres du groupe Danaya qui font la vente de pagnes wax et de tapis s’approvisionnent dans le marché de Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso). Ces pagnes wax (préablement découpés en trois pagnes) sont vendus ainsi que le tapis au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement. Quant aux fabricantes de boissons non alcoolisées, elles se ravitaillent dans le marché de Fana et vendent dans le même marché en détail au comptant à une clientèle généralement composée de femmes, de forains et d’enfants Elles comptent réaliser chacune 25000 FCFA de bénéfice par cycle qui servira à aider les maris à supporter les charges scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The married women who make up the Danaya group have an average age of 20 years and two children. They live in nuclear families in the Fana sous-prefecture (second administrative region of Mali). The Danaya group participates in diverse activities, from the production of non-alcoholic beverages and powdered juice, and the selling of local plants to the purchase and selling of pagne wax (a highly-prized fabric in Africa), as well as rugs. To prepare ginger juice, they crush the ginger into a paste. For two kilograms of ginger paste, 10 litres of water, 5 kilograms of sugar, and flavoring are added. Afterwards the mixture is filtered with a sieve and then put into packets which will be placed into a refrigerator before they are sold. Wanting to increase the size of their business, the women have decided to collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program with which they are on their fifth group (or solidarity) loan. All of their previous loans were repaid in full. The current loan will be used to purchase 20 rugs measuring four square meters each and 50 pieces of pagne wax, 200 kilograms of sugar, 50 kilograms of dah (dried hibiscus leaves), 50 kilograms of ginger, colorings, and plastic packets. The members of the Danaya group who sell the pagne wax and the rugs get their stock at the Bobo Dioulasso market (in Burkina Faso). These pagne wax (precut into three pieces) as well as the rugs are sold for cash and on credit with monthly payments. As for the makers of the non-alcoholic beverages, they stock up at the Fana market and sell their products at the same market at retail prices for cash to a client base comprised mainly of women, stallkeepers, and children. They each hope to make 25,000 FCFA in profit per cycle (which is an average of four weeks) which will be used to help their husbands pay for their children’s educational expenses.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pagne wax, rugs, and ingredients to make non-alcoholic beverages (from sugar, powdered juice, ginger, dah packets, flavorings, etc)

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda se dedica a la elaboración de masitas y las vende en las tiendas. También trabaja como empleada domestica y tiene una hija que le ayuda en su negocio.
Esta separada de su esposo por lo cual la actividad de masitas le ayuda de gran manera ya que cubren sus gastos familiares.
Vive en la zona de alto sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, en la casa de sus padres.
Es la Octava vez que solicita un crédito, es cliente con categoria 1 debido a un excelente comportamiento en el cumplimiento de sus cuotas.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de insumos ( harina, manteca, levadura, y huevo) para su negocio de repostería.
texts.en:
Nilda works making pastries which she sells in local stores. She also works as a maid; she has a daugther who helps her in her work. She is separated from her husband which makes her job making pastries all the more important in order to cover her household expenses. She lives in La Paz in the Alto Sopocachi neighborhood in her parents' home. This is the eighth time she has requested a loan and she is a Category 1 customer due to her excellent record of on-time payments. The loan will be used to purchase ingredients for her pastries such as flour, shortening, yeast, and eggs.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, shortening, yeast, and eggs for her pastry business

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 29 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Wissam has been in the car body repair business for many years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business. Wissam has been a micro-credit client for four years now and has always paid on time.
The loans have influenced his life in a good way. When he first started he faced some difficulties such as not having enough clients and his clients not paying on time. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He decided on doing this business because he started learning it once he left school. That’s why he has a lot of experience. In the future, he plans to expand his business and have more clients.

loans.use: Wissam needs the loan to purchase merchandise for his body shop.

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeung S. is a villager in Roka village in Kandal province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store in the village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for her business. 

Her husband, Mr. Mon Sam Ath, is a construction worker. Mrs. Oeung S. has seven children. One child is a construction worker, two other stay at home to do housework, two attend the local school, and the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her business.

loans.name: Bébégnon

texts.fr: V. bébégnon est un coiffeur dans le quartier de tokoin cassanblanca à lomé, il voudrait associé à son commerce la vente des articles de fripperie et ouvrir un autre atelier, pour cela il sollicite un crédit de 500000f, il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages. il est célibataire sans enfants avec son surplus de revenu, il arrive à aider les membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bébégnon V. is a barber in the Tokoin Cassanblanca district in Lomé. He would like to include with his business the sale of used clothing, sheets, towels, and the like. He would also like to open another shop. To do so, he’s requesting a loan of 500,000 francs. He has never been the recipient of a loan from WAGES. He is unmarried and has no children. With his extra income, he manages to help his family members.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For opening another shop and for used clothing
